1.content:
You lay back in your chair on the deck of the ship. You bask in the warm sun, in your swim trunks and Hawian shirt. You sure were lucky that you won that sweepstakes back home. The one that got you this vacation. The sea is a crystal blue, the sun is shining, the fish are jumping, the clouds are thundering.......Wait, clouds?

You open your eyes and see some dark clouds on the horizon to the west. You can hear their booming thunder from here. You lay back in your chair, not worrying about it. It'll probably pass right over you, you think.

KATHOOM!

Lightning flashes through the sky, as rain pounds on the ships deck. You were caught unaware by the storm, and try desperatley to get to your cabin. You run across the deck, slipping on the rain soaked surface. You are drenched, it'll take you weeks to get dry again. The storm churns the sea, waves rock the ship back and forth.

You crawl across the deck on your belly, trying to get back to your feet. Suddenly, a massive wave rams into the side of the ship, splashing over the deck, sweeping you away with it, across the deck, into the sea.

The waves toss you around through the water like a rag doll. You open your mouth to yell for help, but it is filled with salty water. There is no hope for you now. Your vision begins to fade, as you sink below the waves. You stare at the rippling surface of the water as everything goes black.

Suddenly, you can breathe again! You open your eyes. You're laying face down on an island beach. You lift your face out of the sand, staring at your surroundings. You have no idea where you could be. You didn't even know there were any islands nearby. On the edge of the beach is a thick jungle.

You wobbly get onto your feet and trudge across the beach, still soaking wet. The jungle is lush and humid, with many different animal calls sounding in the distance. You make your way through the jungle, pushing branches and brush aside.

Suddenly, as you step on a pile of palm leaves,you hear a loud cracking sound, as the leaves crumble beneath you, and you fall into a pit. Spilntered bamboo and leaves lay all around you as you look up to the top. The pit is at least ten feet deep, and there is nothing you can use as footholds to climb out.

You sit at the bottom of the pit for over an hour, hoping someone comes and finds you. Then you hear voices. "Hey! We caught something!" Staring down at you, is the strangest creature you've ever seen. It is at least ten feet tall, and appears to be female. It was dressed in a a grass skirt, and a leather bra. But the strangest thing, was that it appeared to be a skunk! Or at least, a skunk with a humanoid body.

Another one of the creatures appeared beside it, this one was a fox. They both carried long spears, with golden spearheads. "What is it?" The fox asked to the skunk. "Whatever it is, it isn't one of us. Therefore, we should take it to our ruler, and let her decide what to do with it." The skunk reaches down and grabs you by the wrist. She single handedly pulls you out of the hole.

They tie a think vine around your wrists, and pull you along with them. You forcefully follow them through the jungle, dreading what might become of you. Suddenly, the jungle breaks, opening into an Aztec-like city. They continue to drag you though the city streets, which are populated by more of these anthro beings, who stare at you, as though they're never seen a human before.

They bring you to the steps of an enormous, grand palace, big enough to be a city on it's own. They drag you inside, to an elaborate throne room. They force you onto your knees, facing the floor. "My empress." Says the skunk. "We captured this man in the jungle. What shall we do with him?"

"Bring him to me." You hear another voice say. You are forcefully shoved towards the massive throne. You stumble as you gaze up at the biggest thing you've ever seen. It's another anthro, at least three football fields high!

But, what anthro is it?
1.title: The Island

11.content:
There, on an enormous marble throne, sat a giant female fox. She was dressed in a long white silk skirt that went down to her ankles, a white top with gold lining, and a gold tiara on her head, that went well with her red hair that went down to her shoulders.

"Come here." She said. Her voice sounded gentle, but you weren't sure you could trust her. You timidly took a step toward her. She reached down with one huge,black furred hand and picked you up between her fingers. You legs ran in the air as you were lifted off the floor, and dropped into her palm.

You turned to see two giant blue eyes staring at you. "What is your name?" She asked. "J....j......Jake." You stutter. "Don't be afraid." She said kindly. "I won't hurt you. Now, how did you get here?"

You tell here your story, wondering what will become of you when you are done. She listens intently, then pauses after you finish, deep in thought. "Let me fill you in." She says. "You are on the island of Anthromia. I am their ruler, Mihal. We have long been hidden from your kind, and we want to keep it that way. So, I'm afraid we can't let you leave."

"What!?" You exclaim. "Now now, don't fret." She says. "While your here, you'll be my guest. Don't worry, me and my servants will take good care of you." She places your on her shoulder and gets up from her throne. You keep you balance by holding on to the fur on her neck. Now you see why this palace is so huge! Her head nearly touches the ceiling!

As she walks through the halls of her palace. "Your lucky you got here when you did." She says. "Your just in time to join me for......."
11.title: Mihal, the kindly vixen

choices: Peaceful. If their queen trusts him, then they will too.
Hostile. They don't like the idea of allowing an outsider into their village.
Indifferent. They don't care about him right now, they just want to feast.
111.content:
"Annual feast?"

"Yes Jake, it's a tradition among our kind. You see, every month we each set aside a small portion of whatever food we've harvested. By the end of the year, this pool of food will have grown into a grand feast. It's our way of celebrating another year of hard work. And luckily for you, you've arrived just in time to take part in it!"

"So you're inviting me to be a part of your special tradition?"

"Of course! Like I said, you shall be our guest here from now on! It's only fair that you get to experience everything that our kind has to offer."

"Really? Well, thank you very much Your Majesty."

"Oh, there is no need for such formalities Jake. Please, just call me Mihal!"

"Alright then, Mihal. I'd be honored to join you for your feast."

You then smile at the 200 foot tall vixen with great joy. Mihal simply giggles.

"Oh Jake, you're so cute. I think that I might really enjoy having you around."

Mihal then begins walking. Finally, you and the massive fox queen arrive in an enormous banquet hall. There is are several tables lined up in the room that seemed to be around twice as big as a normal, human sized table, but these were all still dwarfed by Mihal's massive stature nonetheless. There was then one massive table that seemed to be designed for her. Your eyes then focused on an incredible sight: In the center of the room, an enormous pile of various fruits, vegetables, meats, and other foods was gathered on a tray the size of a baseball field! There was so much food piled on the tray that the stack came all the way up to Mihal's waist! It may have only been half her size, but staring at a 100 foot tall pile of food was an amazing sight to say the least.

Suddenly, you hear the sound of a gong being rung. Like clockwork, the entire banquet hall was quickly flooded by at least 100 different anthro girls! Mihal then spoke out.

"Greetings and congratulations, girls, for another successful year of hard work! You should all be very proud of yourselves for what you have done. May our village continue to prosper in everlasting peace!"

The various amazons around the room let out cheers as their ruler finished her speech.

"Now girls, before we begin our feast, I have one more announcement to make."

The cheers turned to confused murmurs, as the girls didn't have any idea what could be on their queen's mind.

"You see, we have a new guest here on our island."

Mihal plucks you from her shoulder and sets you down amongst the other villagers before continuing.

"His name is Jake, and he will be staying with us from now on. I expect that you shall all treat our guest with the utmost respect. As far as I'm concerned, he's one of us now. Please try to show him the ropes and aid his integration into our society... That will be all."

The amazons glance around at each other in confusion once more before all resting their eyes on Jake. Their attitude toward him is...
111.title: A feast with the fox

112.content:
"Since you're my guest you will join me for my bath "sniff, sniff" and by the smell you need one" Mihal says.

"I'm sorry you're majesty but i'll have to decline" you say looking for a way down.

"Decline? I'm the queen you can't decline my invitation" she says still walking, she picks you up for a second and looks at you "are you saying you don't think me beautiful?" she asks.

"That's not the problem" you say, you were kind of a furry fan but even if you weren't Mihal looked absolutely gorgeous.

"So then why do you not wish to bathe with me" Mihal says putting you back on her shoulder.

"Don't you have a problem with someone you barely know seeing you naked?" you ask.

"You sure are an interesting one" Mihal says. "No I do not mind being seen by one of you're race" she says turning around a corner and you can feel the air get warmer.

"Why?" you ask.

"I am the queen, it is an honor to be able to see me naked" Mihal says.

"Fine, whatever" you say resigning to yourself to what was to come. Mihal walks into a stone room with a square basin in the center which is being fed by what you can only assume is a nearby hot spring as the water was steaming. She puts you down on the edge of the basin and you have to flail you're arms a bit to keep you're balance, you hear her clothes land near you and you take that as a cue to get undressed. You slip into the water as it was nice and warm and you feel more then see Mihal enter next to you. You just float for a bit until you feel her poke you, "excuse me Jake but I have an itch would you scratch it?" she asks pointing to a place on her back. She leans against the side of the basin and you climb up and walk over to her back. You reach over and start scratching the spot she indicated.

"Oooh that feels heavenly" Mihal says leaning forward, however you put some of you're weight on her so when she leaned too far forward you fall in, not really hurt but a bit suprised. She pulls you out of the water and smiles at you "you just showed up and you are already proving useful to me, I'm very glad I made you my guest" she says.

"Thanks, can you put me back into the water?" you ask.

"No I don't think I will" Mihal says smiling, "a queen can't owe a favour to anyone" she says.

"Look think nothing of it, if you really want to feel better you can think of putting me down as repayment" you say. She brings you up to her eye and stares at you for a bit, "you know for a human you're not half bad looking" she says.

"Thanks, but can you put me down it's kind of cold" you say. Finally she puts you down in the water and it felt heavenly after being surrounded by the cold air, but the part of you Mihal was holding felt very warm. You swim for a bit trying to figure out just how big this basin you were in really was and you estimate it was about 10 times Mihal's size so about 30 football fields long and 9 wide. You look up and notice Mihal is staring at you, "is there something wrong you're majesty?" you ask.

"No, nothing is wrong, just for some reason I can't stop staring at you, have you cursed me, is this human magic?" she asks.

"No I haven't cursed you, if I had this whole place would be under my control already" you say jokingly but she just stares at you stunned.

"That was a joke, humans are no more capable of sorcery then you are" you say. You however are corrected a second later as a small blue flame appears on Mihals finger, she twirls it and the flame follows. "Ok I stand corrected I guess you can use sorcery" you say.

"Hmmm so someone small enough not to disobey and can't use sorcery to try to overthrow me you just keep looking better and better" Mihal says.

"In what way?" you ask confused.

"As a canidate to be my king, you will then have no reason to leave and you won't try to betray me" Mihal says smiling.

"Woah woah woah, shouldn't that kind of thing be decided on ya know love" you say.

"I don't see what mating has to do with it" Mihal says.

"No the feeling of love, you know the feeling you get when you truly care about someone and you want to protect them no matter what" you say. Mihal stares at you confused. You sigh and swim up next to her, "you're majesty can I give you a hug?" you ask.

"Yes you may" she replies. You swim up and hug her breast which was about you're size. You swim back a bit, "did you feel anything?" you ask.

"Strange, when you hugged me my body felt warmer then the water, are you sure you don't know sorcery" Mihal says.

"I think that's the beginning of love, not sure why you'd feel it about me" you say.

"Well you are pretty cute for a human, easy to manage, there's just one more thing" Mihal says. She stands up and sits on the edge of the basin, she picks you up and puts you on her head.

"Um what are you doing?" you ask.

"I want you to scratch my ears" she says. You shrug and reach over and scratch one of her ears.

"Ooh that feels great, you are definitley worth keeping around little one, never have I received such a pleasing ear scratch" Mihal says.

"Thanks" you say scratching harder and apparently well enough to have Mihal sink into the basin and lay there sighing. You stop after a minute and you feel yourself picked up and Mihal holds you in front of her face. "You are definitley worth watching little one"

"My name's Jack not little one" you say.

"Alright Jack, you have piqued my interest, so not only will you stay as a guest you will stay as my personal guest" Mihal says.

"What does that mean?" you ask.

"It means the queen herself will watch over you, you should feel honored" Mihal says.

"Yeah I do" you say. Mihal places you down near you're clothes and throws you a towel which you use to cover yourself and your clothes as Mihal shakes herself dry. You quickly dry yourself off and you see Mihal looking down at you. She picks you up and places you down on her shoulder and starts walking with a purpose. You can tell she's heading somewhere but you aren't really sure where. She seems to loop around the whole castle before coming up to a kitchen, she grabs a few slices of meat cut from you really weren't sure what and a mug full of again you really weren't sure what before walking back to her throne room. She sits down and the food and drink in front of her before putting you down in front of it.

"Is this for me?" you ask.

"Of course, you must be hungry" Mihal says.

"Well I am kind of hungry" you say smelling the meat. It didn't smell weird so you ripped off a small bit, it didn't taste bad, heck it tasted like chicken. You start eating and you quickly eat you're fill, you try to drink from the mug but it was bigger then you were. "A little help?" you ask.

"No I think you should figure out how to drink it yourself" Mihal says through giggles.

"Fine" you say, you climb onto the handle of the mug and you're just able to keep you're balance while you drink you're fill, Mihal however gives you a small push so you fall into the mug.

"Oh now where'd Jack go" Mihal says picking up the mug.

"Hey that wasn't necesscary" you say as Mihal brings the mug up to her mouth. You're given a very god look at the inside as Mihal tilts the mug and you're just able to hold onto the sides, falling onto her muzzle as she shuts it.

"Oh there you are" Mihal says smiling.

"It's not very nice to try to kill you're guests" you say.

"I wasn't going to kill you, you have too much to offer to kill" Mihal says.

"Thanks, but please never do that again" you say.

"Is that a request?" Mihal asks.

"Yes" you say.

"Alright" Mihal says you were sure smiling but considering you were laying on top of her muzzle you couldn't see. She picks you off and puts you on her shoulder. The same skunk anthro that found you before walks in and bows "You're majesty it's time for"

1121.content:
dinner" she says. "Thank you Elizabeth" Mihal says before the skunk anthro leaves. Mihal stands up and exits the room walking through halls with ornate marble pillars that would have probably taken normal people 10s if not 100s of years to carve. "Wow who made all the beautiful architecture?" you ask.

"Me!" Mihal replies.

"Wow, you're really talented" you say admiring another pillar as you pass it. You enter an ornate dining hall with a table that well you really weren't sure how long it was, all along it were raised chairs with small ladders on them so everyone would sit at a level height with Mihal. Mihal heads to her seat and puts you down on the table "you can sit here, right next to me" Mihal says. A Cobra anthro sits in the chair next to where you were and this is when you notice all probable 500 individuals at the table seemed to be anthros, and they were all female.

"This is a joyous occasion for our island, I have finally found our king" Mihal says lifting you up. The applause from the girls was deafening, "now it is time for a feast" Mihal says. Some people left to go get food, and soon the table was filled with all sorts of fruit as well as that weird pigish meat thing you saw before. Everyone begins eating except the cobra who leans over to you. "Sssooo you are to be our king, will you have a concubine?" she asks.

"Wha...what? No I will not" you whisper back.

"Oh come now it'ssss very important for usss to have assss many children as possssible" she replies.

"No, i'm going to be Mihal's and hers alone" you say.

"All it would take issss the act of child-rearing and you're part would be done" she says.

"For the last time in no way am I going to fuck you all" you yell, problem is the room had gone deathly quiet. You slowly turn to see everyone staring at you and there's an eruption of applause.

"Uh what did I do?" you ask Mihal.

"You just said you'd give children to everyone didn't you?" Mihal says.

"Uh...uh..." you turn to see the cobra girl smiling at you.

"I....I guess so" you say.

"Excellent, well then everyone if you wouldn't mind i'll be his first" Mihal says picking you up.

"Wait what about the feast?" you ask as she gets up and starts walking with a purpose.

"It can wait" Mihal says. Mihal quickly enters her chambers and strips before you, you had already seen everything once but this time for some reason you stood there transfixed. "Take em off or I rip em off" Mihal says a primal urge entering her voice. Needless to say you stripped, the next 5-6 hours you were poked, prodded, shoved, squeezed, massaged, bruised, licked, and inserted. You really weren't sure how many times you had released into Mihal but it had to be atleast 10, as for how many times she had, well you were easily soaked enough to prove she had done it a lot. You were lifted up from her nether regions and Mihal smiled down at you "never have I received such pleasure before, you are definitely my king" she says.

"Uhh thanks" you say. Mihal licks you for a bit cleaning any leftover juices off of you before snuggling you into her chest. "Mmmm I am very glad that you ended up here" she says.

"Me too I guess" you say.

"What is wrong, you sound displeased, was I not good enough?" Mihal asks.

"That's not the problem" you say laying down, "this is just a bit much for me to take in, I mean in less than a day I went from vacationing. to being stranded on an island with giant animal women, to becoming a king and having to give all those women children" you say. "That and I think i'm falling in love with their queen" you say. Mihal smiles down at you, "so what is the trouble then?" she asks.

"Well I only want to make love with one fox, namely you" you say.

"You will only make love with me, the rest are just for the purpose of child-rearing" she replies.

"Thanks Mihal" you say burying yourself in her fur, "You're welcome Jack" she replies. You fall asleep next to her and you weren't expecting that to be the last time in a while. You spent the next 2 months child-rearing as they called it with about 3 different girls a night. Some took it more gently with you like a mouse girl named Jasmine and a dog girl named Elizabeth. Some however just went totally primal like Tyra the tigress or Keira the cobra who you met at the dinner table. Luckily for you a week after the last woman had been reared everyone including Mihal were walking around with more pronounced bellies telling you that it had been a success. All of the girls you passed said hi and most either smiled or waved as well. You headed to Mihal's chamber and you found her propped up on the bed eating what looked like a giant apple. "Hello my king" she says as you enter.

"Hi" you reply as you walk up and scale up the side of the huge bed. You walk over and lay up against her pronounced stomach, "you're child's getting bigger" Mihal says happily rubbing her stomach. "Yeah, only a few more months and i'll be a father" you reply.

"You will and there will be a celebration across the island and everyone will attend" Mihal says.

"Yeah..... i'm really not sure if i'm ready to be a parent" you say laying back.

"Why not?" Mihal asks.

"Well judging from you're size, the kid's probably gonna be as big or bigger then I am to start off with" you say "and it'll just grow bigger making my job that much harder" you say sighing.

"You'll be a wonderful father" Mihal says, "just like you're a wonderful lover" she continues picking you up and nuzzling against you.

"Thanks Mihal" you say hugging her cheek. She smiles and lays you down near her, "so have you come up with a name yet?" she asks.

"There's a few months till it's born I think a name can wait" you reply.

"I want one now" Mihal says whining.

"Fine, how about we come up for one if it's a boy and one for if it's a girl" you say.

"Mihal if it's a girl and Casey if it's a boy" Mihal says.

"nah, how about Kelly if it's a girl, and Jim if it's a boy" you reply. Mihal shakes her head. "Fine" you say. You bounce ideas off each other for a good 20 minutes before both agreeing upon the names Kevin and Yasmin. You lay out on Mihal's chest and she strokes you're back.

"Thank you Jack" she says.

"For what?" you reply.

"You've given me a child, and you've made me so happy" she says.

"Well same for me" you say snuggling up. You feel Mihal drape a hand over you and you fall asleep content to just lay atop her stomach. You're woken up a few hours later to the feeling of something kicking; 1,2,3,4 there were 4 kicks, no way could a kid kick that fast unless. "Oh great she's pregnant with twins" you think to yourself as you fall back asleep higher up on her body so the kicking won't disturb you. You fall asleep again and wake up to the sound of birds chirping and light streaming in. You stretch and yawn and you feel a long wet surface slide over you.

"Good morning" Mihal says finishing her lick.

"Good "blech" morning" you say wiping her spit off.

"Sorry I thought you'd like to be licked awake" she says.

"It's ok, but just a simple light shake or a kiss would work better" you say.

"Alright" Mihal says leaning down and kisses you, trapping you under her hand before she lets go.

"Thanks" you say as you try to get up but she keeps you pinned under her. "Hey Mihal you can let me up" you say.

"Not until you tell me what you learned last night, I can tell you know something just not what" she says.

"Oh you're pregnant with twins not a single kid" you say.

"EEEE" Mihal squeals and sits up rapidly. "Do you know how good that news is?" she says.

"No, why?" you ask.

"We've always reproduced one child, to one mother, always needing the help of some wandering male or an outsider to reproduce" Mihal says.

"So?" you reply.

"If it's a boy then we can finally sustain our own population" Mihal says.

"That's excellent" you say. The next few months fly by as everyone heard the news and waited for Mihal's birth. The day finally arrives and.....

11211.content:
Finally, the day came when your new children were to be born. You sit outside the door to Mihal's chambers, waiting for the news. On the other side you hear voices and yells coming from Mihal. "You're almost there my queen! Push!" You hear a voice say. Another cry of pain comes from inside. You feel really sorry for Mihal, her having to go through this. But she said so herself, this would be a joyous occasion for the island.

Finally, the door opens, and a cheetah anthro steps out. "It's done." She says smiling. "Congratulations! You're a father!" She leads you into the room. She lifts you up and places you on the bed at Mihal's feet. There she lay, holding the twins in her arms, a huge smile on her face, tears of joy in her eyes.

"Oh my King!" She says as you walk toward her. The twins are wrapped in wool blankets, both of them sound asleep. "It's just as we had hoped!" She says excitedly. "One of them is a male! Say hello to Kevin and Yasmin."

You take a look at your new children. They are both red foxes like their mother, except there is a major difference with the Kevin. He has the head of a fox, and the body of a human! "He looks just like you!" Says Mihal.

You smile. "Except he has your eyes. And nose. and ears." You both laugh.

The news of the new princess and the first prince in the island's history quickly spread, and there is to be a grand celebration. Mihal walks through the streets, a baby in each arm, and you on her shoulder. The other anthros throw confetti around and cheer. Later, and feast is held. You sit next to Mihal, eating a particularly good piece of that strange meat, as the other amazons come up and congratulate the both of you.

After the feast, some amazons begin playing music on wooden flutes and drums, and there was much dancing. Mihal held you in her palm while she slowly stepped about, dancing with you as best as she could. "I love you." She says. "I love you too." You say back. She holds you to her breast and hugs you.

"Well," you think, "Now I'm a father, and a king. And there are many more children on the way. Lets just wait and see what the future holds."
11211.title: It's a boy and a girl

112111.content:
That night you sat on Mihal’s stomach as Kevin and Yasmin slept on either side of her in her bed, her arms draped over them. You had a slight headache, due to having a little too much wine at the celebration.


“I don’t get it.” You said to Mihal. “I didn’t drink anywhere near as much as you. How come I have a headache, and you’re completely fine?” Mihal giggled. “Could be our wine is different then what you have where you come from. Or maybe because I’m much larger than you, and can handle more than you can.”


You lay back on top of Mihal and sigh. “Is something wrong?” Asks Mihal. “Well.” You say. “I always told myself I would never have kids. That I never wanted to fall in love.”


“Why’s that?” Asks Mihal. “Because I never really trusted women.” You say. “You trust me don’t you?” Asks Mihal. “Of course.” You say. “Until I met you, I had never been in love with anyone. Yet here I am, in love with giant fox, and with children.”


Mihal smiled. “Then I guess we were just meant to be.” She holds her hand out and you climb into her palm. She holds you to her cheek and nuzzles you. You hug back.


“I have something for you.” Says Mihal as she sets you down on her chest. “Something very special. I can only give it to someone I can absolutely trust, and I think you fit that description.” She puts her hand over her mouth and begins coughing.


“Are you alright?” You ask. She nods as she coughs again, and something lands in her hand. She grips the object between her fingers and holds it out to you. It is a large spherical ruby, that seems to glow with a bright red light.


“Take it.” Says Mihal. You reaches out and touch the ruby. It istantly shrinks to a small down to the size of your fist, as you hold it in your palm. “That is the Orabos Stone.” Says Mihal. “It is an artifact of ghreat power. It will grant its’ owner nearly any desire”


“You had this in your stomach?” You ask, a little bit grossed out. “I had to keep it in a safe place.” Says Mihal. “I thought there would be no safer place than in there.”


You turn the glowing red orb over in your hands. “How does it work?” You ask. “Just hold it, and concentrate on what you want. Of course it does have certain limitations.”


“Like what?” You ask.


“For starters, it glows because it is full of magical energy. With each wish you make, the glow will get dimmer and dimmer. Eventually, it will go dead. It takes a hundred years for it to fully charge again, so wish wisely.”


“Why couldn’t you just use this to bring back the males population of the island?” You ask. “That’s another limit it has.” Says Mihal. “It can’t create living beings.”

You stare into the glow of the stone. It feels warm in your hands, like a flame. “Thank you Mihal.” You say, kissing her on the nose. “I promise I will use this for good. I only wish I had something for you.”


“You have already given me a gift.” Says Mihal. “You have given me love, and you have given me children.”


“Even so.” You say. “There’s something I want to do for you.” You hold the stone in your hands and concentrate. The gem’s glow becomes a little dimmer, as you feel the energy surge within the jewel.


A violin and bow appear at your feet. You set the stone down and pick them up. “What is that?” Asks Mihal. “It’s called a violin.” you say. “It’s a musical instrument. This is my gift for you.”


You pull the bow across the strings, playing a melodious tune. The flow of music you create is almost enchanting. It’s hard to believe you’re just making up the whole thing as you go. When you finish, Mihal hugs you to her cheek again. “That was beautiful.” She says. “But you’re even more beautiful.” You say.


Mihal giggles. “I will always love you.” She says, kissing you. “Likewise.” You say.
112111.title: Can You Feel the Love?

1121111.content:
It’s been about six months since your children were born. Already they are twice your size. Mihal is always there when they want to play, to make sure they don’t end up hurting you. They are starting to teethe, and are at the stage where they like to chew on things, including you.


Mihal has already had to pull you out of their mouths twice. You still have some teeth marks on you from them. You hated to admit it, but you were kind of afraid of them.


You would often go on walks through the city, just to get away from them for a while. It was sad, but what else could you do? On one such walk, you were approached by a mysterious figure.


She was covered from head to toe in a brown cloak. Her face was shrouded in shadow from her hood. The strange thing was that she was shorter than the other anthros, about your size. “My liege.” She said. “You must come with me at once, there is a terrible emergency!”


That got your attention. “Lead the way.” You say. She turns and jogs ahead of you. you follow her through the city streets, out into the jungle. She leads you through the tall grass and ferns to a small clearing surrounded by trees.


She suddenly stops. “So, what’s the emergency?” You say, catching your breath. “There is no emergency.” She says, not turning around. “What? You brought me here for nothing?” You say, irritated. “Who do you think you are.


Beneath her hood, the figure smirks. “Do you not recognize me?” You’re getting really annoyed now. “No! How can I recognize you if I can’t even see your face?”


The figure turns and lets her cloak slide off of her to the ground. She is a black panther, with glowing yellow eyes, and long black hair down to her waist. She is dressed in a long, blood red skirt and sleeveless top that exposes her trim her belly. She wears two golden bracers on her forearms, and a gold circlet around her head. At her side is a golden sword, sheathed in a black scabbard.


“Am I familiar now?” She asks, grinning. Now you do recognize her. You have seen images of her painted on the palace walls. “I’ve seen you before.” You say. “But I do not know your name.”


“I am Morgana, Goddess of War.” You jaw nearly hits the ground. “You’re a goddess?” You say, in awe. “Indeed I am.” She says. “Why did you bring me here?” You ask. She grins. “So I can have you all to myself.”


You begin to back away in fear as she steps toward you. “ Now, now, don’t be afraid.” She says. “I’m about to make you an offer you won’t be able to resist.” You back into a tree, and she presses herself against you. “What do you say we take this someplace more……..comfortable?”


The world around you begin to fade and waver, like a mirage. Everything is being distorted. Suddenly, you find yourself in a green field with an orange sky, a golden sun setting on the horizon. “Where are we?” You ask, looking around at the sudden change of scenery.
“This is Nirvala, the home of the gods.” says Morgana. “Come with me, I’ll take you to my palace.” She leads you through the field to a building. made of black marble and gold, designed like a Greek temple. guarding the entrance is two anthros in golden armor and red capes, In their hands the hold spears and large round shields with strange symbols painted on them. They bow as Morgana passes, leading you through a long, black marble hall, illuminated by glowing white crystals in the walls.


“Who are they?” You ask. “My personal guards, the Furkuries. Mortals given the honor of serving me in the afterlife. I based them off of my favorite warriors, the ones you people call Spartans.”


“ You know about human warriors?” You ask. “Of course.” She says. “ I admire humans rather fondly. Mainly because you are always at war with each other. It’s amazing your kind aren’t extinct, especially with the amazing weapons you create. Although, I prefer fighting your enemy close and personal. Killing them from a distance is cowardly if you ask me.”


She leads you to her throne room. Two servants, a fox and a skunk, dressed in purple gowns, run up to her. “Mistress Morgana, who is this?” Says the skunk, indicating you. “He is my guest. I want you to bring me a bottle of my special wine.” Unknown to you, when she says “special” She winks to the skunk.


“Yes, mistress.” Says the skunk, bowing before running off. Morgana points to the fox. “You, prepare us dinner.” The fox bows as well and heads for the kitchens. You notice that Morgana is shorter than her servants. “Why are you my size, instead ten feet tall like the others?” You ask.


“I can be any size I want.” Says Morgana as she leads you to the dining room. “I just thought you would be more comfortable around me if I were down to your level.” You both sit at a table carved from black marble like everything else in the palace.


“So, what do you want with me?” You ask. “I’ll tell you after the meal.” The servants bring out a large roasted bird, though you couldn’t tell what bird it was. As you eat, the skunk from earlier brings you crystal bottle of red wine. You drink it and enjoy in immensely. As you drink, Morgana thinks to herself “That potion should kick in any time now. Then, he will be like clay in my hands.”


After the meal, Morgana leads you to her personal hot springs. She removes her clothes, revealing her amazing body. “Come on.” she says. Slightly intoxicated from the wine, you strip down and get in the spring with her.


“Enough delays, Morgana. Tell me why you brought me here.” You say. Morgana grabs a hold of you and pulls you close to her. she stares into your eyes and giggles. “You’re lucky you’re good looking, so I won’t eviscerate you for daring to give me orders.”


She places her hands on your head and holds you face up to hers. “The reason I brought you here, is this.” She presses her lips to yours, sliding her tongue into your mouth. For a moment you kiss back, but suddenly realize, “What the f&%^$ am I doing!?”


You quickly push her away and get out of the spring, drying off with a towel and putting your clothes back on. “How dare you reject me!” Says Morgana, angered. “How dare you try to steal me!” You retort back. “I have a wife, a family! Now send me back to the island!” Morgana scowls. “You’re afraid of your own family. Wouldn’t you rather have me? I can make your every fantasy come alive. What do you like? Wealth?”


Suddenly, you’re no longer in the hotsprings. You are in a room filled with mountains of gold and jewels. “Women?” The piles of treasure disappear, and you are surrounded by scantily clad anthro females, all of them winking or flirting with you.


“No!” You say. The crowd of females vanishes, and you are in the springs again. “I love Mihal, and only Mihal. I will not abandon her or my children for anything that you can offer.”


Morgana snarls. “Then begone! But mark my words, mortal, you just made the biggest mistake of your life!” she waves a hand and you vanish back to the island. “Foolish mortal.” Says Morgana with a half sneer, half evil smile. “I’m not only the Goddess of War, I’m also the goddess of Revenge.”


Option 1: Morgana unleashes a terrible plague upon the island, infecting hundreds of citizens. The only way she will end it, is if you submit to her


Option 2: Morgana curses you with bad luck. You continually have one misfortune after another, scoring several injuries as well.
1121111.title: The Goddess of War

11211111.content:
It’s been a week since your incident with Morgana. You haven’t told anyone about it, not even Mihal. The good news was that your children were finally starting be more gentle with you. You discovered that they liked the sound of music. When they were getting fussy, or wouldn’t go to sleep, you would play them a soothing tune on your violin, and it would calm them down.


They had also started to speak. They could already say “Mommy”, “Daddy”, and “Up” whenever they wanted to be held. You were sitting on Mihals shoulder as she sat on her bed indian style with Yasmin in her lap. Kevin was sleeping on the pillow behind her.


Mihal was tickling Yasmin’s belly while she giggled. “She’s so much like you.” You commented to Mihal. “What do you mean?” Asked Mihal. “Well, she has your eyes, your nose, your hair, she’s sweet, cute, and beautiful. Just like her mother.”


Mihal smiled. “You’re so sweet.” She turns her head towards you and kisses you. You kiss her on the cheek. “That’s why you love me.” Just then, one of the servants, a panda girl, bursts into the room. “My queen! Come quick! It’s an emergency!”


Mihal instantly sets Yasmin down on the bed next to her brother and is heading out the door, with you on her shoulder. “Stay here and watch the children.” She commands to the panda as she exits.


Mihal strides through the halls to the throne room, Where two anthro cats are holding a fox in a stretcher of leaves and bamboo. “What happened?” Asks Mihal. “She has some sort of disease.” Says one of the cats. “We don’t know what’s causing it, we only know that it is very contagious, at least fifty others on the island have it already.”


Mihal leans down to get a better look, and is horrified by what she sees. The fox on the stretcher is completely bald, all her fur is gone. Her bare skin is covered with open sores. Her eyes are bloodshot and red. Blood stains her mouth as she constantly drools the crimson fluid. You can see that her body is stiff as a board, her muscles tight and cramped. She is covered in sweat, as her body overheats.


You and Mihal are both horrified. “Take everyone who has been infected, and quarantine them.” Mihal orders. “Where?” Asks one of the cats. “Anywhere!” Says Mihal. “Just keep them away from everyone else!”


It was decided that the infected would be kept outside the city, in an arboretum in the jungle. Over the course of a week, despite the citizen’s best efforts, over half the island had been infected with the mysterious plague. Sadly, over half of those who were infected had already died.


Mihal was in despair, which put you in despair. She sat on her bed, her face buried in her hands, crying. Yasmin crawled up to you and hugged you close to her. “Daddy.” She said in a scared voice. You began rubbing her belly, in an attempt to calm her.


“It’s okay sweetie.” You say in a soothing voice. “Everything will be O…….” You stop mid-sentence as some of Yasmin’s fur comes off in your hands. “Oh-no.” The news that the prince and princess had been infected spread rabidly across the island. By now, Mihal was a miserable wreck. Her own her started falling out, but you didn’t know if it was from the plague, or from stress. Then, one day, as Mihal was in her throne room with you on her shoulder, an anthro bee came into the room, carrying a large jar under her arms.


“Your highness!” She said. “I think I may have found a solution to our problem.” Miahl’s eyes lit up. “What is it?” The bee held up the jar. “In this jar is some of my own special honey. I gave some to some citizens who had been infected. It seems to lessen the effects of the plague!”


Mihal told the bee to follow her to her room, where Kevin and Yasmin were kept. they had to be kept in a pen in the corner of the room, to keep them from infecting you and Mihal. Over half their fur had fallen out, and their eyes were turning red, and they both had a ragin fever. The bee gave them both three spoonfuls of honey.


Mihal felt their foreheads and their fevers were gone. “How long will this last?” She asked. The bee sighed. “I’m not sure. But I know that it won’t cure the plague, only keep it at bay.”


“In that case.” Said Mihal. “I hear by commission you and all the bees on the island to begin production of as much honey as possible.” The bee bowed. “It would be an honor to serve you, in our time of need, my queen.” then she flew off.


In a few days, the bees had made hundreds of jars full of honey. The problem was that wasn’t enough. The island’s healers tried every spell the could, but the plague seemed to be unaffected by magic, or any medicine they had.


The arboretum was becoming overcrowded, and homes were converted into makeshift hospitals. The honey had eased the infected’s pain, but they had to continually take it every day. Soon, the honey began to run low, and as a result, the flowers and plants of the island began to wither from no pollenation.


Mihal say on her throne, sobbing. “What did we do the envoke this?” She said. “Why have the gods cursed us so?” You tried to comfort her. “There, there.” You say, stroking her cheek. “It’s not your fault.”


“No.” Says a voice from nowhere, a voice that is all too familiar to you. “It’s yours.” A pillar of fire shot up from the floor in the center of the throne room. After it dissipated, there stood Morgana, this time as big as Mihal. She laughed evilly, then stared at you. “So, ready to submit to me?”


“You caused this!?” You exclaim angrily. “Yes.” She says, grinning. “After you so rudely dumped me, I decided I would make you pay by making those you love, and everyone around you suffer.”


“Who are you?” Asked Mihal, confused. “Name’s Morgana. I tried to seduce your little friend there, and he rejected me. So, I figured this would be the best way to get revenge.”


“How could you do this!?” Snarls Mihal. “I’m the Goddess of War, I can do whatever I want.” Says Morgana non-chalantly. Mihal stood up from her throne, angrily striding over to Morgana, until she was staring her straight in the eyes. “You killed my people!” She snarled. “You hurt my children! You tried to steal my husband!”


“Yes.” Said Morgana, smirking. “I would have had him too, if he hadn’t somehow resisted that love potion I put in his wine. What are you gonna do about it?”


Option 1: Mihal challenges Morgana to a duel. If she wins, Morgana must cure the plague. If Morgana wins, she gets you.


Option 2: The other gods are displeased with Morgana’s actions, and you are transported to Nirvala, where she is to stand trial before the other gods.
11211111.title: Morgana's Revenge

choices: Mihal won, but she is badly injured
112111111.content:
Even through her fur, you could see Mihal turning red with fury. She was now nose to nose with Morgana, her teeth bared in a snarl. .”Go ahead.” Said Morgana in a calm voice. “Make one move. It’ll be your last, mortal.”


What happened next, you would never have expected in a trillion years. Mihal clenched her fist, and swung it upwards, delivering an uppercut to the underside of Morgana’s jaw, knocking her across the throne room and landing on her back.


For a moment, Morgana stared wide eyed at Mihal in shock, the mere notion that a mortal would dare to strike her was incredible to say the least. You too had your jaw hanging agape in amazement. This was a side of Mihal you had never seen before. In all the time you had known her, Mihal had always been so kind and gentle. She would never hurt a fly.


But now, you had just seen her sucker punch a god! After she had recovered from her shock, Morgana got back on her feet. “You dare strike a Divine?!” She said, her very voice causing the room to tremble. “For that, you will suffer far worse than what your people have endured!” Morgana curved her arm back behind her head. As she swung forward, a whip of solid flame materialized in her fist. The blazing cord came lashing down towards Mihal.


An enormous golden shield appeared in front of you and Mihal, hovering in midair. As the burning whip struck it, a shower of sparks filled the air. It had been so long since Mihal had shown you her magic, you had forgotten she could use it.


The whip dissipated in Morgana’s hand, as did Mihal’s shield. “I challenge you to Akratai!” Said Mihal, pointing at Morgana. An Akratai was how Anthronians would settle disputes between each other, with a duel, sometimes to the death.


Morgana grinned. She may have been bold enough to have struck her, but there was no way this mortal could defeat her, the Goddess of Battle, in an Akratai. Hell, it had been Morgana who had invented the Akratai to begin with.


“I accept.” Said Morgana with an evil smile. “Name the stakes.” “If I win,” Said Mihal. “You must cure this plague upon my people, and never bother us again.” “Fine.” says Morgana with a sneer. “If I win, your husband will become mine, and I get to do with you as I please.”


“Mihal, what are you doing?” You say into Mihal’s ear. “I’m going to fight her, to the death if need be.” You beg her to reconsider, but she refuses. “Choose your weapon.” Says Morgana. A long, thin sword with a curved blade and ivory handle appears in Mihal’s hand. She picks you up in her other hand a places you on the armrest of her throne.


“Don’t worry.” She says. “I’m much tougher than I look. I can handle her.” She turns to face Morgana. “Well?” she says with a sneer. “What’s your weapon going to be?”


Morgana grinned and held up her hands, palms outward. As she curled her fingers, her claws sprang from their tips. Her claws were wickedly sharp and were made of gold. She pointed to Mihal with one golden tipped claw, and drew it across her throat with an evil smile on her face. “Ready?” Mihal raises her sword over her head and charged towards Morgana. There was a blindly flash of light that forced you to shield your eyes. When your sight returns, Mihal and Morgana are gone.


You guess they must have teleported to Morgana’s realm to fight. For hours you sit on the armrest of Mihal’s throne, praying that Mihal will come through. She wasn’t kidding about being tougher than she looked if they had been fighting this long.


Occasionally the ground would shake, or there would be a boom of thunder from outside, and you knew it was from the force of their fight. Finally, after what seemed like an eternity, another bright flash filled the room. When your vision cleared, your heart sank.
112111111.title: Clash of the Titans

choices: Speak to Thanatra, and get back Mihal
1121111111.content:
Mihal stood in the center of the throne room, Morgana laying unconscious at her feet. You would have been filled with relief at this sight, if not for the fact that Mihal was also covered in several bleeding gashes. But that wasn't the worst part. The worst part was that you could see Mihal clutching her stomach with one hand, no doubt covering a grievous wound.


"MIHAL!"


"My king..."


Mihal drops her sword and clumsily makes her way over to you, stumbling every few steps, woozy from blood loss. When she finally reaches you, she picks you up and holds you to her chest. "My king...I did it...our children...our people...are saved." Mihal collapses to her knees, then falls back, laying flat out on the floor. You bury yourself in her chest fur, comforting her as best you can. "Mihal...it's okay...everything's going to be alright."


You feel Mihal's body begin to move, but she wasn't standing up. You look up to see that her body was shrinking! "Mihal! What's going on!?" Mihal raises her head very slowly, rapidly losing strength, the light fading from her eyes. "An empress is granted great size to symbolize her status as supreme ruler of Anthronia. She only loses that size when... when..."


You dreaded the end of that sentence. You quickly run up to Mihal's shrinking face and hug her nose. "Please Mihal don't do this! How will I, our children, the people live with out you!?" As Mihal reaches average Anthronian height, you climb off of her chest and cradle her head in your arms. Her breaths become more and more shallow, as she looks up at you with pleading eyes. She weakly tries to lift her head again, but has lost the strength to do it. You lean down towards her, as she gives you one final kiss on the lips.


With her last breath, Mihal whispers in your ear "I love you." With those words, her body went limp in your arms, and she departed this life. All at once, a tsunami of emotions come crashing down on you. Despair, loss, anger, but most of all, hate. Hatred for Morgana, for being the cause of all this. Hatred for the gods, for allowing this to happen. But most of all, hatred for yourself, for rejecting Morgana's advances and beginning this entire disaster.


You turned around to attack Morgana in a fit of blind fury, but to your shock, she had disappeared, without a trace. That same evening, a funeral proccession was held for Mihal, as her body was carried in a grand sarcophagus, through the streets filled with the surviving citizens. Everyone present held a torch of blue flame in the air, to symbolize their mourning of the loss of their beloved leader.


Mihal was laid to rest in the ancient underground city of the dead, in the royal crypt, the final resting place for the rulers of Anthronai's past. Morgana was as good as her word, and the plague had vanished the moment she had been defeated. The fact that your children would live to see another day helped ease your grief, but only slightly. With Mihal gone, how would you raise them? How would you rule as the King of Anthronia by yourself? these and several other question raced through your mind as you sat alone in the throne room. You had ordered to not b3 disturbed while you sat alone to grieve.


You sat in the center of the room, your face buried in your hands, when a blinding flash fills the room. You look up to see a tall lioness of unearthly beauty staring down at you with a sympathetic face. "Who are you?"


"I am the Goddess of Love, Mushana."


The word "Goddess" instantly caused you to turn around and walk away. "Do not bear a grudge against all the gods for the sins of just one, Jacob." You keep walking away, a deep scowl on your face, when there is another blinding flash, and Mushana is standing directly in front of you."Please, listen to me. The gods have been watching what has happened with you, this isl;and, and Morgana. As Goddess of Love, I cannot just sit by, and allow my sister to go unpunished for ruining a love such as yours and Mihal's. The Pantheon has agreed that she must be punished, and I am here to offer you a choice."


"What kind of choice?"


"We know that you must long for revenge against Morgana, after what she has done. So it would only be fitting that you should be the one to deliver the sword of justice to her. Or, you may speak to Thanatra, the Goddess of Death, and convince her to allow Mihal to rejoin you in the mortal world. You cannot do both, so make your decision wisely."


So what will you choose?
1121111111.title: Mihal won, but she is badly injured

11211111112.content:
You think for a while before replying "i'll go speak to Thanatra"

Mushana nods quietly "very well, but i can only take you so far" she says as she kneels to pick you up, you stare at her before climbing into her hand,
"you might want to cover your eyes" she warns "it's going to be very bright"

You nod and cover your eyes, through your fingers you see a blinding flash of light before darkness again, you uncover your eyes to find yourself in a underground cavern before what looks like a river, you hear a light splashing nearby,

"That'll be Serpentine, the ferryman, she'll take you to Thanatra's realm" explained Mushana.

You look over the water and see a light approaching slowly, the light is within a lamp that is mounted on a black boat with a hooded figure rowing with a long stick.

"Serpentine, I've come about that favor you owe me" Mushana said in a powerful voice as the boat stopped at the dock that you had just noticed, the hooded Serpentine looked at you and Mushana and you've realized your mistake about her having a hood, Serpentine is actually a pitch-black anthro cobra,

"Yesssssssssss Musssssssshana?" she replies with a hiss "what you want SSSSSSSSSSSSSSSerpentine to do for you?"

"I wish for you to take this human to Thanatra so he can retrieve the soul of his loved one" Mushana replied, showing you to her, Serpentine's large yellow eyes stare at you,

"very well, i'll take thisssssssssssssss human to Thanatra" she said, holding out her scaled clawed arm, Mushana carefully deposited you into her claw,

"good luck Jason, and try to return alive" said Mushana,

"i will" you say as Serpentine pushes off and rows quietly into the darkness.

You and Serpentine float down the river, the silence being broken by her rowing, she doesn't stop until you reach a heavy iron door that opens on it's own,

"Thissssssssssssssssss issssssssssssssssssss asssssssssssssssssssssss far asssssssssssssssssss SSSSSSSSSSSSSerpentine goes, now human, through the door to Thanatra" you nod, disembark and walk through the doors, beyond them you see what looks like a judge's platform with many anthro souls lined up, you don't see Mihal among them, you then are suddenly pulled into a dark room from an unknown source,

"you are neither dead nor dieing" said a voice in the room,

"who's that?" you call out as the anthro ___________________ steps forward

"I am Thanatra" she says.
11211111112.title: Speak to Thanatra, and get back Mihal

1121111112.content:
Mihal lay face down on the floor, Morgana standing triumphant over her, her foot pressed on Mihal’s back. From the looks of it, they had both put up quite a fight. Mihal’s clothes had been torn to shreds by Morgana’s claws, so much of her body was exposed, with only tatters covering what little of her was still clothed. Her body was covered in several still bleeding cuts, especially across her torso and face.


But Morgana hadn’t come away from the fight unscathed either. She had two visible scars, one that went from her right hip, across her stomach, to her ribs. The second was across her left eye, but neither of them bled. You noticed her right hand was missing, severed by Mihal’s blade. Speaking of which, you saw Mihal’s sword had been inserted between Morgana’s breasts all the way to the hilt, straight through her heart. The blade protruded out through her back. Yet there wasn’t a drop of blood.


Morgana grinned wickedly. “I win.” She said. You call out to Mihal, praying that she isn’t dead. She stirs, raising her head to look up at you, a look of shame and sadness on her face. “My king…….” she said, barely audible. “Forgive me…….. I have failed.”


Morgana strides over to the throne, picking you up in her remaining hand and holding you in her palm. “You’re all mine now.” She says. “Why!?” You yell at her, half angry, half sad. “Why did you do this!? Why did you have to have me!?”


“Because I desired a mate worthy of me as their wife. You were the only male on the island other than the children you have sired. Plus, you’re a human, the most violent, war mongering species on the planet. So who better than to be my husband, than you?”


She said all this as casually as if you had asked her the time of day. She also didn’t seem to be bothered by the fact she was missing a hand, and was impaled on a sword. “Why are you still alive?” You ask. Morgana laughed. “I’m the Goddess of War! As long as there is war and bloodshed in the world, I can never die.”


She places you on her shoulder, and uses her good hand to pull the sword from her chest. She takes a moment to look at her reflection in the flat of the blade. Then the blade instantly begins to rust until it disintegrates in her grip.


Morgana looks down at Mihal. “Now, what shall I do to punish you?” She says, putting a finger to her chin. “You have struck me, insulted me, taken my hand, I can just replace it, but still.”
then she gets an idea. “I’ve got it!” Morgana lifted Mihal up by her neck and sat her on her throne. Mihal just sat there, her head hung low in defeat. At first, Morgan a just stood there staring at her. Then, you saw Mihal’s feet had turned white and smooth like marble. It spread up her legs to her body. She was turning to stone!


“Mihal! NO!” You cried out. Mihal raised her head to get one last look at you as her entire body except her head was now stone. “I love you.” were her last meek words before she hung her head once more and became totally petrified. She sat there frozen on her throne, white as snow and smooth as silk. Her face had a look of sorrow on it, as a single tear rolled down her cheek.


You fell to your knees and covered your face with your hands, sobbing. When you opened your eyes again, you were back in Morgana’s black marble palace. She was your size again, and stood in front of you, looking down.


“You bitch!” You yell. You launch yourself at her, grabbing at her throat. She simply swats you out of the air like a fly, sending you rolling on the floor. “Calm yourself down.” she says. “You will find me a much better wife than she ever was.”


“No I won’t!” You scream, getting back on your feet. “ I loved her! Did you ever even think of the lives you’ve ruined doing this!? How many people you’ve killed with you’re plague? Including my children!?” “Relax.” Says Morgana, as though it were no big deal. “I ceased the plague on the island. Once I had you, there was no further need for it. Everyone who had it has been cured.”


That at least eased some of your anger. At least Kevin and Yasmin would live. “But what of the island?” You ask. “With Mihal petrified and our children only infants, who will lead the people?” “The affairs of mortals are no concern to me.” Says Morgana, waving a hand. “Let them figure it out.”


She walks up to you and puts a hand on your shoulder. “It is no concern of yours either. Here, you will have your every desire and fantasy fulfilled. You won‘t even age a day while you‘re here.” You notice the hand on your shoulder is the one that was missing from her wrist earlier. Her scars are also gone.


“I have two gifts for you.” says Morgana, producing a black silken robe and a small mirror from behind her back. she drapes the robe over your shoulders. “I made this from my own hair,” says Morgana. “It will protect the wearer from any weapon.” She hands you the mirror. “This is so you may still watch the mortal world if you wish.” She says. “Just concentrate on what you want to see, and it will appear in the mirror.”


You take the mirror and stare into it’s reflective surface. “How do I know you won’t try to kill me like you did Mihal?” You ask with contempt. “If you’re talking about that little love tap I gave you, that was only because you tried to strangle me.” says Morgana. “Try to hurt me, even though you can’t, and I will punish you. Secondly, your precious mortal queen isn’t dead. Her soul still inhabits her body. She is merely trapped in a state of suspension. And she will remain so. Such is the punishment for daring to challenge me.”


She claps her hands twice, and two servants, a skunk and a wolf, come running to her side. “Take my new husband to my chambers and get him ready while I freshen up.” The servants bow and lead you by your arms through the halls of Morgana’s palace. “I think I have an idea of what she’s freshening up for.” you think to yourself. “and I get a feeling that I’m not going to like it.” The two servants push you inside two black stone doors, and quickly shut them behind you. The room you stood in was completely colored blood red. The walls, the lighting, the rug, even the bed.


It came as no surprise to you. Being the goddess of bloodshed, red was clearly Morgana’s favorite color. You also had a good hunch that she wasn’t going to be gentle with you in what was about to happen for that same reason.


For what felt seemed like hours you just stood there. In that time you had used the mirror Morgana had given you to check on Kevin and Yasmin. Morgana wasn’t lying. Their fur had grown anew, and their sores were healed. She at least kept her word. They were still in their pen, with no knowledge of what has become of their mother.


You hear the doors behind you open. You turn to see Morgana there dressed in something resembling a belly-dancer’s outfit, with a transparent skirt and veil, red of course. She wore no bra, leaving her breasts bare. Under the veil, you could see her grinning.


“Now then.” She says. “Let’s seal this deal.” You back away as she seductively walks towards you, until she pushes you and you fall back onto her velvet bed. “Wait a minute!” You say. “I barely even know you, and you want to lay with me as soon as you get me in your room?” Morgana smiled slyly. “So? That sure didn’t seem to bother you when you reared that fox queen and her subjects.” You blush at the thought that she knew about that.


“Besides, the queen was the one you did it with first, was it not?” You nodded. “That’s how you became her king. In doing so, you became engaged to her. That’s the how it works here. None of your silly human customs of “dating” or “weddings”. Seeing as your previous wife has been turned to stone, that engagement is now void. Now, you will be engaged to me, right here, right now.”


She suddenly leaps at you with full force, pinning you to the bed with her on top of you. “I should warn you.” She says as she slides the robe from your shoulders and slices off your shirt with one of her golden claws. “I tend to get a little, shall we say, aggressive.” You gulp. somehow you knew she was going to say that.


(Sorry, folks, but you’ll just have to imagine what happens here. I don’t write hardcore stuff like that.)


You lay beneath the velvet sheets of Morgana’s bed, breathing heavily, with the goddess herself curled tightly against you, with one arm wrapped around you. your clothes and her outfit lay strewn across the floor. She was purring softly in her sleep. You guess she must be satisfied with you. She wasn’t kidding when she said she got “aggressive”. Your back had eight long vertical cuts, from Morgana digging her claws into your back. Your torso was also covered in several smaller cuts, some of them still bleeding. There were also many bite marks and hickeys on your neck and shoulders from Morgana’s little “Love Bites”.


It was done. You now belong to Morgana. “Mihal………forgive me.” You whisper these words just before you pass out, from blood loss or exhaustion, you couldn’t tell.
1121111112.title: Morgana won

11211111122.content:
You slowly woke up, everything was the same as it had been for the last 15 years. Morgana was holding onto you tightly half your body clutched against hers while her one of her arms possesively held onto over the other half. You reached over and began gently stroking behind her ears, despite her...nature she seemed to very much enjoy the small attention and she had shown you her....displeasure in waking up without you attending to her after that first day. After a minute you finally felt Morgana start to stir, her arms tensing for a second as she pulled your face up against hers as she playfully nipped at your ear. Despite your inner protests you couldn't help but stare as she stretched, each powerful muscle unwinding, her tail flicking lazily behind her. "Um...I think armour would look good"

"Mmmm, fur it is then" she says turning around, she walks back towards you and offers her hand. You slowly take it and she lifts you up off the bed and onto the floor, just like that first morning your body tingles for a second and you find yourself clothed in her favourite attire for you, a simple red t-shirt and a pair of black shorts, you could tell she liked to see as much of you as possible. She turned around and walked towards the door, expectant as always that you would simply follow, you quickly caught up with her. although you trailed slightly behind her, she stops for a second and starts again as you walk beside her "so love, today's quite special, do you know why?"

"It's been 15 years"

"That's right, it's been 15 years since I won the right to be your mate" she says smiling, "you'll get a suprise this afternoon"

"A surprise?"

"Yes, a surprise" she says the conversation tapering off as the two of you enter the dining hall. The two guards saluted inside the dining hall saluted shutting the doors behind the two of you, although you know they were smiling as they eyed you. You couldn't help but give off a small smile, the looks were all due to Morgana's "boon." Every 5 years if everyone who served her didn't try anything such as trying to kill her, each of them would get to pick a gift, of course they couldn't pick their freedom..but otherwise she was pretty lenient. As soon as you showed up, you quickly became the only boon they wanted, since most of the guards and servants for the matter were female. Morgana of course wouldn't let any of them keep you, but she didn't mind letting them sleep with you as long as she got you for the 2 days afterward. Given there were 100 servants/guards in Morgana's home her system worked...well enough, it wasn't like you were ever asked your opinion though. "Love, what would you like for breakfast?" Morgana asks as you seat yourself next to her.

"Whatever works"

"Oh come now, there's nothing special you want on this day, roast pig? duck? those waffle things i've heard of?"

"Whatever you'd like will be fine"

"Very well, I think we'll have some sausage and pancakes, mmm and make sure the sausages are nice and bloody" Morgana says to a mouse girl who runs off to inform the cooks, Morgana turns to smile at you a soft purr starting to escape from her lips. You noticed a fox girl standing just in the edge of your vision, she seemed quite nervous, you lock eyes with her and indicate she could move closer. "Mistress....you forgot to mention what you and our lord would like to drink"

"Oh, I did, thank you Julianna" Morgana says turning to face the fox "Hmmm....I think I'll just have some milk, love what about you?"

"Just some orange juice if you have it thanks" The fox girl nods and smiles at you for a second before turning and hastily heading to the kitchen so your drinks could be delivered with the rest of breakfast. Morgana leans over and puts her head near you, her sign that she wanted some attention, you reach over and gently start stroking behind her ears. Within a few minutes you and a purring Morgana are interrupted by the sound of glasses and plates being placed down on the table. Julianna and Marie (the mouse girl) smile slightly as they place they step back from the prepared meal, you give them a gentle nod to tell them for now they are dismissed and they leave as Morgana starts to dig into her food. After the meal a cat anthro slowly walks up to Morgana and whispers something into her ear, she smiles from one ear to another and you knew what that meant.

"Love it seems there's a battle going on, I'm sorry but you're going to have to take care of yourself for a while" You nod in reply as she stands up following the cat to her "viewing room" which was basically a room with a giant version of the mirror she gave you, although this one had an enchantment that let it actually search for battle. You gave off a small sigh as the doors closed and slumped back into the chair, feeling around in the pocket of the pants you find Morgana's mirror, since whatever was in the clothes seemed to go with them when they disappeared. You think hard about your children and an image appears in the mirror, like you they had just finished eating breakfast, you smiled as you saw them, they had grown so much in the 15 years you had been gone. Thankfully a snake by the name of Silithera had taken over the job of monarch and the island as a whole took care of your children but you still missed them. Your thoughts slowly turned to Mihal and the mirror shimmered for a second before showing her form, still petrified and sitting on her throne. You sigh as you put the mirror in a pocket and slowly stand up.

You had learned the layout of the castle by heart and so you were easily able to find the gardens, compared to every other part of the castle which was old as the goddess herself, the gardens were relatively new, you had requested them and were then quite surprised when Morgana built them, although she'd never go in them "too peaceful" she said. You enjoyed just strolling through the beds of flowers and laying otu on the grass, and so did most of the servants when they weren't performing duties. You lay there for a while simply enjoying the silence and safety of the gardens. The tranquility was broken by....

112111111221.title: Morgana

1121111112211.content:
While you appreciated all the things Morgana has done for you, and you do admit that you have grown attracted to her a little, you were attracted to Mihal a LOT. She even gave you kids, something you thought you'd never want, but now you're missing them more and more. A tear went down your face as you remembered the good times. That settled it. You had to get out of there. You remember seeing a cool trick on the internet back when you lived on earth. When someone is in a deep sleep, you can ask then even the most personal question, but their subconscious mind would tell you everything.

"Morgana, sweetheart." you say softly.

"Yes, my love." she says absentmindedly.

"How do I get back to Anthronia?" you ask.

"It's simple," she says. "For someone other than me to transport to the mortal world, they simply go to the center of my palace with a strand of my hair and concentrate on where they want to go."

You then remember the coat full of Morgana's hair that she gave you. "Thanks." you say. You couldn't believe that it worked. You make your way to the spot that Morgana mentioned and did what she said. Sure enough, you were in Anthronia's castle throne room, right in front of Mihal's petrified figure. You were overjoyed to be back home. Just then, you see two anthros walk into the room. They were your kids!

"Hey, you two!" you say excitedly.

"Who are you?" Kevin asks.

"Wait, I know him..." Yasmin says. She slowly walks over to you and kneels down, so she can get to eye level with you. "Dad?" she says. "Is that you?"

"It is me." you say. Kevin rushes over to you and he and Yasmin give you a big hug. "We missed you so much!" Yasmin says.

The entire island was soon informed of your return. There was a great feast and everything. Then after the feast, Yasmin and Kevin wanted to talk to you in private.

"What did you guys want to talk to me about?" you ask

"We know that Morgana will eventually come back for you." Yasmin started.

"And we're gonna train extremely hard for when that day comes." Kevin said.

"That is out of the question!" you say. "I already lost your mother! I'm not losing you guys, too!"

"But if we win, we'll bring Mama back." your daughter retorted.

"Even so, there's no point. Morgana's tied up with unbreakable rope. There's no way she'll come back." you say.

"How did you get to tie her up with rope?" Kevin asks.

Knowing that your kids were fifteen years old, you decided not to tell them how. "It's not important." you say.

"We have to be ready, dad." Yasmin says one last time. You then see the determination in your kids' eyes. "Fine." you say.

So how long does it take for Morgana to return?

First of all, you were scared of when Morgana would come back for you. Secondly, you were afraid of your kids suffering a worse fate than Mihal. One night, you were roaming the halls of the palace when Yasmin approached you. "Dad, can talk to you for a second?" she asks.

"Of course." you say.

The two of you went to Yasmin's room, which was actually Mihal's old room. Being there made you a little sad, but you didn't let that distract you from Yasmin.

"Dad, I never got to actually tell you how much I really missed you." Yasmin said. "I can't remember a night where I didn't cry myself to sleep. When I finally found out what really happened to you, it only made it worse for me. I thought that you were just gone, but to know that Morgana had you this whole time... it really hurt me to know that you were being held against your will." She was holding back tears with every word. "Kevin was depressed, too, but I was even more so. I'll never forgive Morgana for what she did. I have to do this"

You were on the verge of crying, yourself. "Listen, Yasmin. I didn't want you and Kevin to do this at first because I was fearing for your lives."

"Mama would've wanted us to." your daughter says.

"I know. That's why I said yes in the end." you say. "I want you to know that I wish you the best of luck, and no matter what happens, I'll still love you and Kevin."

Yasmin gives you a hug. "I love you too."

The next day, the moment that you've been fearing finally came. Morgana came back for you, and she was furious. You, Kevin, and Yasmin were in the throne room, looking at Mihal's petrified form when out of nowhere, Morgana appears.

"How dare you leave me tied up like that!" she howls. "I can't believe you'd betray my trust like that!"

"How did you get her tied up?" Kevin asks. You didn't want to tell your fifteen-year-old kid that Morgana was tied up because it was part of a love game. "It's not important." you say.

"I agree." Morgana says. "What is important is that I take you back home with me. And this time, I won't be so nice to you!"

Kevin and Yasmin jump in between you and Morgana. "YOU'RE NOT TAKING OUR FATHER ANYWHERE!" they simultaneously scream.

"Don't waste my time, you brats." the goddess says with a chuckle. "I can take you both down in a duel easily."

"Wanna bet on that?" Kevin retorts.

Morgana looks at you. "Your son has quite the mouth, sweetie."

"Watch who you're calling 'sweetie'!" Yasmin yells.

"You two want to die so badly, then fine. Name your terms. What do you want if you win." Morgana asks

"You know damn well what we want!" your daughter says. "Free our mother and stay away from our dad."

"Fair enough." Morgana says. "If I win, then I get to torture the two of you to death, but not before you witness me take your father as my own once again. And one more thing, your father has to watch the battle. Deal?"

Kevin and Yasmin look at each other for a while, a little scared. But suddenly their resolve returns. "We accept!" they say in unison.

"Yasmin, lend me your crossbow." he says.

"Not so tough now, are ya?" he says, finally putting his taunting plan in play.

Now on her knees, Morgana tries to attack again, but the twins slice her remaining two limbs. The goddess now lay on the floor.

"Dad we failed now your going to be taken away..." Says Yasmin while she crys. But then you say to her.
