1121111112211221.title: Family reunion

1121111112212.content:
You looked over at the form of the sleeping goddess, while asleep she looked just like any other anthro would, her chest rising and falling. You couldn't help but wonder, how long did this Pantheon exist, how many years did Morgana stay in her castle, alone, simply because she was the goddess of war, finally having to force others to be with her for any sort of companionship. "You'll let Mihal go when if I ask, won't you?" you whisper to yourself more to solidify the thought in your mind than anything else, you undo the ropes and place them back in their case before getting redressed and laying down next to Morgana to fall asleep. As always you wake up first, Morgana's soft, warm breath falling on your neck, you reach up and scratch her ears for a few seconds before switching to her chine.A contented "mmm" telling you that Morgana was up and enjoying your attention.

"Good morning beloved" she says quickly flipping the two of you over so she was on top, she proceeded to give you a few love bites this behavior telling you that Morgana was still a bit frisky from last night. "So my beloved, would you like to have another go, last night was quite enjoyable" Morgana purrs.

You weren't sure how to proceed, although you knew from past experience that lying to Morgana was a very bad idea. "Morgana...." you start trying to come up with the right words "what would you do if I thought of leaving?" you say.

Instantly you felt her grip tighten around her, her claws unsheathing and digging lightly into your flesh "beloved, why would you ask such a thing?" Morgana asks her voice becoming cold as ice, her eyes burying into you.

"Well there's no going back now" you think. Trying your best to maintain eye contact with Morgana you stat "well...last night you were so...defenseless, I....I admit I thought of going back to..."gasp"" Morgana forcefully cut you off by lifting you up from under her by the neck in one fluid, her iron grip choking the air out of you. "You would dare even think of betraying me" Morgana says throwing you against the far wall of the chamber. You were sure you felt a few bones break as you smashed into the unyielding obsidian her castle was forged from, you slowly tried to stand back up, pain shooting through your whole body.

"Mo.." you start but you're silenced once again as she leaps across the length of the room her weight landing square on your back, the words in your throat dying to be replaced by a scream of unimaginable pain. You were just able to look up at Morgana and you swear it almost looked like she was...crying, but that, that was impossible. Morgana lifted you up by your neck again seeming to almost take pleasure in hearing your choking gasps as you struggled for breath. "I am your wife now not her" Morgana snarls "I replaced that weak woman you were with, winning you fairly in a trial by combat. I have given you everything you need for the past 15 years and you would dare betray me" she roars, you swear you could feel her voice shake the entire castle, although that wasn't what was most important to you at the moment. You clutch at her hands trying to get some air.

"Mistress stop" you hear one of the servants from the direction of the doorway and in a second you feel another pair of arms on Morgana's pulling at them to release you. Morgana lets go although you were sure it was due to shock rather than anything else. You fall to the floor gasping for breath as you felt whoever had saved you lift you up slowly and cradle your head "master, master are you alright?" she asks fear and worry practically radiating from the servant. You looked up to see Julianna, the fox from yesterday looking up at Morgana with something akin to hatred Morgana reaches for you and Julianna pulls you closer to her. "Let him go" Morgana says coldly "he has betrayed me, and he must be punished for it" Morgana says.

"He has done nothing" Julianna replies "he couldn't have done that."

"He planned to leave me, to return to that woman even though I beat her fair and square" Morgana says.

"So then why is he still here, mistress you fell asleep last night bound by your own rope, dead to the world" Julianna replies. "He has also asked about...ways to stop you and your power, we have always said no, but if he asked one more time, we would have told him about everything, including the prison you built to trap and hold the other gods" Julianna says her eyes steeling as she stared up at Morgana in defiance. "If he wished to betray you, you would have woken up in your own prison, powerless, trapped there forever" she shouts. You felt Julianna's body start to shiver as she leaned down her tongue lapping slowly at a few open cuts. Morgana just stood there, her eyes focused on you, yet not really looking anywhere. Morgana reaches for you again and Julianna does something you never expected she bites Morgana, her teeth just grazing the goddesses fingers for a second before she pulled back. Morgana looked quite startled but what surprised you even more is that she didn't strike back, she just waited as Julianna tended to what wounds she could see.

Finally Morgana spoke "you have to let him go, I heard at least 5 different bones break when he hit the wall, so if they're to be fixed I must get near him" Morgana says. Julianna stares up at the goddess of war and slowly moves back, Morgana just stares at you for a few seconds before lowering one hand to your chest, it felt like your whole body was on fire for a few seconds before that feeling, as well as he pain disappeared. Morgana then got up and left, she simply walked out of the room, Julianna leaves soon after, returning with a few more of the servants who lift you up onto the bed and start tending to you. Each of them had seen you nude a few times so you didn't even flinch as they stripped you and started to tend to you, first washing away any excess blood before redressing you. Most of the servants left however 5 of Morgana's guard came and stood in front of the door.

Next thing you knew Kayla the head of the guard was shaking you, you had to have fallen back asleep "my lord, Morgana wishes to see you, should we let her in" she asks. This shocked you as this was the first time you had ever heard one of the guards or servants call Morgana by name. You slowly nod and she quickly walks back to the door giving the command to let Morgana in. She walks in, eyeing the guards and Kylie who follow her as she walks up to you.

"Well, you've turned my entire staff against me, although I thought they had lost their will to fight, so this is good. She says a small smile forming on her lips."However since everyone seems to believe you have a reason for what you said I will allow you to explain" Morgana says.

You start slowly "I said I thought of betraying, and I did, however as Julianna said, I couldn't go through with it. How long have you lived?" you ask.

Morgana looks quite surprised by the question "Since the creation of our people of course" she says.

"How many husbands or lovers have you had before me?" you ask.

Morgana looks even more stunned and she slowly starts to snarl before a sword temporarily against her throat silences her "none" she replies sullenly. You could see this shocked each of the guards but it was as you suspected.

"So I'm the first, the first source of companionship, stability, of joy, and love you've had" you say staring up at her. Slowly you could see her weakening her tail and ears drooping and her body as her body started to shake.

"Y...yes" she says her voice faltering for the first time. She just stares at you for a few seconds before pouncing, her weight falls on top of you but instead of tearing into you, you felt her arms wrap around you in a death hug. "Please beloved, don't leave me" she cries, visible tears and a voice full of anguish stopping the guards "I have been so alone, first having to steal souls to be servants for me when the rest of the Panthenon had willing souls lining up, then I had to steal you from that woman" she hugs you tightly her tears falling onto you as she buried her muzzle in your chest.

"Morgana I never planned to leave you" you say slowly, "I realized you were so alone and I could never leave you" you say gently stroking her back. Morgana slowly lifts her head, her eyes meeting yours. "Morgana I love you" you say softly "however for me to let go, I need you to free Mihal, so I know my children will have at least one parent to raise them" you say. Morgana slowly nods and snaps her fingers "her curse is lifted" she says.
1121111112212.title: You couldn't betray Morgana's trust, bu...

11211111122121.content:
You and Morgana go to her overwatch room, where she showed you what has happened on Anthronia. As promised,the curse on Mihal was lifted, and the entire island was in celebration. Unfortunately, after all the celebration, you see Mihal and your two kids in the throne room, looking sadly at a statue. You then see that it was a statue made in your honor. Mogana had left before she was able to see this, though.

Seeing what you just thought made you reevaluate your situation. You realize that you have feelings for both Mihal and Morgana.

You loved Mihal because of how kind she was. She even gave you two kids, something you thought you never wanted to have.

And even though Morgana practically stole you from Mihal, she had genuine affection for you, too. She only did what she did because she was so lonely.

So now there are two parts of you: the part that wants Mihal and the one that wants Morgana. The part that wants Mihal is thinking that you only love Morgana out of pity, and the part that wants Morgana is thinking that you only feel committed to Mihal because you had kids with her.

You need to make a choice. Who's it gonna be?
11211111122121.title: Torn Between Two Women

11211111122122.content:
Before you had time to even register what Morgana had said the room was filled with a brilliant light, which faded after a second. From this light stepped what had to be one of the Pantheon as divine was the only word to describe the lioness that had suddenly appeared in the room, although you couldn't quite remember just who she was.

"I am Mushana, goddess of love and family" the lioness says, most likely reading your mind, her voice sounding almost amused. She walked right past Morgana to stand over you, and reaching down began to stroke your head "quite an interesting human, winning not only the heart of the goddess of war, but also the queen of our people" she says. Strangely enough Morgana just eyed the other figure, making no move to stop her.

"What is it you want Mushana?" Morgana asks staring up at the other goddess.

"Not much" she shrugs stepping back from you "I am just here to inform you of a request made onto me, although she hasn't been freed long, the queen of the anthros has petitioned me for a rematch with you Morgana. She states that the only reason you won was because you are the goddess of war, and if you were mortal, she would have won" Mushana states. "I as well as the majority of the Pantheon are inclined to believe her, and we are considering allowing her that rematch, with the stated terms of your temporary removal of divinity" Mushana says.

"What?" Morgana cries standing up quickly "How dare you interfere in my affairs, I beat that woman fair and square..." Morgana trailed off as she realized that Mushana was not staring at her but at you.

"You say you won, but did you really?" Mushana says, she snaps her fingers and before you appears a mirror like the one in Morgana's viewing room. You could see Mihal, freed from her curse, with two foxes that were almost her size, a boy and a girl hugging her, you knew they had to be Kevin and Yasmin. All three were weeping, and you weren't sure how you knew but you knew Mihal was weeping for a different reason than her children.

"Mihal" you say softly and you couldn't stop yourself,you reach up to the mirror, taking a second to gently stroke the cheek of her image, you felt a single tear trickle down your face as you withdrew your hand.

"He has always loved her Morgana, however you have won half of his heart" Mushana says putting an emphasis on half. "I do not wish to allow this rematch between you and her, as neither of you will win, and the true loser of your conflict will be him, not only will he be made to watch the two women he loves fight each other, but he will suffer the most as no matter which of you win he will lose" Mushana states waving the mirror away, her face becoming serious. "Morgana do you remember what the first wars were about?" Mushana asks.

"Of course i do, they were about men, females who were...."Morgana seemed to come to a realization and she just stopped.

"Go on Morgana" Mushana says

"Females who were co-mated thought that a male was spending more time with one or more of the partners, so they began to fight" Morgana says.

"A co-what?" you say interjecting.

"A Co-Mateship, the originally planned relationships between our people, I am about to tell you a secret which you cannot share with anyone. The population imbalance is not a flike, we created to see how a female run society would work, if it was different than a male run society, we would have made it so the birth's were 1:1, sadly however that wasn't the case. The co-mateship was the original relationship for our people after we realized our little experiment was a failure" Mushana says.

"You cannot seriously be asking me to humble myself...to...to" Morgana just stood there seething unable to finish her sentence.

"To declare Mihal your equal?" Mushana says finishing for her. "Morgana you are right she isn't your equal, you are a divine and she isn't, however she won the heart of this man instantly where it took you 15 years to take half, she has in the opinion of the whole Pantehon tied or bested you in combat depending on who you ask. You cannot deny that she is a great warrior and that at least deserves your respect as goddess of war" Mushana says.

You actually saw Morgana back down, taking a step back and you actually saw her physically resign herself "what would you have me do, and why are you telling me?" she says.

"I am asking you to simply recognize her skills and declare her as your co-mate, otherwise I will have no other course of action other than allow the match to go ahead" Mushana says.

"As you stated she is a mortal I am a divine, what would you have me do when she perishes, as she will" Morgana replies.

Mushana smiled "you have taken this human as your king, and since you will have recognized her as your equal in combat, why would you not make her the personal guard to you and your husband" Mushana says.

"Every guard here is our guard" Morgana replies.

"Then the captain of your guard" Mushana counters..

Morgana looked over at Kayla the girl stepping forward "I, am the head of Morgana's guard" she states. "However if it would make my lord happy, I would gladly work as the second in command as his first wife took my place" she says.

Morgana sighs "very well, I shall name her my co-mate" she states glaring at the other goddess.

"Excellent" Mushana says, "now you just have to convince Mihal to do the same, you have until this evening" she says before disappearing in another flash of light.

"Morgana..." you say slowly, she turns and walks back to you laying herself down in your arms.

"You said you'd let her go" she says sadly sounding quite hurt.

"I thought I could, I'm sorry" you say stroking her cheek gently. Morgana leans up and gently licks at your face, your lips soon meeting as you gently kissed.

"Did I do the right thing?" she asks.

"I know this may sound a bit selfish, but I think you did" you reply. Morgana starts to lightly purr and you spend a few minutes simply stroking her ear-to-tail. Finally she stands up, "Kayla prepare the guards, and have the servants gather up the most valuable items in the castle...if we are going to go and meet this woman I wish to show I mean her no ill will, given....how we last crossed paths" Morgana says. Kayla nods and she as well as the rest of the guard leave Morgana turning on you as soon as they are gone. She smiles down at you "I love you beloved, and I will do anything for you" she says laying back down atop you a smile forming on her lips.

"I love you too Morgana" you reply.

"Would you mind holding me?" she says. You open your arms and she buries herself, sensing that the two of you were alone she starts to cry, releasing countless years of sadness and loneliness. You stroke her back as she weeps "Morgana I'll always be here for you from now on my beloved" you whisper. You felt her gently hug you and she stayed like that for a good 10 minutes simply letting all her feelings out before detaching herself.

"We should probably get dressed" she says.walking over to the dresser. She pulls out a red dress and what looked like a suit which she throws to you.

"Where did you get this?" you ask.

"A girl has to have a few secrets" Morgana replies, you quickly get dressed,before leaving the bedroom and heading for the main hall of the castle. You meet up with the servants and the guards, each servant carrying a small sack of things and the guards all dressed for battle. Morgana snaps her fingers and the next thing you knew the whole group was standing outside of Mihal's castle.

112111112.content:
Mihal raises her fist, ready to connect it with Morgana’s nose. Suddenly there is a loud bang like thunder, and a bright flash of blinding white light. As your vision clears, you see you are in a grand council room of marble. Several thrones lined in a half-circle dominate the room


In each seat sits an anthro animal, about Mihal’s size. In the center of the room sat Morgana in a chair of black marble, with golden chains restraining her in place. You stood on Mihal’s shoulder, who like wise stood next to Morgana.


“Morgana, you have gone way out of line.” Says one of the anthros, a snowy owl in a blue toga. “This court will decide your fate.” You whisper into Mihal’s ear. “Who are these guys?” Mihal whispers back, “They are the Pantheon, the goddesses of my people.”


Morgana struggled against her bonds. “Give it up.” Says a bear goddess in a black leather garb. “I forged those chains myself. Not even one of us can break them.” A swan in pink robes unfurled a scroll and read, “Morgana, you are charged with attempting to steal another’s mate, interfering in the affairs of mortals, and directly causing the death of innocent souls. You yourself have confessed to these crimes.”


“Therefore…..” Says a wolfess in a green dress, “You are hereby sentenced to a century in Kasma.”


“This is an outrage!” Says Morgana. “No, it is the law.” Says the owl. “Now, you will suffer for it.” “Excuse me.” You say. Everyone looks in your direction. “Who is this mortal who dares interrupt us?” Says one of the Pantheon, you didn’t see who.


“I am the husband of Empress Mihal.” You say. “You are a human, are you not?” Asks the wolf. “Yes.” You say. “The same humans who poison my seas?” Asks a blue scaled hydra. “And pollutes my skies?” Says an eagle. “And destroys my forests?” Says a doe.


“Please, listen to me.” You say. “I know humans have made mess of the earth, but we’re not all bad.” You say. “Now, Morgana has killed many of my wife’s people, tried to steal me from her, and even harmed our own children. Therefore, I think it would be a more fitting punishment for her to be stripped of her powers and godhood, and be put in the custody of Mihal to decide her punishment.”


There is a murmur of agreement among the Pantheon as some of them nod. “All in favor of this human’s proposal?” Asks the owl. The entire court raises their hands. “Very well.” Says the owl. “Morgana, your fate will be decided by Empress Mihal. You are banished to the earth and stripped of your godhood until further notice. Your plague upon the anthronians shall also be undone.”


There is another bright flash as you are back in the Mihal’s throne room. There at Mihal’s feet stood Morgana, now at your size, her powers gone. Mihal raised her foot and brought it down on top of Morgana, pinning her under her toe.


“So now you’re mortal.” Says Mihal with a sneer. “You don’t deserve to be mortal. Anything short of death is too good for you. You’re lucky my husband changed the Pantheon’s minds about sending you to Kasma, therefore, you owe him your life.”

“What is Kasma?” You ask. “It is a place of punishment.” Says Mihal. “When a wicked soul dies, they are sent there to be punished for the evils they commited in life. For example, a greedy soul could be forever crushed beneath a mountain of gold coins. This vile creature.” She says while pressing down on Morgana with her toe, “Might have ended up in an endless medow, with no one to fight or wage war against, only eternal peace. For her, that would be the worst punishment of all.”


Mihal stares down at Morgana, who is trying desperately to lift Miahl’s toe off of her. “Now, since the Pantheon put me in charge of you, what would be a fitting punishment for you? She ponders this for several moments until, “I’ve know just what to do with you.”
