You make your way in, going down the long hall until you come to a wide cavern, full of stalagmites and stalagtites. It is here that the torches end, and you see only darkness before you. You take a torch from its bracket on the wall and continue deeper into the cave.

By now you must be hundreds of feet below the island, and those amazons wouldn't dare to look for you in here. Suddenly, you could swear you could hear faint voices. Whispers. You can't make out what they are saying.

A gust of wind suddenly bows out your torch! Now you stand in darkness. Where did that wind come from anyway? suddenly, you can make out a faint blue light ahead about a hundred yards ahead of you. You don't know what it is, but it's got to be better than standing here in the dark.

You make your way towards the light, tripping over several stalagmites on the way. Finally you find the source of the light, and are amazed at what you see.

It's an entire underground city! Stone buildings and and houses fill the entire cavern. A gigantic blue crystal is attached to the ceiling, radiating a dim blue light that illuminates the whole place. You stand at the top of a stone staircase leading down into the city. You can't believe your eyes! This whole place must be thousands of years old, if not more!

The entire city seems deserted. You haven't seen a single living thing since you got here. You take a look into one of the stone houses. It is a single room, filled with various objects, such as weapons, jewlery, furniture, etc. In the center of the room is a long rectangular stone box, covered in strange carvings. A coffin

You notice that all the other buildings are pretty much the same as this one. Then you realize what this place is. It's a tomb! A city of the dead! This is the amazon's burial chamber!

Then you hear those faint voices again. But this time you can understand them. "Who dares disturb us?" In front of you, a figure begins to appear. At first you can only make out the outline of a body, but then it appears in full form. A transparent cheetah amazon appears from thin air in front of you.

Behind her, thousands of other spirits appear. Every animal you can think of is there. Canines, feline, birds, reptiles, etc. "who dares enter the city of the dead?" Says the cheetah. She sounds mad.

Suddenly the cave has gone very cold, and you see your breath as you speak. "I.....I.....I was just trying to h....h....h...hide from the hunters." You stammer. You really hope these ghosts can;t hurt you.

"Ah. So you are an outsider." Says the cheetah. "Grab him!" Two of the ghosts grab your arms and they all carry you to a black stone tample at the back of the city. You pray that whatever happens, you get out of here alive.

Inside the temple, there is a enormous black throne with the skeletal remains of a gigantic anthro bat. The cheetah emerges from the crowd of ghosts and approaches the skeleton. "Lord of the Dead." She says. "What shall we do with this outsider?"

There is a chill in the air and a guest of wind, as a whispering voice echos though the room.
14311.title: The Cave

choices: You hear the hunters outside the hut
14312.content:
You make your way over to the ruined hut. It is a bamboo and straw house ready to crumble to the ground, you doubt anyone has lived here for years. You step inside to see the interior isn't any better than the outside. A fire pit with a huge cauldron is in the center of the hut, with various objects hanging from the ceiling, stick figures, bottles, bones.

Wait a minute, bones? Various animal skulls hang on ropes from the rafters. Jars of various spices and ingredients on shelves line the walls. You take a closer look, and see some of the jars contents are quite frightening. Eyeballs, tongues, etc.

You decide perhaps it would be better to find another place to hide. But as you turn around, a dark figure is standing in the doorway of the hut. It is a grey wolf with long black hair, dressed in a black robe. "What are you doing in my house?" She asks menacingly.

"I.....uh......" You are too scared to speak right. You steps toward you, and sniffs you. "What are you?" She asks. "Hu....hu.....human." You stutter. "Human? Never heard of a human before. But whatever you are, you must be an outsider."

She snaps her fingers, and you suddenly can't move! You're frozen as still as a statue! "And if you're an outsider, then that means you are being hunted, right?" You are unable to answer. She turns around and begins taking down various jars off the walls.

"I've never had human before, but I'm sure you'll make a fine stew." Stew!? She's gonna make you into stew!? She snaps her fingers again, and a fire lights under the cauldron in the center of the room, and the cauldron is instantly full of yellow broth.

She begins adding various ingredients into the broth. "Don't bother hoping the hunters will find you first. They won't come near this place, because they know I live here, and they wouldn't dare trespass. You see, I was banished from the city. I was once the empress's royal magician, but they found out I was turning citizens into food."

She pulls out a knife and begins slicing carrots as she continues. "It's been a long time since I've had a proper meal. I've had to live off of fruit and fish. But I'm sure you'll do just fine."

You begin sweating with fear as she continues adding vegetables to the soup. You pray that you'll somehow make it out of this alive.
14312.title: The Abandoned hut

choices: Hunters find you in the night!
14313.content:
You decide to try and find a different hiding place. They would probably expect you to hide in either of those places anyway. You run through the jungle for what seems like a long time. Your legs are exhausted, your lungs are burning, and you're covered in sweat. They must have sent the hunters in after you by now.


You slow down to a walk, when your suddenly trip. You look down to see a vine wrapped around your ankle. You sit back up and try to get it off, but it only tightens. You tug and tear at it for several minutes, but by now it's starting to cut off the circulation to your foot.


You hear footsteps approaching from behind. It must be one of the hunters! You draw your knife and turn around. There, looking down at you is a ten foot tall, anthro doe. She is dressed in a skirt made of palm leaves, the same for her top. She has hands, and hooves instead of feet. On her head is a crown of olive leaves, like a Roman emperor. Two points stick out from the top of her skull, they look more like Hershey Kisses than antlers.


Two eyes as green as her outfit stare down at you half curious, half demanding. "Who are you? What you you doing in my jungle?" She demands. "I......I......I was being hunted." You stammer. "I didn't know this was your jungle."


Her face softens. She snaps her fingers, and the vine around your leg releases you. " I'm sorry about that." She says as she helps you up. "I don't like intruders in my jungle." You put your knife back in its sheath. "Do you have a name?" She asks.


"Jake." You tell her. "What about you?"


She smiles. "I have a name, but you couldn't possibly pronounce it."


"Try me." You say.


She tells you her name. She was right, you couldn't possibly say it. It had to have at least forty syllables!


She giggles upon seeing your confused face. "You can just call me Kri." She takes your hand and you follow her through the jungle. You notice all the ferns and bushes that are in your way instantly part upon her approach, then reform as she passes.


"How are you doing that?" You ask. "Magic." She says simply. "You see, my name, my real name, means Lady of the Jungle. I am the goddess of this place." "You're a goddess!?" You exclaim. "Yes. I give life to all plants on this island. Look."


She reached down and picked up a seed off the ground. She holds it in front of you, and you watch as it instantly begins growing into a flower. "Without me, this place would wither and die." She says. "That's why the inhabitants of this island respect my children."


"Children?" You ask. "Yes. I consider all vegetation on this island my children. The people in the city, they know not to harm them, or there will be dire consequences. Believe me, I can do much worse than cause a drought or have my babies stop producing food for them."


"Like what?" You ask. "Like grow giant carnivorous plants and have them overgrow the city, devouring everything in site, leaving nothing but ruins behind." You stare at her in shock. "But They give me no reason to do such a thing." She says laughing a bit. "They leave me offerings at my shrine, and I give them a bountiful harvest."


You both continue walking, as you talk. "Don't worry about those hunters." She says. "They won't dare harm you, as long as you're with me. I detest killing any living thing, even for food. There's plenty of fruits and vegetables on the island, what do they need meat for?"


Soon, night falls. "So where do you live?" You ask. "This entire jungle is my home. Just curl up anywhere." You lay down on a pile of palm leaves and close your eyes. "Don't worry, I'll be watching you." says Kri, as everything goes black.
14313.title: The Lady of the Jungle

143132.content:
As you wake up a few hours later, you smell burning wood. You open your eyes, and there are three amazons sitting around a fire in front of you! Then you realize you hands and feet have been tied together. Where was Kri!?


The three hunters are all felines. One is a panther, with long black hair and a scar across her right eye. The second is a lioness, with sandy hair in braids. The third is a cheetah, with black hair in a long ponytail.


They seem to be arguing about something. "I saw him first, so he's mine!" Says the panther. "You only heard his snoring! I'm the one who found where he was sleeping!" Says The lioness. "why don't we just share him?" Suggests the cheetah. "We each get him for a day in turns, then start of over again and again."


As they continue to argue, the panther turns around and sees you. "So you're awake." She says. She picks up her spear from beside her and strides over pointing it at you, the tip centimeters from your cheek. "Mistress Kina said whoever finds you gets to do whatever they want with you." She says, lightly pressing the spear tip to your skin. You can feel the cold, golden point slowly going deeper into your flesh.


"I was thinking of making you my little slave." She says grinning. "We found him, so we all get him!" Says the lioness. "Shut up!" Snaps the panther. "I wasn't talking to you." She bends down until her face is above yours. "Or maybe, I could just eat you right here." She gives your cheek a long lick. You shiver at the touch of her rough tongue.


You hear voice inside your head. It sounds like Kri's. "Don't worry. I will not let them harm you." The panther grins and extends a clawed finger to your cheek. "What's wrong? Don't like to be touched?" She quickly runs her claw across you cheek, leaving a thin cut. You yelp in surprise.


"Get used to it my slave." she says. "You're going to be my slave for more than just housework. And I like it rough." The lioness and cheetah stand up. "For the last time, he's ours too!" They say at the same time. "You and what army?" Responds the panther snarling.


They all face each other, arguing again. They start getting physical, pushing and clawing at each other. They're so engrossed in their fight, they don't notice the vine snaking along the ground towards them. It wraps around the cheetah's ankle and yanks, pulling her feet out from under her and dragging her into the jungle.


The remaining two grab their spears and look around in fear. The lioness walks wearily towards the edge of the clearing. a large flower pod burst up from the ground. It opens to reveal a long sharp barb, that it shoots straight into the lioness's neck. The lioness falls over backwards, out.


Now only the panther is left. She looks from side to side, spinning around and around, eyes wide open for any threat. Suddenly, roots spring up from under her, curl around her legs, and pull her into the ground. She screams in panic, desperately cutting at the roots with her claws. But for each one she cuts, two more grow in its place.


Now only her head is sticking out of the ground. She wriggles her body around under the soil, but can't get free. The vines tying your arms and legs slacken, and you are able to free yourself and run off.


You run for several minutes through the jungle, with only the moon to light your way. You look behind you, to see if they are following, and WHAM! You run straight into something.


You fall back on your rear, look up, and see what you ran into was Kri. "She smiles and extends a hand to help you up. "I told you I wouldn't let them hurt you." She pulls you onto your feet.


"That was you?" You ask. "Of course." She responds. "You didn't think i'd abandon you, did you?"


"But why did you leave in the first place?" You ask, a little mad. "I had just gone for a minute to get a drink from a nearby stream. I'm sorry, that was very irresponsible of me." She takes your hand and you follow her. "From now on, you're not leaving my side."


"But I thought you hate killing?" You ask. as she leads you deeper into the jungle. "I didn't kill them. They are merely.........incapacitated. They'll be fine."


She brings you to a cave in the side of a mountain. "It should be safer in here." She gathers a pile of palm leaves and grass for you to lay on. You curl up on the "bed" and doze off again. Kri sits ten feet away from you leaning against the cave wall. "No mistakes this time. I'll watch him all night if I have to."
143132.title: Hunters find you in the night!

1431321.content:
You wake up to the sight of a fire in front of you, Kri sitting across from you behind it. "Sleep well?" She asks. You nod and sit up. "Well, we're going to be here a while. So you might as well get comfortable. Here, have some breakfast." She pushes a stack of large green leaves toward you.


"No offense." You say. "But humans don't eat leaves." "Trust me." She says. "You'll like them." You pick one up and nibble on the end. To your surprise, she was right! It tasted like sugar. You continue to eat the rest happily.


"So, any ideas on what we could do while we're here?" She asks. "Well," you say. "You're a godess, you must have some interesting stories to tell." She smirks. "Indeed I do. I'll tell you about the other deities of this island."


She tells you about how there are several other godesses that the amazons worship. "There are many of us, but only females. In order to reproduce, we must mate with mortal men, but that hasn't happened in a very long time, do to the male population steadily declining, until there were none left. Each of us prevails over certain things. Such as Mushana, the lioness godess of Love and Fertility, and Thanatra, the bat godess of Death."


You nod, listening intently. "One case of a godess falling in love with a mortal happened with me." She says sadly. "You were in love?" You ask. "Long ago. IT was when this island was just a barren patch of land, and the city was a mere village. I loved him dearly, but one of the other godesses, my sister Jagara, killed him out of jealousy. I buried his body, and cried over it. When my tears hit the ground, trees and ferns sprung from the earth, spreading all over the island. That is when I vowed to protect the jungle I created, and never let a single living thing come to harm in it. Of course, Jagara had a different idea."


"What is Jagara a godess of?" You ask. "She is the Lord of the Hunt." Replies Kri. "So as you can guess, me and her have never gotten along. Even before she killed my love. In fact, those hunters from earlier and probably praying to her to help them hunt you. For your sake, I hope not. She has a golden bo and arrow that never misses, not to mention her sacred spear."


You gulp. "Don't be scared." Says Kri. "You shall not come to harm, as long as you stay in this cave." Just then you both heard voices coming from the cave entrance. "Could they be in there?" Asked one. "Most likely." Relied another, more menacing voice. "Prey will often hide when it is being stalked. I will go in first, you stay here in case the run by."


Kri quickly waves her hand, and the fire extinguishes. You sit there in the dark in silence. You pray to your own god, that whoever is coming, it's not Jagara, and that they can't see in the dark.
1431321.title: Origins and Godesses

14313211.content:
It is completely black inside the cave. The only thing you can see is dark. You hold your breath, praying that whoever is coming in, they don't find you. You hear nothing. Whoever is coming, they must be very silent. Probably a feline.


Then you hear a faint breathing noise. It's getting closer............ And closer.............Now it's right next to you, the hot breath blasting your face. "Hello, mortal." Says a voice, and your heart skips a beat.


You hear the sound of a knife being pulled from its sheath, and a quick flash of gold as whoever it is raises the blade in the air. Suddenly, the fire bursts back to life, and there standing before you, is who you were hoping not to meet.


She is a cheetah, ten feet tall, dressed in a short red skirt and tube top. A necklace of long sharp claws is around her neck. Over her eyes is what looks like half of a skull, like a mask, adorned with black feathers. Across her back is a golden bow and arrows.


Jagara.


She grins as she raises a large, curved, golden dagger, ready to gut you like a fish. Suddenly, a long vine covered in thorns flies from the darkness behind her. It wraps around her wrists and her hand goes limp, dropping the knife as it clatters to the floor.


She spins around, sneering. There in the corner oc the cave is Kri, an angry look on her face, and in her hand, the thorn vine, curled like a whip. "You will not harm him!" She says angrily. Jagara snarls. "You would protect him? An outsider?"


"Yes!" Says Kri. "And he's not just an outsider. He's my mate!" Before you can object, you hear Kri's voice in your head. "Play along." Jagara smirks. "Mate? Another one? Well that's just even more of a reason to kill him."


"You will not!" Snarls Kri. "You took my love once, I will never let it happen again. Even if I have to take this to the Council, you will not have him!" Jagara sneered. "Oh really? Then how about I take you up on that? Let's go right now."
14313211.title: Hunter or Hunted?

143132112.content:
Jagara spun around to face you. She raised her non-limp hand and a golden spear appeared in her fist. She raised the spear back, preparing to impale you with it. You raised your hands in a feeble attempt to protect yourself.


Before Jagara could strike, Kri swung her thorned whip, striking Jagara in the back. Jagara dropped her spear, and fell to her knees, then fell forward, her body paralyzed. Kri rushed forward, grabbing your hand and running out of the cave with you. Jagara lay where she fell shouting curses at the both of you as you fled.


"But the hunters outside the cave!" You say. "Don't worry." Says Kri. When you reach the cave entrance, there are the three hunters from earlier. "There he is! Grab him!" Shouts the panther. All three of them leap towards you, but Kri swings her whip in a wide arc, striking all three of them. The all crumple on the ground in a heap.


You both run off into the jungle, as the three oafs lay there arguing and shouting insults. You run for what seems like forever, until you finally stop at a stream. "Take a rest." Says Kri. Your panting heavily, but Kri isn't even sweating.


You sit on a large rock and try to get your breath back. "Aren't you tired?" You ask Kri. She shakes her head. "We don't get tired." "So, what do you mean when you said you would take me before the Council?" You ask.


"I meant the Council of the Gods. They would decide if I could have you as my mate. If they didn't, Jagara would've had you." "You weren't serious about me being your mate were you?" You ask.
143132112.title: "No! Now begone!"

1432.content:
You've been hunted for a whole day now. So far, they haven't captured you, and you left a few surprises behind for those amazons. You've made yourself some camouflage out of leaves and brush. You're laying down on the ground with it covering you, as a group of hunters approach.

They are all felines, a tiger, a lioness, and a leopard. They all carry spears, with bows and arrows on their backs. They all stop when the lioness's feet are suddenly swept out from under her, and she is left hanging upside down by a vine around her ankles. You smirk to yourself. You knew being in the boy scouts would come in handy some day.

The other two laugh as the lioness orders them to cut her down. Giggling, the tigress pulls out a knife and goes to cut the vine. But when she does, the lioness falls to the ground, banging her head on a rock.

The other two laugh again. This time, the lioness is angry and attacks them both. You've heard of a catfight, but this is ridiculous! They scratch and tear at each other, biting and kicking. It's positively ferocious.

While they tear each other apart you take this chance to get up and quickly run away before they notice you. That was easy! If the other hunters are this gullible, you'll last the three days no problem!

You might want to congratulate yourself later though. Because you are about to step in- SQUISH! Quicksand. Immediatley, it begins sucking you down. You begin to panic, but dare not struggle, or you'll sink faster. Suddenly, you feel your feet hit to bottom of the pit. Your only in up to your knees. Well, that was anti-climactic.

But, the sand is too thick for you to lift your feet out of. You can call for help, and pray that when the hunters come, they are merciful, or you can try to get out yourself. What'll it be?
1432.title: Build some traps to take care of those hunters.

choices: The small hut to your left
14322.content:
You look around and find a tangle of vines hanging from a nearby tree. You grab onto two of them and pull hard. The vines are surprisingly strong. You then pull yourself upward, pulling yourself out of the quicksand. After several minutes, your feet finally come free. You then swing over to solid ground and sit down at the base of an old oak tree.

"That was exhausting." you say to yourself. You open your pack and pull out an apple. You take several bites from it before tossing it away. You then sit back and rest for while. Several hours late, night has fallen. "I'd better get a move on." you muttered to yourself, rising to your feet. You continued walking through the jungle for a while until you came across a small hut to your left. To your right, there appeared to be a campsite. Which do you choose?
14322.title: Get out yourself

choices: A furry hand grabs you from behind!
Oh no! Here they come again!
1433.content:
Apparently the hunters decided to cheat you on your head start, because an arrow flies past your head and lodges itself in a tree. You quickly scramble up the nearest tree and pray that whoever was coming, that they didn't look up.

You hear the rustling of twigs and earth on the ground as the hunter comes closer. From your perch you see it is another cobra. Not nearly as huge as the empress, but still at least three times your size. She has a quiver full of arrows across her back, and a longbow in her hands. She stops just below you, smelling the air with her tongue.

"I know you are here." She hisses. Her eyes flash red with hunger. "You better pray I don't find you firsssssst, because if I do, you're my dinner."

You draw your knife, preparing to attack her from above. You had to be quick, or else you were finished. You spring from your perch, jumping on the huge snake. She lets out a yelp of surprise as your impact forces her flat on the ground, you on her back.

You raise your knife, preparing to bury it in her skull. But she flings her long tail around and wraps it around your neck. You clutch at the tightening coils as she gets back up. She twists around and stares at you for a moment, desperatley trying to escape her grip.

You stab at the coils around your neck, but her scales are like armor, the knife doesn't do anything. Her tongue darts out of her mouth as she grins, savoring your fear.

She opens her mouth wide, enough to swallow you whole. She slowly brings you toward her gaping jaws. Then, out of desperation, when you are close enough to her face, you stab her in the eye.

She lets out a scream of pain, and her tail releases you. You waste no time running away as she held her eye, screaming and cursing.

After what seemed like forever, night falls. You find the mouth of a cave in the side of a mountain, and sit there, resting after the long day you've had. Somehow, you survived day one. Two to go. You lean against the cave wall and begin to dose off when.......
1433.title: Too late! Here they come!

choices: "You know, living her by myself gets pretty lonely." (wink)
14331.content:
Just as you begin to fall asleep, a furred hand covers your mouth from behind! Whatever has you begins dragging you backward into the cave. You try to yell, but the hand muffles your screams. Then, you hear a voice whisper in your ear. "Stop struggling. I'm not going to hurt you."

Then, you feel yourself being lifted up and held against a warm, furry body, as you are carried further into the cave. It's too dark for you to see, and the only sounds are your carrier's footsteps, and water dripping from the ceiling.

Suddenly, you can see a faint light up ahead. As you come nearer, you can see the light is a fire. The amazon carrying you sets you down on her bed, a pile of palm leaves. Now you can see her.

She is a fox, with red fur and long black hair tied in a ponytail. The fur on her hands and feet is also black. You take a look at your surroundings. The chamber is made of smooth rock. The fire in the center of the room is the only light and source of warmth. In the corner are barrels of various food and spices.

The vixen stares down at you. She sees you are a little afraid. "It's okay." She says gently. "My name is Jasmina. Who are you?" You tell her your name. "Well, (your name), Do you want to tell me what you were doing sitting on my doorstep in the middle of the night?" You tell her how you got on the island and how you were being hunted.

"Well then, you can stay with me. They won't dare come in here." She says, smiling kindly. "Why not?" You ask. "Because I am an outcast." She says, somewhat sadly. "I was banished from the city, and forced to survive in the jungle, living off whatever I can hunt and whatever washes ashore." That explains where she got those barrels of food.

"What were you banished for?" You ask. She turned her head and was silent for a moment. "I don't want to talk about it." Then you hear your stomach rumble. Running for your life really works up an appetite. Especially since you dropped your pack of food when you were fighting that cobra.

Jasmina giggles. "Hungry, huh?" She gives you a strange fruit to eat. It is round, pink, and the size of your fist. You take a bite, and find it to be the best fuit you ever tasted!. It is very juicy and sweet, like liquid sugar. You eat another three of the fruits before you are satisfied.

"You must be tired after the day you've had." Says Jasmina. She lays down on the bed of leaves with you and wraps her tail around you. You snuggle your face into her stomach, (She is three times your size), enjoying her warm soft fur. Jasmina strokes your back as you cuddle, then says.......
14331.title: A furry hand grabs you from behind!

choices: Sarina comes in and joins you
Something grabs you from under the water!
151.content:
Atop the massive throne, sits an enormous anthro skunk. She is completely black, except for around her eyes, and a white stripe going down her tail. Her hair is also snowy white, going down to the middle of her back. She is dressed in a flowing blue gown, with a golden collar and belt.

She beckons for you with a finger. "Come closer." She says. "Don't be scared." You make your way up to her throne. When you reach her foot, she reached down and picks you up, laying you down in her palm.

"Now, where did you come from?" She asks. "F....f.....Florida." You stutter, in awe at her shear size. "Florida?" She asks, puzzled. "I've never heard of that place. "America?" You ask. "No, don't know that place either." She says.

"What are you exactly?" She asks. "I'm a human." You say. "Human? What's a human?" She says, confused. "You mean you've never seen anyone like me at all?" You say, knowing the answer. "No." She says plainly. "Your the first, so called human, I, or any of us, has ever seen."

"Now, what to do with you?" She props her head on her hand, thinking. "Do you have any idea, where you are or how to get back home?" She asks. "No. I don't even have any idea what direction home is."

"Well then, you shall be our guest here then." She says, setting you down. She turn to her guards. "Take him to the steam rooms and get him cleaned up."

The guards lead you out of the throne room. You marvel at the halls of the palace as they lead you to where ever they're taking you. They seem to be a cross between Roman and Mayan architecture, with marble columns and paintings on the walls.

They guards bring you to an underground cavern, which is dominated by a gigantic natural hot spring. The guards turn and leave you to bathe. You strip off your soaked clothes and step into the spring.

The water was so warm that it completely filled the room with a steamy fog, so it was impossible to say exactly how large the spring was. You lean back against the edge, enjoying the heat after being in the cold ocean. Suddenly...........
151.title: Sarina the Skunk

choices: "Would you like me to share my bed with you?"
1511.content:
All of a sudden, you hear somebody say. "Mind of I join you."

You yelp in surprise and turn to see Sarina standing in the doorway.

"What are you doing here?" you ask, shocked.

"Well, I didn't see any harm in keeping my guest company while he bathes." she says. Wow. She's a really good hostess.

"You want to take a bath with me?" you ask in disbelief.

"Why not?" she asks. She then proceeds to take off her clothes, right in front of you. You quickly turn your back to her, not wanting to disrespect her by watching. She giggles. "Come on," she says. "There's no need to shield your eyes. Turn around."

"Do you really want me to?" you say, not believing what you heard.

"Of course." she says.

When you turn around, you're captivated by how beautiful she looked. She saunters over in your direction and gets into the bath with you. When she's settled in, she delicately picks you up and places you right above her ample chest.''Are you enjoying your stay here so far?" she asks.

'I am, actually." you say.

"Glad to hear it.' Sarina says. Then she looks at you with a slightly seductive look. "You know... I don't let men see me naked very often."

"Really?" you ask, blushing.

"Yeah, and I've never had a bath companion before." You blush even harder. Sarina lans in closer to you and says.
1511.title: Unexpected Bath Partner

1512.content:
Before you realized what was going on, you were being dragged down by...something. You didn't get a good look at it at first - you were more concerned about getting back to the surface. Thankfully, whatever was in the water with you had only grabbed one leg. You started kicking at the thing with your free leg, and the thing let go, probably surprised by your actions. You didn't care much. You could swim back up now.

You broke through the surface, and were able to get a few deep breaths of fresh air into your lungs before being grabbed and pulled down once more. This time, with air being not as great a concern, you could look down at your assailant. You saw that the thing pulling you down was a...
1512.title: Something grabs you from under the water!

15122.content:
It was hard to look at it, the creature that was pulling you down. Not because it was ugly (which it was), but because it was just so BIG. There was just no way to take all of it in at once, not that there was much to take in. The creature seemed to have a grey blob for a body - not very interesting. What was more interesting was the large tentacle wrapped around both your legs (damn, it was learning) and the giant eye it was pulling you towards.

The eye looked like that huge eye from Lord of the Rings - a giant bloodshot mix of red, orange, and yellow, complete with a black vertical slit for a pupil. The creature held you in front of this eye, and just stared at you. It may have just been oxygen deprivation, but after a certain point you started to think that it wasn't merely look at you, but it was actually looking into you. Then you "realized" it was looking at your soul. Unable to stand it anymore, you tried to scream, but were met only with a mouthful of water.

You couldn't see. You couldn't breathe. You were being filled with water. You started thrashing about, desparate to get away. Air. You needed air. You were going to die here. Unable to do anything else you passed out.

...
...

Darkness. Darkness everywhere. Were you floating or falling? Did it matter?

Gradually, you became aware of your surroundings. You were lying down on your front, on something soft. You could feel fabric on top of and beneath you, so you were probably in a bed somewhere. There was a noise you couldn't quite make out. After awhile, you realized it was a female voice, humming tunelessly.

"Mom?" you call out, not opening your eyes, not sure of anything anymore.

"Yes, dear?" The voice had been humming replied. That was comforting, somehow. It seemed vaguely familiar.

"I had this really bad dream. I was shipwrecked on this island of animal women, and they put me in a room with this huge monster, and I was drowning, and,"

You're cut off by someone gently stroking your head. "Shhhh. You're safe now. Get some rest." The female voice resumed it's humming, and doing as you were told, you drifted back into slumber.

Later

You woke up feeling a little dazed, and uncertain where you were. You open your eyes and take in the surrounding environment. It looked like an ornately decorated bedroom about the size of an airplane hangar. That's when you saw something that made it very clear that you weren't in bed. You saw the face of that giant skunk anthro grinning down at you. You had been using her as a bed! "Ah, you're awake little one. Did you sleep well?"

“Er, yes I did. Thank you. And I’d prefer that you call me “Jake”, not “little one”.”

“Very well, Jake,” the giant skunk said. “And I’d prefer that you call me Sarina.”

“Okay, Sarina. Um. How long have I been sleeping on you?”

“Oh, since we fished you out of the hot spring. Although you did wake up once, briefly,”

You realized why the voice from before seemed familiar. “You mean that was you that I was talking to?” you asked, embarrassed. “I’m really sorry about that! I-“

Once again, Sarina cut you off by stroking your head. For someone of her size, she was incredibly gentle. “There is nothing to be sorry about. You were confused, and were seeking comfort. Do not feel shame over that.”

“Oh, well thank you. But if that wasn’t a dream then…” You left the sentence hanging.

“Yes, you did almost drown, and yes, there was a giant creature looking at you. Before you ask, we know little about it. Indeed, we know little beyond that this island is built on top of it, that the Creature is so vast it is no longer capable of movement, and that it wishes to protect us when it can.” You shifted into a sitting position, getting ready to hear what she had to say. “The Creature has telepathic abilities; that’s how we know it means no harm. Over the years, others have come to this island, though you are the first human to arrive. Many of these individuals had malevolent intentions, and would have killed us if not for the Creature. It has become standard that whenever someone washes up on our island, we bring it before the Creature to stand in judgment. If they are deemed a threat, they are killed. If not, they may live.”

“And I was deemed not a threat, right?” you asked.

Sarina nodded, then scooped you up in both hands and raised you up so you were face-to-face with her. (Sort of. More like body-to-face.) “And you know what that means?” she asked in a barely-containing-excitement voice.

“No.”

“It means…YOU GET TO STAY WITH US!” she shouted. Then, before you had recovered from the sudden outburst, Sarina was nuzzling you. Rather forcefully.

“Um, Sarina? I can’t breathe,” you managed to say.

“Oh, I’m so sorry! I was just so excited! You know what? I want to make what happened earlier up to you. You and me, in my private bath! What do you think?”

What you thought was that Sarina was rather attractive. What you also thought was that she was more than a little over-excited. Trying to be tactful, you asked, “Do I have a choice?”

Sarina paused to think about this for a moment, and then cheerfully said, “Nope!” She then swiftly lowered her hands to her mid-torso, and clasped them to her body, trapping you. You could feel Sarina get up and start walking. “Don’t worry! It’ll be fine. There are no giant monsters in my bath." Sarina paused, then added in a seductive voice, "Well, unless you’re counting me, handsome.”

"It was the “handsome” that caught you off guard. You’re about to take a bath with a giant anthro skunk chick who’s a total hottie, and who thinks you're handsome?! Maybe this wasn’t such a bad thing after all…
15122.title: Meet the Beholder

151221.content:
Sarina carried you into her private bath chamber. The floor and walls were made of marble and the bath itself was rimmed in gold. Torches hanging on the walls illuminated the room. Sarina sets you down on the floor in front of her. "Go ahead and strip." she says. Then adds in a sexy voice, "Feel free to watch me if you want."

You watch as she lifts her blue gown over her head. You had to admit, even if she was a skunk, she had a very nice body. Despite being countless feet taller than you, you felt rather attracted to her. You turned and gazed in awe at the size of the bath. It was easily big enough to be a lake!

Sarina finishes taking off her clothes and steps in the bath, sighing as she feels the warmth of the hot water. She sits down in the bath, and picks you up between her fingers, and sits you in the water in front of her. You have to swim to stay above the surface

"So, tell me about this place you come from." She says. You tell her about your family and your friends. You tell her about cars and planes, electricity and nuclear power, everything. "Fascinating." She says. "And this is a whole other world across the ocean?"

"Yes." You say. "Though I can't say exactly where it is. I don't even think this island is on any map." For a moment she looks away from you, deep in thought. "I just had a wonderful idea!" She exclaims. "I will order the islands best constructors to begin building ships, enough for all the island, and then we shall sail to this land of yours...."
151221.title: Bathtime!

choices: Gathering the Anthros and Setting out for the USA
1512211.content:
Sarina: It's time we revealed ourselves.
You: Won't the humans see you as a threat.
Sarina: Not if you explain that we come in peace.
You: Tell the shipworkers to get the royal cruise ship ready. We are transporting approximately 437 anthros to North America.
Leave Negotiations with the President of the United States to me.
Sarina: Alright.
(Turns to shipworkers)
Sarina: Get the Royal Cruise ship ready and get 437 anthros to volunteer for the voyage.
Shipworker Captain: As you wish.
Get the Royal Cruise ship ready.
Shipworker: yes Captain.
You: (Turns to Sarina) This idea is perfect, now humankind and Anthrokind will be together. We might even have some humans come back with us to here.
Sarina: You're right. Our kingdom will prosper when we have humans as our allies.
You: This will be swell.
It will take 8 days to get to the USA, so we can use that time to relax.
Sarina: You're right.
1512211.title: "And reveal ourselves to you kind!"

15122111.content:
Some of the Island’s citizens volunteered almost immediately. Others were more reluctant to leave. Some of them would ask you questions about America, which was starting to annoy you, having to repeat the same answers over and over again.


The Island’s ship builders cut down the largest trees in the jungle they could find, and carved them out to make massive canoes. Each canoe had a single sail in the center of it, and each one was connected like a train by a rope. All together, there were about ten of them single file.


It took the builders about two weeks to prepare the boats, during which time, you explored the island some more, and spent some time with Sarina, who had rather taken a liking to you. Perhaps a bit too well.


She insisted that you would share her bed with her when it was time to sleep. She would lay you on her breast and gently stroke you as you fell asleep, humming a sort of lullaby. She would sometimes lick you with her long, pink tongue, saying it was how their kind showed affection. Not that it really bothered you.


Finally, the day arrived when it was time to set sail. The boats were much too small for Sarina, so she would just swim with you on her back. “But won’t you get tired?” You ask her as she step into the ocean. “Don’t worry.” she says. “I’m an excellent swimmer. Since I’m so huge, I have much more energy than your kind would have.”


She gently lays down in the water, placing you on her back. For 8 days, she swims across the ocean with the train of boats next to her. You were surprised that she could go this long without rest or food. The anthros in the boats had brought their own supply of food, but Sarina hadn’t eaten anything the entire trip.


Finally, land was in sight. There it is.” You say. “America. At least, I hope it’s America.” The caravan of boats began chatting excitedly among themselves. Of course, when you reach the shore, there’s a huge crowd gathered on the beach, having seen Sarina coming from miles away. There are countless news crew filming as Sarina places you on shore and stands up to her full height.


Reporters run up to you as the string of boats beaches on the shore, and the passengers step out. You raise your hands as the reporters are asking a million questions at once. “Please! Please! One at a time!”


“What are these strange beings?” Asks a woman holding a microphone up to you. “They are humanoid animals, from the island of Anthronia.” You say. “I was stranded on their island and they took care of me. I told them about the outside world, and brought them here. The giant skunk behind me is named Sarina. She is their ruler.”


The cameras pointed up at Sarina who smiled and waved. “They come in peace I assure you.” You continue. “ They hope to join human society and mean absolutely no harm. I’m sure that everything will be just fine once you get to know them.”


Option 1: Everything goes well! The anthros are accepted in human society as citizens, work alongside humans, some even become famous.


Option 2: It’s a total disaster. Humans don’t trust the anthros and shun them. Some are forced to be slaves on the grounds that they’re animals, not people. Some are even hunted as big game.
15122111.title: Gathering the Anthros and Setting out for the USA

choices: "No! There's no way this will work!"
1512212.content:
“What!?” You say, not believing what you just heard. “Yes!” Says Sarina. “From what you’ve told me, your people are in desperate need of our help. You are constantly at war with each other, judge each other based on such petty things like wealth or race, and are the verge of destroying yourselves! And that’s just the tip of it, who knows how many other problems you humans have! Once we have taken control, both of our species will be better off.”


“You don’t understand.” You say. “The governments of the world aren’t going to just hand over control, and your people wouldn’t stand a chance against us in a fight.” “Why not?” Asks Sarina, sounding offended.


“For starters, your people are only on this one island, so your population can’t be very big.” “It was 572 at last count.” Says Sarina. “Well, humans are numbered in the trillions, all across the world.” You say. “Not to mention, your kinds’ best weapons consist of spears and bows. Humans have infinitely more advanced weapons that can kill from very far away. You wouldn’t stand a chance.”


Sarina smirked. “But we have something your kind doesn’t, and that is magic.” “Magic?” You question. “Yes. I could cast a spell to make everyone of the island grow to gigantic size, like myself, and we can simply walk across the sea to this land of yours. Then, your kind wouldn’t dare fight us. Of course, we wouldn’t actually hurt anyone. We would have you as our ambassador. You could explain the situation to your people, and that we are assuming control for their own good, that we want to help them. SO, will you help us? For the good of both our kinds?”
1512212.title: "And conquer it!"

choices: She has decided to heed your warnings and not attack.
She has decided to proceed with the invasion anyway.
15122122.content:
"I'm telling you, you're biting off more than you can chew!" you continue to protest. "Here, let me explain. We actually have the technology to build robots-" "A robot?" Sarina interrupts. "What's that?" "A robot is a bit like a mechanical person really. But that's not the point. As I was saying, we have the ability to build robots about as big as you are. But we don't. This is because they would be utterly useless as weapons of war. They would be too much of a target due to their size. They'd also move too slowly to find cover, assuming that there was anything they could take cover behind in the first place."

"But what does that have to do with our invasion?" the queen asked. "Just that, you and your people will face the same problems as those hypothetical machines I've told you about. Any forces you sent would be slaughtered!" Sarina considers what you've just said. Eventually, she comes to a decision.
15122122.title: "No! There's no way this will work!"

choices: "Our forces have been completely routed. I was the only one to escape."
"We have been surrounded and cut off. I was sent to request rescue."
151221222.content:
"I'm sure that my warriors can handle anything they encounter. Besides I'm not sure I believe you about those 'robots'. The idea of a mechanical person is, frankly, ridiculous. We shall proceed with the invasion," Sarina said as she got out of the bath. Picking you up carefully, she walked over to one of her guards. "Please tell my warriors that they are to begin preparations for war," She ordered. "At once your majesty!" the guard replied, before heading out. "I'm telling you, this will not end well," you continue to protest. She smirks. "We shall see. For now let's go to bed."

It's been a few weeks now since the, now gigantic, warriors left. You and Sarina are in the throne room, waiting for word to get back from the invasion force. Suddenly, one the guards bursts in. "Your majesty! A messenger has arrived from the invasion force!" "Well what are you waiting for? Send her in!"

As the messenger enters, it becomes clear that she is worse for the wear. She is covered in bandages that appear to be fairly new, as well as what looks like a few undetonated missiles jutting from her skin. "I can see from your wounds that you have seen some fierce fighting," Sarina observes. "I trust that you bear good news?" The warrior shuffles uncomfortably, obviously nervous about what she has to say. "Not exactly your majesty..." she mumbles, refusing to meet Sarina's eyes. "Why?" Sarina asks suspiciously. "What happened?"
151221222.title: She has decided to proceed with the invasion an...

choices: "You are to remain here, my personal guest."
Two guards grab you. "Take him to Selkath."
15123.content:
Through the clear water you see an anthro wolfess under the water, holding her breath. She has a hold of your leg, and is staring at you. She stares at you for about thirty seconds. Then she goes up to the surface with you in hand. You gasp as you hit the hot air again, catching your breath. You look up at the wolf holding you in her palm, She has gray fur, with yellow eyes, and long black hair.

The steam in the room obscures her body so you can't really tell exactly how big she is. She stares at you curiously. She leans her head in closer and sniffs you for a few seconds. Finally, you manage to build up the courage to speak.

"What do you want?" You say timidly. She giggles. She can see you are scared. "Well, I just came in here to take a bath, then I see a strange creature like you come in, and I was curious."

"Curious about what?" You ask. She smiles. "I was curious to see if you were some sort of bug, I've never seen one such as you." She lies down, floating belly up in the water, and sets you on her stomach. She strokes your back with one finger. "Well, since you're here, you might as well keep me company."

As she strokes you, you tell her how you ended up here. "So your a "human", you come from a place called "America", and you were washed up here in a storm?"

"Yep." You reply. "Well, You seem like such a nice person. I hope empress Sarina decides to let you stay, and not feed you to Selkath." "Excuse me?" You say, hoping you heard her wrong. "Selkath. The great serpent. It protects us, and we make offerings to it. Usually it's an offering of meat, or the occasional criminal. But if an outsider arrives here, if they are deemed a threat or unwelcome, they are offered to it."

You gulp. "Don't worry." She says in a soothing voice. "I'm sure she'll let you stay. I'm sorry about pulling you under. I wouldn't have let you drown."

"It's alright." You say, rubbing her belly. "Just don't do it again.

You both lay theere floating in the hot spring for another hour, before a guard comes in. "The empress wants to see you." You both get out of the spring and the guard offers you a white silk robe just your size. You slip it on and follow her to the throne room, the wolfess following you. "By the way, my name is Leena." She says. "Jake." You say back.

In the throne room, Sarina stares down at you. "I've have reached a decision on what to do with you." She announces.
15123.title: Whale of a Wolf

152.content:
Before you on a massive marble throne, sits a giant anthro tigress! She is dressed in a long yellow gown from her shoulders to her feet. On her head is a gold tiara with three saphires in the center. Long red hair goes from her head to her shoulders. She stares at you with curiosity.

"Come forward." She says. You timidly step toward her."My name is Nara. What is yours?" "You tell her your name. "Why are you here?" She asks. "Your highness," You say, trying to be respectful. "This is all a mistake. I washed up her during a storm, and your two guards found me." She drums her fingers on the armrest of her throne as she thinks.

"Do you have any idea where you are, or how to get back to where you came from?" Shes asks inquisitively. "No. None at all." You say. "In that case, you will have to remain here. Even if you could find your way back where you came from, we couldn't let you leave, and risk you telling the world about this place."

"Well, since I don't have a choice, I suppose you're right." You say. "Wait a minute." She says. "Before you stay here, all outsiders must prove thier worth to become citizens here."

"How do I do that?" You ask. She turns to her guards. "Take him to the arena." "ARENA!?

Now, you stand in the pit of what looks much like the Roman Colosseum. The stands are full of other antho amazons of all kinds. Nara sits on another massive throne on one end of the arena, watching intently. You have been given one weapon, a double bladed sword, kind of like Darth Maul's from Star Wars.

"Release the challenger!" Calls Nara. The gate at the end of the arena slowly opens, and out steps you opponent.
152.title: Nara the tigress

1521.content:
You can't believe your luck: you're only 6' and your opponent is 9', a good notch foot than most of the other anthro-women. What's more, she's armed with a wooden staff and a bola; hell, her "armor" is a pair of shin guards, a shapely breastplate, and a shoulder pad (you don't count her leather thong as armor, naturally). You, meanwhile, have been outfitted with your sweet double-sword, shin guards, leather half-fanny bikini, breastplate, and a basic metal helmet. Confidence is practically dripping off you; the mouse-girl may have more experience in the arena, but she doesn't have the height advantage most of the other anthros would and she's a larger target compared to you.

The mouse-girl offers Nara a salute before assuming a battle stance, and you take your own. The crowd doesn't quiet in the least even though you aren't fighting yet; their yells for a good and violent show continue.

Finally, the mouse-girl bursts forward with a speed that surprises you. You're barely able to dive to the forward and to the side as she swipes her staff upwards; clearly she wanted to sweep your feet and possibly crack your bones, resulting in a quick win.

The crowd roars with excitement as the fight picks up. They cheer both of you on.

The mouse pours it on, twirling her staff and advancing. You drive your weapon forward, intending to hit her in the center, but she breaks off her whirling assault and sidesteps. You immediately slash with your other blade and amazingly slice her left inner thigh. She manages to get away before you can slash again, but is clearly weakened, almost hobbling.

You strike again, and because of her bad leg, the mouse-girl looses her footing and doesn't get her block up in time, and your blade presses against her throat.

Hesitating, you look the mouse-girl in the eyes. There's a mysterious gleam to her brown orbs, one that twists your gut. Something is very wrong...

"Congratulations!" Nara declares, her voice booming through the arena. "This is a wonderful day! Not only have we witnessed the stunning defeat of one of our most promising gladiatorial stars, but we have seen the prowess of a fresh, nubile male! I have no doubts that the gods have smiled on us today!"

She pauses and a roar of praise sounds through the arena, practically deafening you. Everything she said made you sound like a steer on display at a butcher's auction and---

Oh, fuck me.

The mild exposure of your ass. The general lack of armor. The exotic weapon. The public appearance. The win against a seasoned fighter. The creepy speech. The lack of any males... You're the newest sex toy for an island of over-sized beast-femmes. Nara's been showing you off this whole time.

I am so dead.

"Guards!" Nara commanded. "Escort our guest back to the palace and have him prepared. I will personally bless him before he is added to our city's brothel for all to enjoy!"

The crowd's thunderous accolades of joy at their empress's decision is all you're aware of as two anthros, eyes twinkling and lips being licked in anticipation of your brothel instatement, drag you off.
1521.title: It's a scrawny mouse girl (Phew!)

choices: There's hope yet: you can see a real solution to their problems
There's little hope: you may as well become a breeder
15212.content:
The next couple of hours are dreamlike: you see and hear and feel, but it's in a detached, almost listless state of being. Your escorts, exchanging jokes over how "lucky" you are to be granted a private audience with the Empress, march you straight to a large door with a series of water drops carved in relief on its front, as if descending from the heavy gold knocker at its upper center. One of the guards uses the knocker almost too enthusiastically, the loud banging temporarily robbing you of your hearing.

After a moment, the door is hauled open by a jackal, who blinks in astonishment when she sees you. She fumbles with a question, no doubt about who you are and where you come from, when the other guard informs her, "Empress Nara wants him cleaned up for her private attention later."

You're roughly pushed forward into the jackal's arms, and your now-former escorts turn and leave, one cackling "No pressure!"

The jackal curses angrily as she moves you out of the way to close the door. "Bullies!" she seethes. "Drop one bottle of elixir and they never let you live it down!" She sighs and gestures; you follow her indication and notice the large, porcelain-tiled tub in the room's floor. The tiles are a muted cream color, in stark contrast to the dark brown of the rug laying next to it.

As you absentmindedly study the contents of the room, the jackal begins removing your arena clothing. There are shelves with multiple levels lining each wall of the room, in turn lined by dusty scrolls, dusty books, or dusty bottles (the last two coming in a whole variety of colors). A rack with an assortment of clippers, scissors, combs, brushes, and all such grooming devices occupied the wall opposite the sunken bath. Finally, there was a basket of fresh towels to your right and a much larger basket of fresh clothes to your left.

The jackal finishes with your arena gear and pushes you forward, and you comply, getting into the surprisingly warm water. As you lay down, sinking up to your chin, the jackal deftly collects a couple of bottles from her shelves and a comb and scrubbing brush from the rack. She pays you no heed when she pours some blue liquid into the bath, which causes it to immediately bubble like Coca-Cola; oddly enough, the bubbles release a sweet scent.

"That's just a bonding agent," the jackal says to you, examining her remaining two bottles as if deciding which to use next. She shrugs and sets both down, scooping up a handful of the bubbling water and dousing your face with it. "Faces aren't cleaned very often, I think," she says before wetting your hair with another handful. She then uses her brush (which, thankfully, isn't hard-bristled) to work up some suds. After a few moments, only your face is free of the foamy white mess.

She quickly pours a bottle of red liquid into the bath, making sure it washes over your head.

The effect is instant: the bubbling ceases and you're left feeling like you've been put through the car wash on the deluxe payment plan. While you're busy marveling at this, the jackal replaces the three used bottles, also replacing the brush.

"You need to get out now, so I can dry you off and get you dressed for Empress Nara."

Doing as you're told, you carefully get out from the bath and stand on the rug, letting the jackal wipe you down with a towel. Finishing with that, she takes a rag and proceeds to carefully nab any remaining moisture from your armpits, toes, fingers, ears, and nether-regions (which cause you to jump slightly at the ministrations). With that out of the way, you spend the rest of the time going through the basket of clothes with your temp groomer. Predictably, all of the garments are feminine, but some are mildly androgynous and therefore wearable.

With the jackal's fashion sense lighting the way, you settle on a navy leather mini skirt (which would probably be a micro skirt on an anthro), which has the sides slit and a second layer of silk to fill the gap, giving you the appearance of wearing a very strange kilt. Your "shirt" is a sleeveless tunic and its pea green color was almost depressing.

"Done at last!" smiled the jackal, handing you your sandals, which she swiftly cleaned. "And don't forget this!" You shift uneasily as she returns your equally-swiftly hand-washed bikini.

A knock on the door pulls her away from you, and you both find the guards have returned, to escort you to Nara. You slip on your sandals and follow, forced to endure more banter. After several minutes of walking, turning down huge corridors and striding past impressive sculptures, your group reaches a gigantic pair of doors, each one with a roaring lion's head in their center. The guards don't knock or call out, and yet the doors part, granting you entrance.

You enter alone and the doors silently close behind you, but you're too busy looking into Nara's eyes. She's lying on her side, watching you, propped up on her elbow.

"Sit," she says, nodding at the table and chair ahead of you. "I'm sure you have a lot of questions."

Taking your seat, you immediately ask, "Why did you tell me I could be a citizen if you were just planning on putting me in a brothel like some sex slave?"

"Technically, you are a citizen. It's just that males are second-class citizens by necessity."

"What!" you gape. "What kind of necessity is that?"

"The necessity of a low population. There are less than ten thousand of us on this island, and it is rather difficult for a male anthro to impregnate a female. The chances are approximately one in twelve. When a human is factored in, there is a marginal increase; the chances become one in ten. Oh, don't fear that I'll play the dirty trick of telling you how plenty of other humans have enjoyed their breeding obligations. Some of them were pleased with their fate and others learned to be content enough. I'm not going to belittle you by telling you that sort of nonsense; everyone reacts differently to this."

She pauses to crack her neck, the vertebrae popping like rifle shots. "Now, then, we've tried a host of solutions throughout our history. Our various cults pray to our gods; our alchemists concoct potions to affect the procreation process; and we have even resorted to making blood pacts with our gods by sacrificing particular gladiators in their names from time to time. Not a single bit of difference has been made through those methods, and they're frankly wasteful, so we've taken up for a few generations now the practice of making all males into servile breeders to keep ourselves from dying out. So far, it's kept our population steady."

You stare at her, overwhelmed by the revelations. After a moment, you give her your response.
15212.title: Give in for now

choices: become our island's greatest philosopher's slave."
152121.content:
"Why don't you just have sex more often? If the chances are 1 in twelve, why not have sex twelve times?" You say.
"You think we haven't thought of that? The males of this island are all half our sizes. We usually kill them if we have sex too much." Nara replied with annoyance.

"So why not try parthenogenesis? It's easy. What you do is take two non-fertalised eggs from separate people. You remove the genetic material from one and place it in the other. Then the egg becomes fertilised. The offspring is always female as well." You say, proud of yourself for remembering that piece of information.

"Parthenogenesis? It's worth a shot. Maybe it isn't necessary to have sex normally."The empress said thoughtfully, rubbing her chin. She clapped her hands and a guard ran in.
"Explain to this guard what you just told me." Nara ordered. You do so with pleasure.
"I'll go and alert the islands best scientists to this new idea." The guard announced, running off.

"Well boy, looks like you have saved yourself from the brothel. But what to do with you now? You are obviously a great thinker. I know! You can...
152121.title: "I have an Idea"

1522.content:
You nearly wet yourself as your opponent steps through the gate. A ten foot tall, anthro rhino woman, wearing black armor, with a large battle axe in her hands. But by far the scariest thing about her, was the horn on the end of her nose that had to be as long as your arm.


The only thing you had to protect you was the weapon and armor the amazons had given you. A breastplate, shin guards, bracers, a helmet resembling that of a Spartan, and something like a leather kilt covered your thighs.


You are completely screwed.


“Begin!” Nara shouted, echoing across the stadium. The rhino let out a blood curdling war cry, as she lowered her body and charged, horn aimed straight at you. Each footstep made the ground beneath you shake. You had to think, and fast! Otherwise you would be impaled like a shish-kabob.


You quickly duck and roll to the side as she charges past you, skidding to a stop before turning around and charging you again. Suddenly an idea hits you. You raises you double bladed sword and throw it like a spear. It sails through the air and hits its’ mark, hitting the rhino in the eye.


See suddenly stops charging, and screams in pain. You smirk. You knew being on your school’s javelin team would come in handy. But then your realize that your move was very foolish.


The blade had pierced her eye, but it didn’t go into her brain. Not only that, but now you have no weapon, and you seriously pissed your opponent off.


Yanking the sword from her bleeding eye, the rhino raised her axe over her head and ran towards you, ready to cleave you in two. You get another idea and pray that it works. Once she is a mere foot away, you side-step and stick out your leg, tripping her.


“Timber!” You think to yourself as she seems to fall in slow motion, face down into the sandy ground, making it quake as she lands hard. Her axe has flown out of her hands and lies several feet away. You jump onto her back and wrap your arms around her thick, sinewy, tree trunk-like neck, and squeeze with all your might.


The rhino chokes and gasps for breath as she gets back on her feet. As you cut off her air, she back up against the arena wall and slams you into it, knocking the breath out of you. She presses her back against the wall, crushing you between it and her armor.


As the air is pressed from your lungs, you squeeze even tighter around her neck. It was a battle of breaths. Who would hold out the longest? You can feel some of your bones popping and cracking as she presses ever harder.


With your last bit of strength, you give her neck one more mighty squeeze. The rhino gives one last coughing choke, before she falls to her knees, and collapses. You uncurl your arms from her neck and climb off of her, sucking in loud breaths of air. You look up at the crowd. For a moment, everything is silent as they take in the shock of you defeating such a brutish opponent. Then suddenly…….
1522.title: It's a huge rhino woman (Mother!)

15221.content:
The air explodes with cheers and applause. The sound nearly deafens you. Some of the anthros in the crowd begin throwing various things into the pit at you. Flowers, coins, you even saw a thong or two. One cat anthro in the crowd even blew you a kiss.


Two of Nara’s guards, the skunk and fox from earlier, enter the arena and approach you. “ Empress Nara wishes to speak with you.” Says the fox. “Come with us.” You follow them through the streets of the city back to the throne room. There, Nara happily greets you.


“That was amazing!” She says as she looks down at you from her throne. “Granted, your style was very amateurish, but Big Bertha was one of the arena’s best fighters! The fact that you, a mere outsider, were able to defeat her, is astounding! Your citizenship is well earned.”


“Thank you your highness.” You say, bowing. “You should feel honored.” Says Nara. “I am about to offer you a chance most anthronians would kill for.”


“What is that?” You ask. “The chance to become a gladiator in the arena.” Says Nara. “Why would they kill for that?” You ask. “Well, you see, the gladiatorial games are a very large part of our culture. They have been in practice for centuries. Therefore, gladiators are some of the most revered and respected members of our society. I can see much potential in you after your victory today. After you’ve finished being trained properly, of course. Plus, you’re the first male to fight in the arena for many years, so you’re sure to be a big attraction.”


“I am honored by your offer.” You say, trying to be polite. “But I must decline. I have a life, family, and friends back home, and I really should be trying to get back to them.”


“I’m afraid we can’t let you do that.” Says Nara. “Why not? You ask. “Because our home has been kept secret from your kind for hundreds of years, and we want it to stay that way. We can’t risk you telling the rest of the world about this place, so we must keep you here.”


“What!?” You exclaim. “I’m stuck here for the rest of my life!?” “I am afraid so.” Says Nara. “So, you might as well try to fit into society. My offer still stands.
15221.title: The crowd bursts into applause

choices: Skip to the end of the training
152211.content:
“Well.” You say. “I guess I really don’t have a choice then.” “Splendid!” Says Nara. “Take him to Zira and tell her I said to train him well.” The two guards bow and lead you back out into the city. They lead you back to the arena, but this time they lead you down a side passage that leads under it.


You follow them down a winding staircase lined with torches, to a large room made of sandstone. One wall of the room is lined with various weapons. From spears and swords, to strange looking ones you’ve never seen before.


The room was illuminated by a single fire pit in the center of the chamber. Punching bags hung from chains in the ceiling. Against another wall of the room hung an enormous gong. All around you sat several other anthro gladiators of various species, sharpening weapons, polishing armor, chatting about recent matches.


In the center of the room stands a cheetah woman with long silver hair in leather pants and a tunic, giving orders to the others. “Kreia! I told you to shine those swords two hours ago! Thuul, I want those arrowheads sharp enough to pierce stone!”


She turns around to face the guards after they tap her on the shoulder. “By order of Empress Nara, this human is to be your new trainee.” The cheetah looks down at you, and snorts. “Ah yes, the human that got lucky in the arena today. I don’t think he would last the first week of my training, but if the empress demands it, then so be it.”


The guards turn and leave. “My name is Zira.” Says the cheetah. “While you’re here, I will be pushing your body beyond its limits. So you had better get used to pain.” You gulp.


Zira turns and motions for you to follow her. She leads you down a side hallway lined with doors.. “I don’t know how someone like you managed to beat one of my best girls.” She says. “Especially since she was about three times your size. In fact, everyone here is twice as big as you. To them, you would be merely a child.”


She leads you around corners and turns through the torch-lined hallway, continuing her monolouge. “So the first thing we’ll need to do, before we even start with weapons, is work on that body of yours. Some jina roots should help with that.” You have no idea what she means by “jina roots”.


She finally stops at a door at the very end of one hall. She opens it to reveal what looks like some sort of dining hall. Long wooden tables and benches fill the room, with more torches lining the walls. She leads you past the tables into a storage room filled with barrels and crates.


She reaches into a barrel full of strange blue roots, and hands you one. “Eat this.” She says. “This ins a jina root, it develops growth and will help you catch up with the others in height.” You take a small bite off the end of the root. It tasted bitter and could have used some sauce, but you eat it anyway. “Now then, lets get some meat on those bones.” Says Zira.


She leads you out of the storage room back into the dining area. She motions for you to sit down at a table. She disappears through a back door way for a few minutes and comes back carrying a silver platter with what looks like to be a chicken leg as big as your forearm, a small loaf of bread, and a bowl of some strange red soup. In her other hand she holds a gold cup of some purple liquid.


She sets the tray in front of you. “Eat up.” You are awfully hungry after all you’ve been through, and eagerly dig in. “Everyone here is given a high meat diet.” Explains Zira as she sits down across from you. “It helps build muscle.” She explains the rules of the arena as other gladiators enter the room, and servants come out of the kitchen, lining the tables with various strange looking foods.


“The only rule in the arena….” Says Zira “Is there are no rules. You do whatever it takes to survive. Blind you opponent, disembowel them, slit their throats, everything is permitted. You fight until you opponent is dead, disabled, or surrenders.”


You notice a group of gladiators sitting at a table all the way at the front of the room covered in a velvet cloth, and lined with intricately carved chairs. “Who are they?” You ask. Zira turns to look at the luxurious table. “They are the Elkar, the most elite of gladiators. They are the most respected and honored of all. They rarely participate in matches anymore, so when they do, it always draws a crowd. It’s an honor just to be defeated by one of them.”


She turn back to face you again. “I was offered to be one of them back when I was competing, but I turned them down.” “You used to be a gladiator?” You ask as you take a bite from your drumstick. “Long ago.” Zira nods. “ My arena name was “The Iron Maiden”. I was one of the best fighters the arena had ever seen. I beat some of the toughest men around, back when there were still males on the island. I was even the grand champion for a time, until I decided to retire. Empress Nara’s mother begged me to stay on as trainer, in hopes of breeding more gladiators like me. While I have trained countless others over the years, none have lived up to my legacy.”


“What about the Elkar?” You ask. “I thought they were the elite?” “They are a league all their own.” Replies Zira. “I only ever fought in the mainstream. The Elkar don’t count.”


After you finish your meal (you could only eat about half of it), Zira leads you back to the corridor lined with doors. “You know what the hardest part of my job is?” Asks Zira as she leads you down the halls. “Finding an available room whenever we get new meat.”


After checking several rooms, she finally comes to an empty one. “This will be your quarters.” The only things inside the room was a hammock, a stool, and a small wooden box. The only light came from a lantern hanging from the ceiling.


“Get some rest.” Says Zira as you climb into your hammock. “You’ll need it for tomorrow. “Also, just because you beat one of my best fighters, don’t expect any special treatment. I’m going to push you just as hard as everyone else.” With that, she closed the door.
152211.title: Your New Life

1522111.content:
The next morning, you immediately knew this was going to be rough. You found out what the gong in the main chamber was for, as Zira would bang on it early each morning to wake everyone up. After the sudden loud noise made you jump out of your hammock, you exited your room and got lost in the maze of doors and hallways, until you finally made your way to the main chamber.


Zira directed you to the dining hall, where the rest of the gladiators were already eating breakfast. It was basically a buffet. Food was piled onto silver trays lined along the tables, and you just took what you want. After breakfast everyone went out to the arena.


While the others were practicing sword fighting, hand to hand, archery, etc, Zira had you doing various exercises. She had you lift buckets filled with stones up and down over and over again, Run laps around the edge of the arena, push ups, sometimes a combination of the three. Needless to say, by the time you went to bed every night, you were exhausted. Zira wasn’t kidding when she said she would push your body beyond its limits.


Slowly, your muscles became more developed, after six weeks, you were able to do the lifting and running exercises without breaking a sweat. The jina root Zira made you eat daily was also taking affect. After the first month of training, your body had grown to the point where you could look the amazons in the eye, though some of them were still a few heads taller than you.


After three months of working with your body, Zira put you on weapons training. Each gladiator was allowed to choose what weapons they wanted to train with, but Zira had something special for you.


“I want you to have this.” She handed you a gauntlet with a large brass disc attached to it. As you slip it on your left arm, Zira tells you to clench your fist. You do so, and the disc instantly grows into a full shield. The edge of the disc was also razor sharp and it could spin like a saw.


“This was my signature weapon.” Says Zira. “Empress Nara has asked me to give it to you to use.” After putting on the same armor you were given before, you choose a sword with a wicked curved blade, and a spear with a two-pronged head, almost like a giant fork.


You would practice battling with the other gladiators with wooden weapon. Some of them seemed to really be trying to hurt you, but Zira told them to save it for the real matches. The shield-glove Zira gave you came in very handy. blow after blow banged against it from your opponents, yet it didn’t even dent. You found it most effective to hold your shield out in front of you, using to block any incoming attacks, then backhand your opponent with it.


One of the gladiators, however, seemed to not want to fight you. She was a white tiger with long black hair tied in a ponytail. When Zira told everyone to pick a partner for battle practice, she would do her best to avoid you. You didn’t know her name, but you have noticed her staring at you during meals and while you were training.


Finally, after months of training, it was time for your first match. The order of the matches and who would fight who decided by lottery. Each gladiator wrote their name on a scrap of parchment, and placed it in a clay jar. Zira would then reach into the jar and select names at random.

When she pulled out the parchment with your name, Zira grinned from ear to ear. “Ah, our rising star’s first real fight!” She said. “Now, who will have the honor of being his first defeat?” The other gladiators gripped their weapons eagerly as Zira reached into the jar and called out your opponent.
1522111.title: Follow your training

15221111.content:
"Kreia!!!" Zira bellowed out the name of your first opponent. Kreia? You've only heard that name a few times, but never knew who exactly it was. Looking down the row of Anthro Warrior women, you see they all have looks of annoyance & disgust..........all but one White Tiger.

Your eyes widened as you realized you were fighting the same person who'd been trying to avoid you. "This is BULLSHIT!!" You looked over at Zune, clearly angry about the results. "Here I am, ready to char this meat sack, & now I have to watch him fight his stalker!!" Wait, what?

You raised an eyebrow in confusion, "What do you mean, Zune?" The purple scaled dragoness pushed smoke from her nose as she glared at you, "Don't tell me you don't know why snowflake over there has been avoiding you, Meat Sack!" She growled at your ignorance.

All the drama caused the other Antho Amazonian's to howl & hoop with instigation. The White Tigress just put her head down in embarrassment. Though you couldn't see it through the fur, she was obviously blushing heavily. Now you were EXTREMELY confused. This Kreia couldn't possibly have feelings for you, could she?

"Haha!! Okay, Meat Sack, I'll give you a hint......'Oh, Nolan! How I long to sit next to you during lunch & cuddle under the sun set!!!'"
