This caused the entire Amazon Warrior chamber to erupt with laughter, leaving all but you & Kreia in silence. Zira stood with a stern expression, waiting for the right moment to chime in & stop the nonsense.

"Shut UP, Zune! Don't tell him anything else!!" The embarrassed Kreia turned towards the dragoness. "Hahahaaaaa! I can't believe you actually LIKE this excuse of a warrior! No wonder you're the weakest fighter here, Snowflake." Zune blew light flames at the feet of Kreia.

It was at this point when the Tigress started to lunge at Zune, who was anything but unprepared to skin her alive, when both you & Zira intervene. You blocked Zune's flames with your suddenly flame proof shield, which also grew to protect your entire body. Zira tackled an enraged Kreia down, holding her to the floor till she calmed her nerves.

"IS THIS HOW WARRIORS OF ANTHRONIA ACT?!?!" Zira' voice echoed throughout the chamber so loud that even the Empress could hear it. "TAUNTING ONE ANOTHER? FIGHTING OUTSIDE OF THE ARENA?!?!" Zira stood up, looking even taller than she normally does. "This is Nolan's first official battle, and I'm not about to have you all ruin it just because you fools can't wait your turn!"

Zira turned to you, a hint of worry in her eyes, "Go & prepare for the battle. Meet me out in front of the Arena gates when you're ready." You nodded, retracting your shield to it's watch size & turning to Kreia. Zira turned to the other Amazon's, "The rest of you, out of my sight until the fight starts!!!" The Amazon's went off, grumbling in disappointment.

Kreia was so embarrassed at how she'd let her emotions get the best of her. You offered a hand to pick her up, & she obliged. Once she was level to you, you finally got a good look at her. She was actually rather gorgeous to you. Crystal blue eyes, a zebra stripe pattern with thin lines of black fur trailed along her body. Her figure was slender, but still athletic, as you could see her biceps & muscular thighs. Her bust was a sizable C cup, & her tail was long & slender. Compared to the rest of the muscle headed women here, Kreia actually had a nice womanly figure. At least for an Amazonian Native.

You snapped out of looking at her amazing body, "Ah......good luck at the fight.....Kreia." You held out your hand for her to shake. She only looked at you sadly before turning to head out to the arena grounds.

"Sigh.....I better go get ready....." With that, you took a long walk to your room to gather your armor.

On the throne in front of you, sits a beautiful leopardess. She is dressed in a flowing white gown that goes from her shoulders to her ankles. On her head, she has long black hair, tied in braids. On her wrist is a golden bracelet studded with rubies. A golden tiara rests on top of her head.

She stares at you with sparkling green eyes, with a look of hunger in them. "Release him." She says. "I have special plans for this one." Your captors cut the vines on your wrists, and push you toward the giantess leopard. She bends down and picks you up in her fist. You get the feeling of being on a moving elevator as she lifts you up to her mouth.

"This is the end." You think. "I'm going to be eaten!" The huge mouth opens, blasting you with her hot breath, and revealing long white fangs. You close your eyes, waiting for the chomp.

But it never comes. Instead you feel something hot, rough, and wet press against your body. It's her tongue! She's licking you!

She continues to rub her tongue on you for three minutes before she stops. Then, she begins walking with you in hand. You try not to look down as she carries you through the grand halls of her palace.

She brings you to her room, in the center is a vast velvet pillow, which you assume is her bed. She lays down on the pillow, and presses you against her chest, stroking you like a pet. You can hear her heartbeat, as well as the sound of her purring as she pets you.

You look up at her face, she is looking down at you, smiling. "My name is Jasmine." She says. "I have ruled this island for ten years, and have gone a very long time without any company, other then my guards and servants. The moment I saw you, I knew there was something special about you. I want to make you mine."

"I understand your lonlieness." You say. "But with all respect, I could never be a lover to you. I'm am much too small."

"That is easily fixed." She says with a wink. "You see, when a new empress is chosen here, she is given a potion to drink, that makes her grow to enormous size, like me. If she dies, or drinks it again, she becomes normal height. I have such a potion. With it, we can be together."

You think about it. There could some benefits of having an empress as a lover. And besides she is pretty hot, and seems to be very nice. "As you wish." You say, hugging her as much as you can.

"Wonderful!" She says. "Now, would you prefer to drink the potion, and become my size, or shall I drink it, and shrink to your size?"

“Exactly how many mates?” You ask. “As many as possible.” Replies Numa. “So, you want me to have several wives, and have children with all of them?” You ask. “That’s the idea.” Says Numa. “Well, you see, where I come from, that sort of thing is illegal.”


“Well, normally, one would only have a single mate in our culture.” Explains Numa. “But this is a special case. You see, the reason the population of males on this island is nearly zero, is because of a recent plague we had that was deadly to males. It was this plague that robbed me of my cub, as well as my mate.” She pauses, a tear running down her eye.


“I’m sorry.” You say, feeling bad for bring up the subject. “It’s alright.” Says Numa. “Now, our society can begin anew.” She sets you in her palm and exits the bedroom, carrying you to her throne room. As she sits on her throne, she calls for the royal scribe.


A skunk anthro carrying a roll of parchment and several quills and bottles of ink hurries into the room. “Yes, empress?” She says. “I want you to make an announcement. Write this down.” The scribe begins writing down what Numa says next, word for word.


“By decree of Empress Numa, a new prince has been crowned. Therefore, all eligible females of 17 or more, are to repot to the palace at noon tomorrow, so the prince may inspect and choose his new mates, for the sake of the island’s population.”


After the scribe finishes, she bows and exit’s the room to make the announcement. Numa smiles. “There. Tomorrow you shall choose your mates, and we can get the island back on track.” You hesitate. “But how do you know anyone will come?”


Numa chuckles. “Why wouldn’t anyone come? Who wouldn’t want to have someone as handsome and sweet as you?” You blush. “Well, back home I wasn’t exactly popular with the ladies. Where I come from, women want a guy who either has a lot of money, or looks nothing less than like a statue of a god. They’re that shallow.”


“They can’t all be that bad.” Says Numa. “Well, all the ones I know are.” You say. Numa strokes you with one finger. “Well, you won’t have to worry about that here. I promise.”


The next day, at least two hundred female anthros filled the throne room, many of them dressed in their most alluring clothing. You stood at Numa’s feet as you waited for them to finish filing in.


They stood in rows of ten, each row behind the other. You could make out some of them whispering to each other.


“What sort of creature is he?”


“I don’t know, but he looks cute.”


“If he picks me, I hope he’s a gentle one.”


Numa nudges you forward. “Go on, go pick your favorites.” You walk along each row, inspecting each female. There wwas at least one female from every species you could think of. Felines, canines, birds, reptiles, even some mythical creatures.


As you inspect each one, you pause for a moment, looking each of them over. When you find one you like, you tell them to step forward and to go stand in front of Numa’s throne.


When it’s over, you have chosen several of them. Kri the Cheetah, Luna the Wolf, Aisha the Dragoness, Isis the Hydra, Mellany the Fox, Minx the Cat, Sasha the Husky, Li the Bat, and several others that I am too lazy to name.


“Excellent!” Says Numa when you are finished. “The prince has selected his chosen mates. They shall stay here with him in the palace, and be treated as royal guests. The rest of you are dismissed.”


The remaining females file out of the throne room. Numa stands up from her throne, and motions for you and you chosen mates to follow. She leads all of you through the halls of the palace to a large marble double door.


Numa pushes the door open, revealing a room with silk pillows everywhere, with a golden fountain in the center of the room. “This is where your mates will stay. If they need anything, all they must do is call for one of the servants.”


As your mates file into the room Numa says to you, “Have fun.” as she nudges you into the room behind them.

"Captain Maxine!?" she fearfully replies. "You know that you cannot be in here when Empress Eve isn't present! She'll devour you whole on the spot if she catches you!"

"Empress Eve is no longer in any condition to eat anyone, Madame Reba," Maxine calmly explains as she and her subordinate sets you on the ground. "Lady Ursula and I bring to you her slayer, (your name)!"

"My word!" Reba responds before making an incredibly leap across the room, landing just before you with a loud clap of her webbed feet on the ground. "This short little balding ape man slew the Empress?" she asks as she eyes you over.

"I didn't really mean to," you say, "but everyone seems relieved, so... you're welcome?"

The trio laughs at your remark, as the shaman toad kneels down to speak with you.

"(Your name)," Madame Reba explains, "our society is a monarchy and the crown and throne are granted to either the Empress' eldest heir or whoever bests the current Empress in a contest of life or death. Empress Eve had no heirs, but even so, that wouldn't matter, as you have proven yourself the victor in such a contest."

"Wait," you say, "it wasn't a contest! Like I said, it was an accident!"

"Really?" Reba asks. "How did you slay the Empress?"

"I fed her food I prepared that I didn't realize I added poison to," you answer.

"I see, and why were you making her food?"

"I asked her to let me try to cook for her because I didn't want her to eat me!"

"Well, there you go!" Reba says. "That sounds like a life or death contest to me!"

"I guess so," you say. "Wait, does that mean I'm your ruler now?"

"Not quite," Reba responds. "Our leader must be one of us. That means an amazon, and judging from your height and masculinity, you're no amazon."

"Plus, you would have to be part animal," Ravanna adds. "Not completely human as you are now."

"Human!" Reba shouts with a tone of realization. "That's what those balding ape things are called! Anyway, no, (your name), you're not our new ruler, but there is a solution!"
155121121.title: They raise you onto their shoulders and cheer

1551211212.content:
"Our laws state there can never be a sole human ruler." Reba stated. "But should our Empress choose to marry a human, or was already married to one, that human would then be rendered Emperor or co-Empress by extension. But since it was a human that proved himself the victor in the contest, he has the right to choose his mate, who will then be crowned Empress."

"That answer one question. But what if I don't want to pick a mate."

"I'm afraid that choice is out of your hands." Reba said. "All know that to gain the throne, they'll have to mate with you. You are essentially a target to all females on the island. How have nothing to worry from me, I'm comfortable in my role as the island's shaman and I have no interest in the throne."

"I cannot speak for all of my wards." Captain Maxine stated. "But know that me and Ravanna will not force you to accept either one of us, unless you so wish." She added with a wink. "We can accompany you and make sure nothing happens while you see the other inhabitants."

What will be your decision.
1551211212.title: You will choose a mate, and she will be declare...

choices: Decline, but see what you can do to minimize war and ensure a fair ruler wins.
Decline, and ask for a boat and some provisions. This is not your place.
1551211213.content:
"I can cast a spell," Reba explains, "and that spell will make you eligible to be our Empress!"

"You mean, 'Emperor,' right?" you ask.

"Noooo," Reba affirms. "I mean 'Empress!' Our society is a matriarchal one! We could never be ruled by a male."

"You mean, I'd be changed into a woman?"

"An amazonian woman, and an anthropomorphized animal on top of that," Reba responds.

"Well, I mean, if you can change my gender and species, what does it matter what I am?" you ask.

"Tradition!" Reba declares. "Besides, are you saying there's something wrong with being one of us?"

"Oh, no, nothing like that," you nervously answer. "It's just, I like being me!"

"You'll still be you!" Reba remarks. "You'll just be... different!"

"I don't know," you sigh.

"'Oh, boo-hoo," Reba taunts, "'I'm being given the chance to rule a society of attractive animal women ready to serve my every whim but it means I have to give up my manhood and species and shortness. Oh, boo-hoo.'"

"Reba, please," Captain Maxine scolds. "This is a life-changing moment for (your name). He's sure to have some concerns."

"Fine," Reba says as she returns to a non-mocking speaking voice. "You don't have to do this, (your name), but you should know that if you don't, there will be a power vacuum on this island. Many of the amazons will fight to determine who among them will be the Empress, and there will be great bloodshed."

"Not to mention," Ravanna adds, "the eventual victor could be much crueler than Eve was."

Being the ruler of an entire society of amazon anthros sounds like it could be fun, and you'd be preventing a power struggle among them should you accept. Then again, giving up your body to take the form of another is frightening. Either way, you're still stuck on this island for the time being, so you'll have to live with the consequences of your choice for the immediate future. Though, it's possible they'll at least assist you in leaving the island out of gratitude for eliminating Eve.
1551211213.title: One Of Us! One of Us!

15512112131.content:
You've just freed the long-suffering citizens of this island from a gluttonous tyrant who saw her subjects as little more than possible snacks. You'd hate to prolong their suffering by allowing a war for the throne to happen; a war that could be won by someone else with a vicious streak.

"I accept, Reba," you reluctantly agree.

Reba's mouth stretches into a smile of relief. "Thank you," she says. "You have spared us from potential horror."

"Do we need to go to your laboratory, Reba?" Captain Maxine asks.

"No need for that," Reba says as she removes various bags and charms from the pockets of her feathered-garb. "I have all I need right here. We can begin with no delay.

"Now, (your name)," she addresses you, "over my lifetime, I've tried to learn as many spells as I could, and those include spells that transforms... 'humans', was it?... into anthro amazons like ourselves. Of course, I never thought I'd run into a human so I stopped learning those after committing nine such spells. The spell I cast will determine what species of animal is incorporated into your new form. Each form as their own unique qualities, quirks, and... possibly complications that may arise in at least once case. Do you understand?"

"Sounds simple enough," you say. "I have nine choices."

"Good, good," Reba continues. "Once you've made this choice, it's permanent. I won't be able to transform you into one of the other forms. And of course, I won't be able to restore you to your present form or any aspect of that, such as being human, or being male, or being shorter than us. Do you understand?"

You gulp, and then reply, "I understand."

Reba nods. "I'll detail the choices to you, then. Also, it is common practice that when the Empress is crowned, she takes on a new name. I would advise that you choose a new name for yourself when you settle on a form. You'll probably find it easier that way."

"Okay," you say.

"Do you have any questions?" Reba asks of you.

"Just one: will this spell make me giant, like Eve was?"

"No," Reba answers. "You'll grow to around ten feet tall, like we are. After the coronation, however, you'll be able to grow up to around 100 feet tall and shrink back at will."

"I see," you say. "I have no further questions."

"Very well then," Reba says, "allow me to detail your options..."
15512112131.title: Accept Reba's Offer of Transofrmation

choices: I will become Fenna, the red fox amazon.
I will become Aloren, the green dragoness amazon.
I will become Patra, the cobra amazon.
155121121311.content:
Reba explains the first three options.

"Option one is for you to become a red fox woman. This is the first such spell I learned, as I thought of a kindly vixen who was once our Empress.

"Option two is for you to become a winged, green-scaled dragoness. Capable of flying and breathing fire, this might be the most powerful form I can muster. I'm not sure why I ever thought I'd want to turn a human into that, but if you're to be our Empress, it would be an impressive form to take.

"Option three is for you to become a cobra woman with golden-brown scales. Your legs will be replaced by a tail. Venomous snakes may have a reputation but much of it is undeserved; they mostly just want to be left undisturbed.

"If none of these options are to your liking, I still have six other choices for you. If you do, remember to choose your new name for yourself now."

(Step back to the previous chapter to check the other options.)
155121121311.title: Options One, Two, and Three

choices: Yes, but not how you or Reba imagined it
1551211213111.content:
All of Reba's choices sound intriguing, but knowing there's no returning to your current self or changing after you choose a form makes it tougher. You think about how Reba said a previous empress was a fox, you figured you might as well go with something the people here were familiar with.

"I guess I'll be a red fox," you delclare to Reba.

"Are you absolutely certain?" Reba asks. "There's no going back once I'm done."

"I am certain, Reba," you affirm.

Reba nods. "Very well, then," she says as she sorts through her materials. She opens up a small burgandy pouch and pours the powdery contents of some of her vials into it, giving it a good shake once she has closed the little bag. She then takes a larger vial and pours the mixture into it, adding various multicolored liquids at different doses until it takes on a blueish hue. Finally, she adds what looks like hairs of red fur to the concoction and secures the vial's lid before rapidly shaking it with both of her webbed hands.You watch the solution within change colors from blue to yellow and bubble as she stops and sets the jar upon a nearby table.

From behind her back, Reba pulls out a colorful staff decorated with feathers. She twists the head of the staff to remove it, revealing it to be hollow within. She opens the jar and pours the mixture she just created into the staff. You swear you can hear it sizzle as it hits the confines of the staff. She screws the staff's head back on, taps it on the ground a couple of times, and turns to walk back over to you.

"I advise you to lie on the ground," Reba says. "These changes may be overwhelming. I'd hate to see our new Empress injure herself before she's even coronatied."

You gulp and comply with Reba's warning, facing upward as Reba and the two guards stand over you.

"Captain Maxine, Ravanna," Reba addressees the two guardswomen, "please be prepared to secure our soon-to-be-Empress if he starts to shake violently."

"Aye, Madame Reba," Captain Maxine answers as she and Ravanna walk over to your sides.

"Now, then," Reba says. "I believe we're ready to begin."

Reba begins to chant and shake her staff, which causes it to begin exhuding a yellow mist. You can smell a pungent aroma in the air as Reba dances toward you, moving in rhythm until she stands over your prone form on the floor. As she continues chanting, she twirls her staff and eventually points the head of it at you. You're now being bathed in the yellow mist, which is starting to make you feel nauseous.

As the smell overtakes you, you start to feel warm, almost feverish, and every muscle in your body starts to tense. You start to feel your bones stretching and reshaping, and your flesh doing the same as it tries to keep up. The process is painful and you begin to scream and thrash about. You feel your arms being grabbed, which you assume is Captain Maxine and Ravanna grabbing them to hold you down. As you feel your teeth begin to become more pronounced and a tail begin to emerge from above your behind, the intensity of the transformation becomes too much for you to bear and you pass out.


---------------------------------

You start to come to and feel a weight on your chest, and a warm layer of fur all over your body. You slowly open your eyes and see that standing over you are Reba, Captain Maxine and Ravanna, who is rubbing her arm. They were looking at you expectingly.

Was the transformation a success?
1551211213111.title: I will become Fenna, the red fox amazon.

15512112131112.content:
"Reba, what went wrong?!" Maxine said. "She was suppose to be a red fox, but what I'm seeing isn't red fur."

"I don't know. The potion was never tested on an actual human before." Reba replied.

"You risked our new Empress's life on an untested potion?!" Ravanna yelled.

"I couldn't do any actual test with it because there are no humans here!" Reba yelled back.

Their yelling was starting to hurt your sensitive ears as you covered them. "Can you please stop yelling, its hurting my ears!" You shouted.

That stopped the argument between Ravanna and Reba as Maxine helped you to your feet. Your vision was finally clearing and you look down. But instead of a red fox pelt, what you saw was sliverish fur.

"W-w-what happened?" You stammered. "I thought I was to become a fox!"

"I'm not sure what went wrong." Reba said. "I followed the potion's recipe to the letter. I can only guess the potion affects humans differently. You did become a fox, but not a red fox like you wished. You instead became a-"
15512112131112.title: Yes, but not how you or Reba imagined it

155121121311122.content:
a Kyuubi." Reba said.

"Kyuubi?" You replied, surprised before looking over your shoulder, seeing nine fluffy tails.

"Yes. I admit we heard of such a creature, but there has never been a recording one actually existing on the island. We thought they were nothing but a myth." Maxine replied.

"What powers do I have?" You ask, feeling abit better as Maxine lets you go to stand on your new two legs.

"My Empress, Kyuubi's are able to see and communicate with spirits, they can conjure and see through any illusion, can grant a lifetime of good luck or bad luck to an individual." Reba explained. "And lastly, they are able to create a flame made entirely of spectral energy, harmless to those its user deems innocent, but deadly to those it finds guilty as the flames cannot be extinguished by normal means. Beings of both the physical world and the spirit world can be harmed by it."

"I see..." You reply, moving one hand upwards and focusing, causing a blue flame to appear in your hand.

"Have you chosen a name?" Maxine asked.

You dissipate the flame before thinking. "...Fenna."

"Very well then, Lady Fenna. We should get you to your quarters so you can rest and dress for the ceremony in a few days."

"Why a few days?" You ask.

"Your coronation is to coincide with the full moon. Your body needs time to recover from your transformation and adjust to any new power you may of obtained in the process." Reba said.

You and your two guards left the room and started towards your new bedroom. But you notice Ravanna was still holding her arm.

"What happened to your arm Ravanna?" You ask.

"You threw me against the wall while you were thrashing from the potion." Ravanna replied with a small smile. "Before you try to apologize, don't. I knew the risks of trying to hold down someone thrashing and did it anyway."

"Ravanna, why don't you go see the healer, I'll continue to escort Lady Fenna."

What happens next?

choices: I will become Kongra, the monkey amazon.

choices: Jira doesn't care. He says just wants to go home.
Jira doesn't want the throne but he does want some sort of compensation.

All of Reba's choices sound intriguing, but knowing there's no returning to your current self or changing after you choose a form makes it tougher. You think about how Reba said white tigresses were pretty unique among the inhabitants of this island. You decide that if you're going to be the new leader of these anthro amazons, you may as well make yourself stand out (even more than being gigantic would, anyway.)

---------------------------------

You start to come to and feel a weight on your chest, and a warm layer of fur all over your body. You slowly open your eyes and see that standing over you are Reba, Captain Maxine and Ravanna, who is rubbing her arm.

"She's coming to!" shouts Reba. "I'm so glad this didn't kill her!"

"This was untested?" Captain Maxine asks with a shocked tone.

"Well, of course!" Reba answers. "He, or rather, she was the first human I ever saw. What would I have tested the spell on?"

"Oh, God," you say, shocked to hear your new feminine voice even though you were expecting it. You turn your head as much as you can and see what remains of your clothes in tatters all around you. "I'm actually kind of glad there's no going back or changing into something else because I don't want to go through anything like that again."

As you strat to rise, Reba warns, "Do not exert yourself too much, Your Future Highness. The transformation took a lot out of you. Even after you blacked out, you continued to thrash about."

"Yeah," Ravanna says, still rubbing her arm. "You managed to throw me into the wall."

"Oh, I'm sorry, Ravanna," you say as you sit on your knees. You realize that in your kneeling position, you're now at eye level with these women's waists, which is where you were eye level at before while standing.

"I'll be all right, Empress-to-Be," Ravanna says with a smile.

"So I must ask," Reba begins, "what name have you decided for yourself?"

You answer, "When I thought about a white tigress, I imagined the color being ghost-like. So I thought I would call myself 'Spectra.'"

"Ah, a lovely name, and an interesting choice," Reba responds. "As I mentioned, white tigresses are rare amongst the people of Anthronia. There are legends that they have a connection to the spirit world somehow. In fact, taht's part of the reason I learned this spell; I thought if I ever ran into a human, I'd turn them into a white tigress and see for myself what they can do!"

"Do you think such a thing is really possible, Reba?" you ask incredulously.

"I dunno," says Reba. "Did you think you'd ever change gender, species and height all at once?"

"Good point," you say as you carefully start to rise to your pawed feet. "I wish I could see how I looked."

"Empress Eve was quite vain," Captain Maxine responds, "so of course, there's a giant mirror in here, behind those drapes."

The anthro horse amazon trots over to the drapes, situated on the wall at the side of the throne, and pulls a rope, revealing the looming looking glass. You walk over to it, only really able to see your new white tiger head, with straight, lengthy, black-and-white striped hair cascading down past your shoulders.

"Here, Your Imminent Majesty," Maxine says as she trots back over to you. "I'll let you stand on my shoulders."

Maxine kneels down and lowers her head, motioning for you to straddle her. You turn around and begin to place your new, striped, furry legs around her head as Ravanna, still nursing her arm, walks over to the two of you.

"I'll spot you, Empress-to-Be," Ravanna says as Maxine rises to her feet to hold you aloft. The guard captain is quite strong, you think to yourself, to be able to do this with little struggle. Maxine turns so that you're now facing the mirror, and you carefully begin to stand on her shoulders while Ravanna holds your hips steady, moving her hands down to your ankles as you stand yourself up. You're amazed with the ease at which you do so, believing that you may have inherited a feline's grace.

You now see for yourself that your tansformation is complete: you're covered from head to toe in white-and-black striped fur and have a long, striped tail. You're also most definitely female as your super-curvy form reveals.

"I don't look half bad," you purr. "This is excellent work, Reba."

"Oh, thank you, Your Future Higness," Reba says with a bow. "I'll take you to Eve's quarters to find some clothing to wear. She spent all her time at her maximum height but I'm sure she has some stuff she's never worn at your current size."

"Captain Maxine," a voice shouts from behind. "We bring you the Empress' crown!"

Captain Maxine turns (effectively turning you with her) and you see a raccoon anthro amazon holding the crown that was atop Eve's head. You also see two other guards, a pig and a zebra, carrying a familiar looking anthro male appear behind her.

"We also found this one in the kitchen!" the pig announces, referring to the smaller anthro panther she's carrying . You see that it is Jira, the former cook who helped you prepare the meal.

"Screwed!?" Jira calls out to you. "What have they done to you?"

"Keep your head down, cook!" the zebra orders. "You are not to look at our new leader while she is unclothed."

"I don't really feel naked, you guys," you say as you gracefully leap off of Maxine's shoulder with your new feline agility. "And besides, Jira kind of helped me out."

"Is this true?" Captain Maxine says as she walks over to Jira. "Was poisoning Eve YOUR idea?"

"Poison?" Jira asks. "She died from being poisoned? I thought the glutton just finally choked on something!"

"You mean it wasn't your plan to put Jinko Powder in her food?"

"Jinko Powder!?" Jira says with a confused expression on his face. "Wait, you mean that wasn't tenderizer? Who would put Jinko Powder in a container clearly marked 'tenderizer?'"

"We did find the Jinko Powder in the tenderizer bin, Captain," the bear admits.

"I see," Maxine says with, bringing her finger to her head and closing her eyes to think. "Jira, you would be the prime suspect in this case if we were actually making a case for it. As it stands, we're all actually happy to finally be rid of Eve. Of course, as you are a male anthro, you're unable to hold any kind of political office in our society, and we've already chosen a new leader anyway."
1551211213123.title: I will become Spectra, the white tigress amazon.

15512112131231.content:
"I see," Maxine says with, bringing her finger to her head and closing her eyes to think. "Jira, you would be the prime suspect in this case if we were actually making a case for it. As it stands, we're actually happy to finally be rid of Eve. Of course, as you are a male anthro, you're unable to hold any kind of political office in our society, and we've already chosen a new leader anyway."

"I wouldn't even want to!" Jira insists. "I really don't even want to be here in the first place! I just became a cook to save my own skin! All I really want to do is go back to my home in the jungle, far away from you amazons!"

"That doesn't sound unreasonable," you say. "I guess you're free to go home." The other guards look at you with a slight sneer before Captain Maxine speaks up.

"Spectra here is to be our new Empress," Captain Maxine addresses her underlings. "If this is what she wants now, it's perfectly reasonable to expect that she'll want the same in a few hours when she actually is the Empress. Let Jira go!' The two guards then lower Jira to the floor and set him down gently.

"Ah, thank you, Screwed!" Jira says, bowing to you. "Sorry I'm going to miss your coronation but I'm done with this place! May your reign be remarkable and the attempts on your life be few!" With that, he dashes out the door as fast as his paws will carry him.

"He was possibly crazy," Maxine muses, "but it was hilarious when he fed Eve that extra spicy meal." The guards and Reba chuckle as they remember the event Jira described to you earlier. "I want you three to properly dispose of that Jinko Powder," she says to the guards that carried Jira in as Reba walks over to the raccoon amazon to take the crown.

"Follow me, Spectra," says Reba. "I'll take you to Eve's room, which is soon to be your room."

Reba leads you from the throne room into the halls of the palace keep, with Captain Maxine and Ravanna accompanying you at your sides. As you walk through the halls, you look around and observe the decorations, which include various paintings and statues of anthro amazons, among other items. At one point, you come across a human-sized dummy dressed in the armor of a Spanish conquistador.

"That armor seems out of place," you remark. "How did it get here?"

"Anthronia is a magical island that appears in various places in this planet's oceans, so it's nearly impossible to locate," Reba explains. "However, humans who wore that kind of armor once found us. At first, we thought they were peaceful, but they soon tried to make war with us, so that they might plunder our island and make us their slaves. It did not end well for them."

"So that's a trophy," you realize.

"Precisely," Reba says. "In fact, that was the armor of their leader. His final words before his execution was a curse, that any outsider who set foot on our island and was welcomed would be our undoing. Since those days, we've been distrustful of outsiders."

"But you seem to be welcoming me," you point out.

"True, but we've also made you one of us," Reba replies. "Besides, we distrusted Eve even more. Even so, most of us nowadays don't believe that the captain's words had any weight to them."

Eventually, you begin to approach a massive doorway, which you think must be the entrance to your soon-to-be private quarters. As you walk through this final hall, you see paintings of the various empresses, beginning with Leona. You admire the beauty of the various Anthronian Empress before walking past the final painting; that, of course, of Eve, who appears to be glaring at you from the paining as if you were her next meal. Reba turns and sees you looking at Eve's painting.

"You probably think she wants to eat the observer," she correctly guesses. "I don't believe it will surprise you to learn that she ate the artist almost immediately after that painting was completed."

"She seems like she was a real asshole," you say.

"True, but those days are over now, Spectra. I trust that your rule will be much fairer," she says as she beckons you to follow you to the end of the hallway and the giant door waiting there. To the side of the grand door is a much smaller one, clearly meant for service. Reba opens the door and leads you inside.

You look around and see incredibly huge furniture, which is much more ornate than what you've seen elsewhere in the palace. Everything is scaled for Eve's personal use.

"Are you sure there's something that will fit me in here?" you ask. "Like I said earlier, I don't even really feel naked."

"There should be right in here," Reba says as she leads you to a small (compared to everything else in the room) chest sitting in a corner behind a chair. Reba opens the chest and sifts around inside, producing a leather bikini top and loincloth. "Eve took so much from so many people, and she didn't even use it all. She just kept it." Reba hands you the clothing and you put it on, with her assistance for the bikini top.

"Thanks," you say, noting that it is a rather simple, yet nice look on you. "This will work nicely."

"Very good, Spectra," Reba says. "Come, let us prepare for the coronation."
15512112131231.title: No Complaints From Jira

155121121312311.content:
A couple of hours later, you wait behind the stage of an amphitheater outside of the palace as you hear a crowd of Anthronian Amazons begin to gather in the stands, waiting to see the coronation of their new Empress.

"This is nerve-wracking!" you say to Reba.

"Just try not to think about it," Reba advises.

"'Try not to think about it!?'" you say. "What if they don't like me?"

"Then they might try to kill you to become the next Empress. That's why you shouldn't think about it," Reba answers before walking off onto the stage. Dumbfounded, you wait backstage with Captain Maxine and Ravanna at your side while Reba addresses the crowd.

"Amazons of Anthronia," Reba speaks, "and any males who happen to be in the audience to catch a peak, lend me your ears! As you have heard by now, Empress Eve is no more!"

Cheers erupt from the audience, making it clear that Eve was almost universally reviled.

"As is Anthronian custom, the one who slew Eve is the one who inherits the crown of Empress! Our new Empress is not originally from Anthronia, had never even heard of Anthronia before today, and wasn't even an Anthronian or an Amazon until just a couple of hours ago."

You hear a mass of hushed whispers coming from the crowd and start to get really anxious. Why on earth would Reba point that out about you?

"Ummmmm," Reba continues, "she killed Eve!"

The crowd once again erupt into cheers, making you breathe a slight sigh of relief. Still, Reba's words have put some doubt in your mind. Are you really the right person for this job? As Reba made clear to you earlier, there's no backing out now.

"Please hail our new Empress, Spectra!" Reba announces, which is your cue to walk out onto the stage. Maxine and Ravanna accompany you as you walk from behind the curtain, greeted with a cacophony of applause. You take position at the center of the stage, before a massive throne fit for a giant.

"Spectra," Reba says as she holds aloft the crown of the Empress, "the Amazons of Anthronia bestow upon you the crown, title, and office of Empress of Anthronia, to bear until your dying day, or until you decide to retire, or until someone has had enough of your crap and murders you. Actually, that would also be your dying day, I suppose."

You gulp, not sure if the crowd notices your sweating. Nice job of helping me not think about that, Reba, you think to yourself.

"Lower your head, Spectra, so that I might place the crown upon it."

You comply with Reba's request and lower your head. As Reba lowers the crown upon your head, you're overcome with a sense of warmth, as if something magical just happened.

"I dub thee, 'Empress Spectra!'" Reba declares. "Now, ascend above us all!"

The crowd looks at you in quiet anticipation as you just stare ahead in confusion about what you're supposed to do next.

"Psst," Ruby whispers. "Think about growing."

Oh, ascend! That's what that meant! You realize the warmth you felt from putting on the crown must be an indicator that you're now capable of growing with a thought. With that in mind, you begin to concentrate on growing.

You feel yourself expanding outwards, rising to the sky well past the heads of Reba and your two guards. You realize the clothing that Reba found for you earlier is miraculously keeping pace with your growth, although, again, you didn't exactly feel like you were naked before. Your surrounding seem smaller and smaller each second until about ten seconds have passed, when you reach 100-feet tall, which is as large as Eve was and the maximum height Reba told you was possible. You look down at the minuscule crowd, which is cheering for you.

"Take your seat on the throne, Empress Spectra!" Reba shouts from down below. "Your Coronation Banquet will begin!"

Far below you, you see castle servants begin to cart out huge plates of delicious-looking food. Some of this is the unusual stuff you saw in the kitchen earlier, but it looks rather appetizing to you now.

"Go ahead, Empress!" Reba yells from below as the staff gets everything into position, "dig in!"

You look down at the feast that was prepared for you and grab one of the six-legged boars. The mouth-watering aroma is picked up by your huge nostrils, and you can't help but pop the whole thing in your mouth and start chewing. Your newer, sharper teeth make quick work of the bones and flesh and you swallow the delectable beast once it's fully pasted up in your mouth.

You lick your chops and begin to reach for another. However, as you do, you look at the food and realize there's quite a bit of it, enough to feed everyone in this amphitheater... three time! However, no one in the crowd, and not even Reba and the guards, are partaking in the banquet.

"May I ask why none of you are eating?" you ask.

"Your Very, Very Highness," Reba shouts from below, "this feast was made exclusively for you! It is our gift!"

"That may be so," you say, "but it's silly that there's so much food for me and none for everyone else!"

You rise from your throne and think about changing your size once more, only this time, you reduce yourself in height, down to about 15 feet tall, which is 5 feet taller than the other Anthronian Amazons.

"I invite everyone here to come down and help yourself to this food!" you announce!

The stunned crowd look to each other in a brief moment of silence before breaking out in the largest cheer of the night as they begin to spill from out the stands towards the bountiful banquet that was prepared for you on stage. They do so calmly, knowing that there is more than enough food for everyone here.

"That applies to you three, too!" you say, motioning at Madame Reba, Maxine and Ravanna. "As well as the guards and the staff who brought it out!"

"Cheers for Empress Spectra and her generosity!" someone in the crowd shouts as your staff partakes of the meal, fallowed by a raucous ovation.

------------------------------------------

Very little food is left after the coronation ends, and every Anthronian who attended went home with a full belly. As the staff begins to gather the dishes for cleaning, the guards and Reba begin to accompany you down the halls to your quarters.

"Will you be growing back to your maximum height, Empress Spectra?" Maxine asks. "Everything in your quarters is sized for someone much larger than you."

"Oh, good point!" you say as you picture yourself growing again, rising back up to 100 feet and making the hallway seem normal-sized for you.

"If you wish, I can have new furniture commissioned for you at any scale you wish if you prefer to be smaller," Reba offers.

"That won't be necessary," you say. "I don't think there's anything wrong with being this tall most of the time. It just seems wasteful to eat this way."

Reba nods. "You're already doing better than Eve."

"Heh, maybe with the money saved on food, the guards and other staff can get a raise!" Ravanna jokes.

"Well, I'd like for everyone to be treated fairly, Ravanna," you say as you continue down the halls. You feel a little more comfortable in your new furry skin now that the coronation ceremony has come and gone.

However, you get an odd feeling whenever you pass by one of the things in the hallway you noticed earlier...

You walk past the painting of Eve once more. This time, since you're now as tall as she was, you no longer get the feeling that the subject of the painting is looking down at you. However, you still feel something uncomfortable about it as you walk past.

"Does this painting have to remain up?" you ask.

"Not if you don't want it here, Empress Spectra," Madame Reba replies.

"Yeah, I don't suppose I do," you say.

"I'll be happy to have my guards take the painting down and burn it," Captain Maxine offers. "There's no reason to pretend we have to honor Eve."

"Thank you, Captain," you respond. "What are you doing with her body?"

"I'm having my guards bury her in a secret location at this very moment, so that her corpse might not be defiled," Maxine answers. "Again, there is no reason to honor her with a funeral, but she consumed so many of us. In a sense, we are giving them their proper burial."

"Tomorrow," Reba says, "we will have a memorial service for those we've lost to Eve."

You nod as you reach your doorway. "I'll make certain to pay my respects then," you say as you step inside your quarters. "Good night to the three of you, and thank you for all that you've done for me today."

"Good night, Empress Spectra," the trio says as you close your door.

--------------

As you lay in your new bed, unbeknwonst to you, a scene plays out n a remote location in the jungle where Maxine sent her guards to bury Eve.

"We should have just thrown her wretched corpse in the sea!" a rabbit amazon guard says as she nearly finishes shoveling dirt on the grave of her former empress. "She's not worth this trouble!"

"It's not about her," the sheep amazon replies as she also continues refilling the plot. "It's about those she's taken from us."

"Well, we could have at least gotten some males to do this for us!" the rabbit sighs, rubbing her back.

"Meh, we're stronger than they are," the sheep responds. "Better to have gotten this done faster."

The rabbit groans. She didn't want to be far from the city at night and so far into the jungle. But she puts her back into it, knowing that she's almost done. A few more shovelfuls full of dirt and the grave is properly covered.

"Good riddance," says the rabbit as she pats down the earth. "Not even worth my spit."

"Is it just me," the sheep asks, "or did it get darker out here?"

The rabbit looks around and sees that it is indeed much darker out than normal.

"What on earth?" she exclaims. "Come, let's get back to town before..."

As she speaks, a strange black fog begins to pour into the clearing, enveloping the area with darkness. The two guards are overwhelmed by the fog and begin to cough violently, passing out onto the jungle floor.

The fog rolls out and a hooded figure emerges from behind the trees, walking towards the grave of the fallen empress Eve. A horrid chanting begins to emerge from the hood as its paws begins to sprinkle a strange, black, powdery concoction on the grave. As the figure continues to chant, the ground begins to shake violently, loosening the recently patted-in dirt of the grave. After a few seconds of this, the figure stops chanting, and steps back from the grave.

The shaking suddenly stops when a hand clad in spotted fur thrusts itself from the grave. A glow appears around the wrists of the hand and takes the form of a shackle with a broken chain. The rest of the body follows quickly as Eve, now with phantom shackles on her wrists, ankles, and neck, has awoken from her eternal slumber. She looks dead-on at the figure who gave her the wake-up call.

"I would thank you," she hisses to the hooded figure as she holds up her shackled wrists, "but these chains indicate that you expect something."

"Indeed, I do," the hooded figure says as he uncloaks himself, revealing the grinning visage of Jira!

"YOU!" Eve growls. "The lousy cook!"

"Actually, I'm a very good cook," Jira laughs. "I just happen to be an even better necromancer. Since the day I convinced you to let me be your cook instead of eating me, I've been feeding you a series of components that would allow me to put you under my command. Those spices you thought I overdid? That was on purpose!"

"I should have eaten you when I had the chance," Eve laments.

"You should have eaten Screwed when you had the chance, too!" Jira points out. "I got him to complete the spell for me, and now HE'S the Empress!"

"Who? What? How does that even... Bah, it doesn't matter! I am the rightful Empress!"

"Not anymore! But the magic granted to you as an empress still linger within you, and it's mine to control now! Observe!" With that, Jira holds out his palms to frame his view of Eve from top to bottom and then begins to slowly force them further apart, causing Eve to grow in size to fit within the frame until she is twenty feet tall.

"You're going to regret giving me a size advantage," Eve says as she starts to lunge towards the necromancer, only to be held back as the phantasmal chains of her shackles become rigid.

"Nuh-uh-uh," Jira chides with a taunting voice, "it works both ways." With Eve's movement restricted, Jira frames Eve in the frame of his palm once more and this time closes them shut, causing Eve to reduce in height, shrinking well past her previous Amazonian stature and finally standing at a mere one foot tall as the chain as release her.

"What do you want with me?" Eve demands as she stares up at her new apparent master. "It's clearly not the throne as it sounds like you could have had tit for yourself instead of this... 'Screwed?'"

"I do want the throne, my dear, but on my terms," Jira muses as he slooks down at the smaller Eve. "I'll not be undergoing some sort of mojo to become a female, and I won't take a bride only for her to become the empress and me be the concubine."

"So I'm not to be your bride, then? Then what am I?"

"A pet," Jira cruelly taunts, "and a weapon. Through your power, I will conquer Anthronia and take its place as ruler."

Eve sulks. "I've been demoted from empress to pawn, it seems."

"Come now, my dear, you make it sound so terrible," Jira chuckles. "I know you really cared nothing for the throne, anyway. You only ever wanted one thing, and I'm prepared to offer that to you."

"What do you mean?"

"I mean, I offered to prepare you meals before," Jira says as he frames Eve with his palms once more and quickly spreads them out. "I'm about to give you the feast of a lifetime!"

Jira vanishes in a cloud of smoke as the two amazon guards start coming to. The rabbit quickly looks in the sheep's direction, only to watch her be snatched up by a massive spotted hand. Before she can even start screaming, however, the other hand grabs her and holds her aloft, bringing both amazons face to face with the former Empress they had just buried. Both are frozen in shock as Eve licks her lips.

"I always wake up so famished after a long nap," Eve says with a malevolent grin before opening her massive maw, providing both guards with the last sight they'll ever see.

"Oh my yes" she says putting you down in a palm she lowers her face and starts to examine you. "Hmm your pretty scrawny, not really meant for fieldwork are ya" she says.

"No, I'm more an...intellectual" you reply. She nods "well good then you should be fun for a game or 2" she says. She lowers her hand and puts you down on the floor and that's when you realize that the giant hall was silent except for the sound of breathing and the guards who had stood watch and the ones who had brought you here had disappeared. May lowers herself into an almost crouching position "alright Alex here's what we're going to do, we're going to play a little game called cat and mouse, and guess who's the cat" May says smiling. "You have 10 seconds so I suggest you get running" she says. You take her advice and bolt in the other direction back down the hall you had come from "here I come" May shouts after a few seconds and you turned for a second to see her start walking after you. Just as you turn a corner you see her drop down onto all 4s and start running. You were suddenly grabbed and pulled into a doorway, 3 pairs of hands covered your mouth as you heard the titanic mouse race right past the doorway. Finally after a minute the hands were removed and you were able to turn around. You were staring at 3 mice, all of them about 5ft 10, and they all looked like duplicates of May even the dress, the only difference was fur color, one was brown, one was white, and one was jet black which surprised you a bit.

"Geez I can't believe this first visitor we have in ages and she wants to "play" with him" the black mouse says obviously perturbed.

"It could have been worse, I mean she could have wanted to play something else" the brown mouse remarks.

The white mouse walks forward and looks at you eye to eye "are you alright?" she asks.

"Yeah...I'm fine" you say.

She nods "that's good, oh by the way I'm Cathy, and these are my sisters Tina and Diane" she says indicating the black and brown mouse in turn. "You already met our elder sister" she says with a hint of scorn in her voice.

"Your related to that giant mouse!?" you say stunned.

"Yes, the first born always becomes that big, although she only beat me by 2 seconds" Cathy says. Suddenly you hear a tearing sound and a large chunk of the wall including the door was ripped out behind you and you slowly turn to see May the mouse staring down at you, "found you mousey" she says smiling.

"H,o,l,y.....shit what the hell she wrecks her own castle?" you say. The 3 mice sisters nod, "May quit it, you won, do you have any idea how much work the construction crews are going to have putting that wall back together" Tina says walking up and challenging the large mouse.

"Blehhh your not the boss of me besides I win, now I get to decide what happens to him" May says reaching for you when suddenly the 3 mice stand in her way.

"Oh no you don't May, we're sick and tired of this, as you know under law no anthro can touch another's husband so we claim him as ours" they say.

"What?" you shout but they just ignore you.

May laughs "fine if that's how you 3 want to prove that you have some power around here even though I'm the first born that's fine. However you also know under law I can challenge you for your husband" she says.

"Yes but you have to put up something of equal value for if you lose" Cathy says.

May nods" that's true, so I'll wager my crown against him, do you accept the challenge?" May asks. The 3 mice sisters nod, "good then the competition will be held one week from today, I'll see you there" May puts the piece of wall down and calls "clean up" before heading back towards the throne room. Out of a side corridor run a bunch of male furs most of them large horses who grab the piece of wall and hoist it back into place, it's held there and mortared back into place. They nod at the what you assume are princesses and just stand there holding the wall in place till It dries. Your pulled away by the 3 mice and Cathy sighs "I'm sorry my sister has caused you such trouble" she says.

"It's uh...okay" you say really not sure what else to say. "So what was that whole exchange?" you ask.

"Under Anthroia law not even the queen and touch the husband of another anthro without their say so, if we hadn't intervened well May has never seriously hurt someone but you may have been....scarred" Diane says. You nod "well then......thank you" you say. Tina sidles up next to you and hugs your arm "although that's not the only reason, you are pretty cute" she says. Suddenly the 3 girls were walking very close, "you know she's right, you pretty cute for a...what are you?" Diane asks.

"Human" you reply.

"Yeah your pretty cute for one of those" Cathy says. They lead you down the hall into a room about 3 times the size of any other you had seen so far except the throne room, in it were 3 identical king size beds as well as 3 dressers although there was only 1 bathroom that branched off the room. You stared at the three of them and Cathy smiled "this is our bedroom" she says walking forward.

"That's very nice, so why did you bring me here?" you ask.

"To make sure that May doesn't try anything we need you to stay here, one of us will stay with you at all times to make sure that nothing happens to you" Cathy says.

"Alright, no offense but what should it matter what happens to me, I mean you don't even know me" you say.

"So, as soon as you stepped on our island you became a citizen of Anthroia, and as it's royal family we have a duty to protect everyone who lives here" Tina says, "also we wouldn't mind getting to know you" Tina says getting closer to you. You nervously giggled when Diane pulls you back "I'm sorry about my sister's actions it's just that May has a....controlling hand on the male population, it's not very often a guy becomes available that she hasn't already tried to sink her teeth into or just doesn't like" Diane says. "Ok that's quite not really good" you say. The three sisters nod "don't worry, we won't let May get you, and then you'll be ours to love" Tina says as if it's fact.

There are some areas that are coated in webs and on those webs look like some chunks of web spun into one solid area and they're rustling about, almost as if they were cocoons and whatever was inside was trying to escape and unbeknownst to you, that's exactly what's happening.

1553322221111.content:
The queen's chambers were rather dim, with only glowing blue crystals coming out of the walls providing a faint light. Like the hallways, the room was full of webs, with more wriggling cocoons.


In the center of the room was one gigantic web, that was cocoon free. This, you guessed, was the empress's bed.


You heard the door open behind you, and in stepped Arache. "So, I hope these accommodations suit you." She said with a toothy smile, showing her fangs.


You quickly nodded, knowing telling her that they weren't would probably result in your death. "Excellent." She says. "Now, let's discuss what the plan is for you."


She places you in her palm, and climbs onto her web. She turns around so she is facing the ground, holding you out in front of her face.


"Now then. I have selected you for a very important task. But first, in order for you to accomplish that task, I must do something to you first. And you probably won't enjoy it."


"Wait a minute." you say. "Why do you need my help for this? Couldn't you just pick one of your subjects?"


"No." She says. "You see, The task is important for the continuation of my line. I can not produce an heir, because I have lost my ability to lay eggs."


"So what do you want me to do?" You ask. "There's no way I could help you with that."


"Ah, but there is." She says grinning. "I promise you two things. One, when the task is done, you will be greatly rewarded. Two, I must first do something that will be unpleasant for you, but it will only be temporary."


"What is that thing?" You ask, dreading the answer.

155332222221.content:
You can't believe your eyes! There in front of you, on the massive throne, sits Zig Zag, the famous tiger-striped skunk! Only, she's much larger than you've normally seen her on the internet. Other than that, she looks exactly the same.


From her white fur with the black stripes, the long white hair, the red painted nails, only her outfit is different. She wears a light blue silk skirt that goes down to her knees, with golden belt above it, with a strange symbol on the front. Her chest is covered by a sleeveless light blue silk top that exposes her belly.


On her head is a golden tiara, with more symbols carved all around the ring. She looks at you with a gentle smile. "Come here little one." She beckons you with one finger.


You walk toward her, marveling at her gigantic size. You had always been a fan of her, but you never knew she actually existed, or that she was so huge. But then again, you didn't think anthropomorphic animals existed to begin with, either.


When you reach her feet, she gently picks you up between her fingers, and places you in her palm. "Now then, what brings you here?" She asks.


"I don't know." You reply. "Last thing I remember was drowning in the ocean, then, I wake up on this island."


"Well, you're in safe hands now." She says gently. "My name is...."


"I know, I know." You say, cutting her off. "Your name is Zig Zag."


She looks at you bewildered. "How did you know my name?"


"You're an internet icon, where I come from." She looks even more confused. "What's an internet?"


You explain to her about the internet and computers. "I see. But how could.........Max! Of course!"


"Max?" You ask.


"Yes. Several years ago, another one of your kind found this island. He ended up here the same way you did. He stayed with us a while, then we built a raft for him and sent him home, after erasing his memory of this place. I just hope he didn't remember it after all."


"Well, don't worry." You say. "He didn't tell anyone. Otherwise, a lot more humans would have come here before me. He probably only remembered you, and thought he had just made you up himself."


"Well, that's a relief." She says."So, in this "Internet" of yours, what am I like?"


You tell her all about how she's practically a celebrity of fandom, and how she is portrayed in art and writing.
155332222221.title: Zig Zag The Amazon!?

1553322222211.content:

"Yep, that certainly is just like me. I guess he remembered more than we had expected him too but at least people don't know I actually exist." she says as she wipes a tear from her eye caused by her laughing.

"So anyway young man, about getting you back home, it will take a few days to prepare a raft for you to set sail on and you are certainly welcome to stay and enjoy yourself in the meantime. One thing that wasn't mentioned about Zig Zag is that she has the ability to read minds and knows exactly what you're thinking. "Don't worry, the memory I'll replace it with is one of you having a good time." she replies.

You look up at her and give her a meek smile. "Thanks Zig Zag." you reply. What do you do first?

"Okay, mother." You say jokingly as you head toward the exit. Zig Zag giggles and watches you stroll on out. She sighs to herself. "It's to bad he'll be leaving. He seems like such a good guy."


You make your way down the marble steps in front of the palace. You look out at the city before you, marveling at how grand it is. It looks like a a mix between a Greek and a Mayan city, with marble buildings and columns, walls with pictures carved into them, and some statues here an there.


You wonder around the city, admiring the beauty of it, passing anthros of every species imaginable. You come to what look like the local market place. Stands selling various strange fruits and fish, jewelry, art, etc, lined the street. As you walk past, you hear various calls from the stand owners.


"Fish! Fresh Jing Fish, just caught!"


"I've got berries, I've got roms, I've got squin, any fruit you can think of, I've got it!"


"Eels! Come and get your eels!"


"Come! I just get a fresh supply of medicine! I even have a new cure Sleeping Fever!"


You pass by, admiring the various goods, when you hear the sound of a horn. You turn toward the direction of the sound, to see a skunk anthro walking down the street, blowing into a conch shell. She is followed by four of Zig Zag's servants, carrying one of those beds with rods sticking out the sides, surrounded by a pink curtain.


Who ever was coming was apparently very important, because every one in the street was stepping to the side to let them through. You quickly follow their example. The servants stop in front stand. A long, slender leg steps out of the carriage, followed by another. Out steps the most striking anthro you've ever seen.


She is a tigress, with black fur, and white stripes! Snow white hair hangs from her head to her shoulders, and her tail tip is white as well. She is dressed in a way that reminds you of Cleopatra. Unlike her mother, she is the average height for species, ten feet tall.


The stand owner, a cheetah, bends down on one knee and bows his head. She motions for him to rise, and begins speaking to him. You can't help but stare at her. She was so captivating, so exotic, so..........beautiful.


You tap the anthro standing next to you, a fox, and ask. "Who is that?"


"That is Princess Kasmir, Empress Zig Zag's daughter." He responds.


Zig Zag's daughter! That explains her fur, even though it's the vice versa of her mother's. You want to go up to her and talk to her. Even just to say hello.
15533222222112.title: Love at First Sight?

choices: I'm sorry Kasmir but he is still going home
155332222221121.content:
You slowly walked towards the Princess and you were about to say hi when she turned around burying your face in her stomach as she was about 4ft taller then you. She giggles for a second and looks down "oh my hello" she says. You were pulled backwards and forced onto your knees by the stand owner "i'm so sorry princess this is the visitor that will be leaving in a few days" he says. Suprisingly you felt her arm on your shoulder and she lifted you up till you were standing and looking at about a 50 degree angle up at her. "Aren't you gonna say hello?" she asks.

"H-Hello, princess....ma'am" you say. She laughs "geez cat got your tongue?" she asks.

"Well somewhat, you are very beautiful" you reply before covering your mouth.

She leans over and there's a look of almost hunger in her eyes and it almost sounded like she was purring. "This is the first time i've ever had someone compliment me who wasn't a citizen, thank you" she says.

"Y..your welcome" you stammer back. She smiles at you and snaps her fingers the bed and the anthros carrying it moving to her and she climbs on "come" she says motioning for you to follow. You slowly stepped forward and climbed onto the bed before it started to move, Kasmir smiled at you as you were well very nervous to say the least, for some reason you were more nervous now then you were seeing a 300ft tall Zig Zag. You jumped as you felt her hand on your shoulder and she smiled at you "you really need to settle down, it's not like I bite...much" she says showing off some fangs. You nervously laugh and she licks your cheek "mm actually you taste pretty good" she says leaning over more "mmm maybe just a little nibble" she says. You were unsure of what to do, I mean you didn't want to get eaten and they didn't seem to be into cannabilism but you never knew. She leans over and nibbles on your ear causing you to laugh "haha stop that, it tickles" you say. She just keeps it up till you were totally exhausted from rolling around laughing and she smiles at you "aww are you all tired out?" she says looking down at you. You couldn't move or answer, "mmm i've never met someone who's been so, awed when near me" Kasmir says.

"Well I am kind of awed at this whole place, anthros aren't exactly normal where I come from" you reply. She nods "so you will be leaving in a few days?" she says.

"Yeah I will, apparently your mom or someone will wipe my memory so I don't remember anything" you say.

"So you won't remember me?" Kasmir says.

"Probably not" you say finally finding the energy to sit up. She actually looks kind of sad "what if you didn't leave?" she says.

"I've got to leave don't I, I mean I have friend, family back home there's no reason to stay" you reply.

"What if there was a reason, for you to stay?" she says.

"Well then I guess i'd have to stay" you reply. She crawls across the bed till she was looking straight at you "do you have any idea why I asked you to come with me?" she asks.

"No" you reply bluntly.

"I've never seen one of your kind before, you a what was it....human right? How are you so short, how do you survive without fur?" she asks.

"Well back home most creatures are well to simply put it not as intelligent as us so we can hunt them, we also farm and wear clothing like you do for warmth" you reply. She nods and keeps staring "your just so strange, but in a good way" she says.

"Thank you?" you reply kind of confused. She moves forward and lays her head down on your stomach "so did my mother tell you that i'm single?" Kasmir says.

"No, but I kind of figured" you reply.

"Mmm a unique husband, only one on the whole island and he's pretty cute" you heard her mutter.

"You think i'm cute?" you ask. Her head shoots up and she sighs "yes you actually are pretty cute, in fact" she leans over and gently nibbles on your ear again "I just might pick you" she says. "Stop" she shouts and the bed stops moving "Fernando" she shouts and through the curtain appears the head of a fox "yes my liege?" he asks.

"I would like him to be entered into the pick" she says pointing at you.

"But...but Princess only men of somewhat noble birth can be entered" he replies.

"Are you questioning my orders?" Kasmir says staring him down. The fox sighs and nods his head "as you wish Princess, we will enter him as soon as we return to the palace" he says. The bed starts to move again and Kasmir seems very excited "excellent, now it is all a matter of time" she purrs.

"What exactly did you just do?" you ask.

"Well I am the one and only daughter of the Empress and tradition dictates that any male of noble birth may fight for the right to marry me" she says.

"Alright, what about your feelings?" you ask.

"Pardon?" she replies.

"What doesn't the monarchy have the right to pick someone who they like rather then whoever wins them?" you ask.

"Well no, tradition has always dictated that men fight over the queen and in her generosity she allows the winner to marry her" Kasmir says.

You sigh and nod "oh that reminds me, why is Zig Zag so big?" you ask.

"Oh well you see even though the man wins the woman we have always been a matriarchal society, there's some ritual that gives the queen that size so that she may rule over even her husband although i've heard tale of one queen who denied the ritual" she says. You nod again and she sits back "so what is the outside world like, I don't know anything but this island" she says.

"It's alright, the outside world is an alright place, there is a lot of war and other problems" you say sighing. She pestered you with more and more questions till the bed stopped and she stepped out again motioning for you to follow. "We might as well tell mother in person" Kasmir says leading the way since her strides were twice yours. You soon re-entered the throne room where Zig Zag was sitting looking very bored "oh Kasmir welcome back and you brought our guest with you" she says sitting up.

"Yes, Mom can I ask for a favour" Kasmir says and you see her put on "the eyes."

"What is it my daughter?" she asks.

"Well can you enter him into the competition to marry me" Kasmir says pointing at you.

ZigZag actually looks stunned "Kasmir he can't that's only for the families with noble lineage" ZigZag says.

"Why not" she replies "can't I have someone who was chosen because I like them instead" Kasmir says. ZigZag sighs "Kasmir please the rules haven't changed for hundreds of years, I met your father through them even though I didn't like him" she says.

"You didn't like dad?" Kasmir replies as you watched thankfully all but forgotten.

"No your father was a good man, and I liked him, but I didn't love him, I never really fell for anyone before I met your father" she sighs.

"Please mom can he enter then, please" Kasmir says.

ZigZag sighs "Kasmir please i'm sure there are lots of nice boys to pick from" she says.

"No there aren't, they're all too afraid of you to do anything but suck up" Kasmir says folding her arms. ZigZag sighs and picks her daughter up "Kasmir please just go with tradition" she says.

"Mom why? If you had fallen in love before you met dad would have gone through with the competition" Kasmir asks.

"No I would not have" ZigZag replies then covers her mouth. Sighing ZigZag says"
155332222221121.title: Greet Her

1553322222211211.content:
Alright Kasmir he may join the competition" ZigZag says. "Oooh thank you mom" Kasmir says hugging her mother's neck.

"Are you truly alright with doing this?" ZigZag asks.

"Yes I am" you reply giving a little bow.

ZigZag sighs again "Anthony" she shouts and from a side corridor runs a male skunk in very regal garb who bows when he stand in front of Zig's throne "yes ZigZag?" he asks.

"I would like him to be entered into the competition for my daughter, no questions" she says.

Anthony nods and turns to you "name?" he asks.

"Alex" you reply. He quickly writes your name on what you can only equate to parchment before bowing to ZigZag again and running off. ZigZag puts Kasmir down and she runs up and grabs your hand "come on I’ll show you your room" she says pulling you along after her. Kasmir happily runs through the halls which like the throne room were absolutely gigantic as they had to fit something ZigZag's size, you weren't exactly sure how long they took to carve as they were all made of stone you just knew it must have taken a long time.

"So what exactly happens during the competition" you ask.

"Oh well there's 3 parts, physical, mental, and then the pick" Kasmir says.

"The pick?" you reply.

"Yes the physical and mental challenge reduce the amount of anthros for the pick down to 10" Kasmir says.

"How many anthros usually compete?" you ask.

"Around a hundred competed for my mother" Kasmir says. She pauses after like the 10th identical giant wood door you passed, she looks in and motions for you to come in "alright well this is your room, see you at the competition tomorrow" she says before leaving the room. The room was very majestic, one of the side walls was taken up by a giant oak dresser and a door that led to a bathroom with a toilet and bathtub although you knew there was no plumbing so the room confused you a bit. The whole wall across the door was open and it led onto a large terrace the only cover being a light curtain. You turned as there was a knock at the door and a shy looking dog anthro in a maid outfit comes into the room.

"H-hello I'm Petunia, I'll be your personal servant for the competition" she says not once lifting her head. You walk up and she gasps as she was well able to look down at you at a 90 degree angle. "Hi" you say and she backs up a step, "you, what are you?" she asks.

"A human" you reply smiling at her, her face softens and she bows "as I said i'll be your personal servant for the competition" she says. You nod and decide to ask, "so um how do the toilets and the bathtub work, since you probably don't have plumbing" you ask.

"Plumbing?" she replies confused.

"It's like a system of pipes that moves water into the home" you say. She nods "well if you wish to have a bath we can heat the water right now as for the waste, well we use it as fertilizer" she says. You look up at her "are you serious?" you ask and surprisingly she nods "augh ok that's kind of gross" you say. She shrugs and bows to you again "is that all?" she asks.

"Yes that's fine, thank you for your work" you reply.

"I didn't do anything" she replies.

"Your willing to help me out that's all the work I need right now" you reply. She looks at you confused and shrugs again before leaving the room. You sit back on the bed and lie down, you must have fallen asleep as the next thing you know Petunia was shaking you awake "come on wake up, you need to get changed for dinner" she says pointing to a set of clothes already laid out.

"Thanks" you reply starting to undress, you freeze as you realize she hadn't moved "um you can leave" you say.

"I can't leave I have to escort you to dinner" she says. You try to convince her to leave but finally you just sigh and get changed although you swear you felt her lean forward once or twice. You followed Petunia out of the room and she leads you to the dining hall which you expected was absolutely massive in size, you followed Petunia up to what looked to be a chair with a ladder on the side and you started to climb up. You were seated about halfway down the table between a male dog anthro and a deer anthro. Both turned and stared at you for a second before turning away. You saw ZigZag at the front of the table and she stood up "I have been informed that everyone is here so me may begin dinner" she says. Servants like Petunia come out from side corridors carrying giant trays of food that are actually passed to ZigZag who sets them onto the table. Finally the servants take their places near the end of the table and everyone gets up and grabs part of the nearest dish and digs in. You ate what looked to be some sort of giant boar with a sail like a sailfish has on it's back as well as some sort of rainbow fish as well as some sort of fruit juice. After about a half an hour the dinner hall quieted again and ZigZag once again stood up "all you men are here to battle for my daughter's hand in matrimony, as the first competition will be tomorrow I can do naught but wish you luck" she says. There was scattered applause across the table and people started to leave you followed suit retracing the path you saw Petunia took to get back to your room, thankfully you got the right door on the first try. You headed straight for the closet and started to undress when the door opened and you heard a muffled "eep" standing in the doorway was Kasmir red as a beet, she quickly shuts the door and you get dressed and slowly open it. "May I come in?" she asks and you nod. She walks into the room and it was weird it was almost like it got brighter "I am....sorry for my intrusion before" she says blushing a bit.

"That's...alright, Princess do you need me for something?" you ask.

She laughs "I am very different from my mother but you will address me as Kasmir got it" she says. You nod and she shuts the door "I thought I should come and see you since you are somewhat, disadvantaged in the physical competition" she says.

"Really, what is it?" you ask.

"It's an obstacle course, although thankfully some of the obstacles take brains rather then brawn to figure out, especially the last one, I designed it myself" she says smiling. You nod and she smiles at you "you know your my favorite right" she says. You nodded again and she pushes against you with one paw "you better win otherwise you will make me very sad" she says. She pulls out what looked like a pink ribbon with a bell in the center, "I want you to wear this around your neck during the obstacle course" she says.

"What?" you reply.

"Please" she says.

You sigh "fine" you say stashing the ribbon under your pillow.

"Oooh thank you" she says leaning over and pecking you on the cheek. She quickly but silently exits your room and you change into your sleep clothes before laying down into bed. You heard a gentle knock and you go and answer it, opening the door Petunia was standing there "has Lady Kasmir been here yet?" she asks.

"Yes?" you reply.

She sighs "good, well good luck in the competiton tomorrow" she says before she leaves. You scratched your head for a second then shrugged, shut the door and went to sleep holding the ribbon tightly.
1553322222211211.title: He may join the competion

15533222222112111.content:
You were woken up by Petunia's shaking as well as the call of some bird "get up you must have breakfast and then we must go to the competition grounds" Petunia says. You nod when you sit up and knowing she's going to stick around you get changed into a t-shirt and what seemed to be shorts although you could tell they were modified to fit you. You followed Petunia into the dining hall where there were a few of the male contestants and you had a breakfast of strange fruit one was even a blue square as big as you were but you just shrugged and dug right in. Petunia led you back to your room and you grabbed the ribbon and secured it around your neck in a little bow. You were led out onto the course and thankfully everyone was just standing around. In a few minutes ZigZag walks up and everyone lines up and you take the one empty place. The same deer from yesterday looked over at you and he actually growled and soon there was very angry muttering going through the whole line.

"This is the first competition for my daughter's hand, each of you will go along the path in front of you so that there may be no interference" ZigZag says.
