You waited around for a few seconds and ZigZag yelled "start" and you started off at a sprint heading into the tree lines. The first few challenges were very basic, swing over a pit, climb up the hill or over the tree that kind of thing. The first major obstacle was you had to cross a river and all you there was, was a single giant tree and an axe, throwing caution to the wind you chopped down the tree and pushed it into the water. Suprisingly it fit the gap perfectly so you ran across the makeshift bridge. The second challenge required a bit of archery to hit a lever that would make a rock fall into a giant pit so you could cross. Luck was on your side and you hit the lever on the first shot.

The final challenge was where it got interesting there was a bird anthro waiting near a box full of wooden blocks with letters on them. On a tree nearby was a note which you guessed was the only clue.

"Of this there is only one"
"More like the night instead of the dawn"
"The most beautiful in all the land"
"All you'll see though is the hand"

You instantly knew it was Kasmir and quickly grabbed the blocks you needed and spelled out her name. The bird nodded and flew upwards and spread her wings, it was nuts like a peacock but the display this bird gave off had to be seen for miles. She then swoops down and picks you up by the arms and flies back to the starting area. When she lands your suprised as you don't see anyone else. Within minutes however more of these birds come flying back and in about 10 minute there are about 70 of you there as well as 30 extra bird anthros with no male.

ZigZag walks up "that is disappointing that there were so many that couldn't figure out the riddle" she says. "Alira" says ZigZag and instantly the bird who carried you back stepped forward "how long did it take him to solve the riddle?" ZigZag asks obviously referring to you.

"No time at all ZigZag he looked at the riddle once and in a second spelled Kasmir's name" Alira replies. You look up to see ZigZag smiling and she picks you up and examines you and you felt one of her claws press against your neck and the ribbon. "Seems somebody is a favorite" she whispers.

"The first round is over, with the outsider in the lead" ZigZag says. There were gasps from all over especially from the other participants. "Kasmir will now stow give him the first prize" ZigZag says. Kasmir walks up and smiles at you and then pretends to freeze "mother, he already has the prize around his neck" Kasmir says. Zig pretends to lean over and she gasps in shock "your right, how could he have gotten your personal ribbon, did you steal it?" she asks you sternly.

"No, I just found it, in the baths, but then I heard Kasmir and I bolted" you say trying to come up with a suitable answer.

ZigZag nods "well since you found the ribbon you may keep it, but you still deserve a prize" she says. Without hesitation Kasmir walks up and kisses you gemtly on the lips for a second and this time there was a stunned silence however you don't know what happened after as Petunia comes out of nowhere, grabs you, and starts running carrying you like a sack of grain. She disn't stop until you were back in your room and she deposits you on the bed and locks the door, "that was close" she says panting.

"Why'd you do that?" you ask.

"You couldn't feel it, every other contestant wanted to kill you, I suggest eating your meal in here" Petunia says. You nod "thanks for saving me" you reply.

"My lady likes you so you can't be all bad, and your welcome" she replies.

"Petunia come here and sit down" you say. She walks over and sits next to you, you reach up and start scratching behind her ears and she gives off a sigh of pure contentment. "Mmm what is that?" she asks moving over so you can get better access to her ears.

"It's called an ear scratch" you reply.

"Oooh it's heavenly" Petunia says. She freezes as there is a knock at the door and you hear Kasmir's voice "May I come in?" she asks. You walk forward and open the door and you find her standing there and she hurries inside and shuts the door "your ok" she says hugging you.

"My lady you must try this" Petunia says sitting her down next to you.

"Petunia what are you.....ohhhhh" Kasmir sighs and starts purring as you scratch her ears her tail happily wagging from side to side.

"He says it's called an ear scratch, it feels heavenly doesn't it" Petunia says. Kasmir nods and after a minute you stop and she turns to you, and pushes you over "mmm you are absolutely my favorite now" she purrs. You started to gently rub her back or atleast the part that wasn't covered and the purring increases.

"Kasmir we should be leaving now" Petunia says pulling at her. Kasmir sighs and kisses you once before getting up "I will see you after the mental competition" Kasmir says leaving the room. You took Petunia's advice and stayed in your room as the day led on, Petunia brought you your midday meal and it did kind of suck as you wanted to go out and see Kasmir but you knew that you needed to be alive to win the competition. Later in the day Anthony came to your room and he read a message from ZigZag "I am sorry that the jealousy of my people have confined you to your quarters, I am quite happy that my daughter has found somebody that she loves as much as you as to give you her ribbon. I expect great things from you during the mental trial and best of luck" Anthony bowed after reading the message and left the room. You sighed and sat back in bed not having much to do you just stared at the ribbon and you went out onto the terrace and observed the forest below. A little while later Petunia showed up with your dinner and she gave you what a ring with a small topaz stone set in the center. "Like the ribbon you are to wear it tomorrow for the competition, do not worry the mental competiton has each male in their own room" Petunia says.

"So how long after the mental competition is the pick?" you ask.

"Right after" Petunia says before leaving the room. You fell asleep that night somewhat tense but you clutched the ring and felt better.
15533222222112111.title: You wake up on time

choices: You want Kasmir to stay at 10ft tall
155332222221121111.content:
Again you were woken up by Petunia but this time she shushed you as you get up. "No one is supposed to be up yet but I need to get you to the starting area early so that no one attacks you" she whispers. You nod and quickly get dressed in a shirt and some pants made out of cotton and follow her out the door, the castle was eerily quiet this early in the morning, every so often you'd see a servant rush past and they didn't even give a second glance as they passed you. You were led suprisingly to Zig's throne room "this is where the competition starts and ends, that is all i'm allowed to tell you" Petunia says. You nod and she leans over and you scratch her ears "I could get used to this" she sighs and you both waited there. Within 10 minutes ZigZag and Kasmir as well as the other contestants started to show up, within 15 minutes everyone was there. ZigZag stands up and looks over the contestants "all of you have beaten the first trial but the second one is much more difficult, a king must be smart enough to take care of their kingdom as well as his wife" she says.

With that you are led by Petunia as well as the other contestants are led into a room. The room is lit only by candle and you heard the door seal as you entered, in the center of the room was what looked like lines as well as there was a constantly flowing stream of water. You had 3 small blocks and you almost laughed your head off, the big mental challenge was nothing more then a water diversion challenge. From the looks of it the answer was simple as could be, you faced harder puzzles in video games. You grabbed the blocks and quickly had them in place. You removed the partition holding the water back and it started to flow. Following the path you created the water flows swiftly and with precise accuracy, it fills what looks to you like just an empty pool. You jump as the bottom of the pool sinks and the door you had entered from creaks open. "Holy shit I didn't know they had that kind of technology" you think. You sprinted the whole way back to the throne room and as you entered the great hall suprisingly there was cheering from everyone. Zig walks over to a wall and pulls a lever, "that's 6 doors that won't open until the end of the competition" she says smiling at you. She then walks up and picks you up "how did you figure that out so quickly?" she asks.

"No offense but i've faced harder puzzles on pretty much a daily basis" you say. ZigZag smiles "I wonder what would have happened if Max had stayed, we probably would have had a competition on our hands" she says laughing. It took a few minutes for the next contestant to show up and again ZigZag pulls a lever. By the end ZigZag had pulled all the levers and making sure the count was correct she pulled the lever back up and told the servants to go and get the rest of the contestants. It took a few minutes but the other contestants joined the onlookers as ZigZag smiled at the rest of you. "You have proven yourselves worthy to be picked by my daughter, now Princess Kasmir go and pick your husband" ZigZag says gently pushing her forward. She walks up and starts examining everyone up and down or well just down in your case, she bends over and carefully grabs your hand so that no one else could see and you saw her smile as she saw the ring. She walks down to the end of the line and starts walking back having contestants do things like open their mouths or bend over and show their tails which kind of confused you. Finally she nods and walks up to ZigZag "you've made your choice , already, are you sure?" she says. Kasmir nods and ZigZag stands up "the Princess has made her decision, to make sure that there are no, interferences with her choice all canidates will bow and shut their eyes. The one Kasmir picks will walk up with her to the throne" ZigZag says. You like the rest of the contestants bowed and closed your eyes, you smiled a bit as it was like that old kid's game just with a much larger prize. You felt a paw on your shoulder and you grabbed it and stood up. There was a gasp from the crowd as you slowly followed Kasmir up to the throne and you opened your eyes to see her smiling at you.

"Well well, our princess has chosen the outsider to be her king" ZigZag says, you froze as each of the other contestants stood up and pulled out a sword.

"My queen we cannot allow this" the deer anthro from before said.

"Lord Horn it is not your choice but my daughters, besides all of you lost before this even began" ZigZag says picking you up. "hold out your hand" she whispers and Lord Horn has a look or pure shock on his face. "That can't be, how did he get the royal signet" he says.

"I gave it to him, as well as my ribbon before" Kasmir says stepping forward. ZigZag smiles "oh so now we have a full confession do we, I was wondering where it went" ZigZag says.

"No..um...well...I" Kasmir stammers.

ZigZag laughs "it is his to wear now" she says. Your lifted up to face level and she smiles "you'll take good care of my daughter won't you?" she says.

"Nothing pleases me more then to see her happy" you say bowing your head. ZigZag smiles and puts you down next to Kasmir who excitedly hugs you.

"The competition is complete and your new king has been chosen, this calls for a feast" ZigZag says. Instantly the halls erupted into cheers and all the anthros except the competitors including Anthony and Petunia swarmed forward and started to congratulate both you and Kasmir. You were hoisted up by ZigZag "now now you gotta remember the new king's kind of short" she says.

"Coming from Godzilla that's saying something" you reply.

"Hey" ZigZag says pinning you under a finger "you sure have some nerve insulting the ruling queen" ZigZag says but she's chuckling.

"It's not an insult, it's a crack, besides why would I insult the mother of the most beautiful thing i've ever seen" you say. Kasmir giggles and ZigZag puts you down though now she's smiling. Kasmir leads you once again to the dining hall yet this time she pulls you up after her as she climbs the ladder for her chair and sits you with her. The feast was incredible to say the least the creatures you could name were some sort of duck, a one of those sail boars and again some sort of rainbow fish. You and Kasmir were passed some sort of fruit drink but you almost felt a little tipsy after you drank it.

"Don't worry, it's to give you lots of stamina, for later" Kasmir whispers into your ear. You shivered a bit and she gently licked your cheek "I knew you'd win, I just knew it" she says. You nodded, the feast lasted for hours and then ZigZag stood up and smiled. "Everyone it is time for the ritual, no one is allowed to follow me" ZigZag says. She picks you and Kasmir up, one in each hand and walks back to the throne room. She pushes against the back of the throne and it disappears revealing a tunnel lit by torches. ZigZag puts the back of the throne back and walks down, you were however totally freaked. Zig walked down for a good few minutes until she reached a large room with a weird symbol in the center. The outside looked like a normal runic circle which was a circle with runes in the lines, but the center was some weird design. It almost looked like a sword planted down with wings on either side of it. ZigZag lifts both of you up "I need to ask you both a question as you get to decided if this happens, do you want the ritual to happen or do you want Kasmir to stay the same size?" she asks.
155332222221121111.title: Mental competition 1

1553322222211211111.content:
You just stood there for a few seconds, although Zig Zag had said it was up to the both of you, both her and Kasmir's gaze were fixed directly on you. It was a bit unnerving but you couldn't let it distract you, you thought about it for a few seconds weighing all the pros and cons you could think of before looking up at the both of them. I really hope I'm not making a mistake. "Kasmir i'd like you to go through with the ceremony" you say.

"What? Why?" she replies sounding almost hurt by your statement, you sighed knowing this wasn't going to be easy. You were just about to speak before she cut in "why do you want me bigger? Is there something wrong with me now? I...I don't understand" she says sounding frantic her eyes almost welling up with tears.

"Kasmir" you say quietly and she stops a second. You slowly reach up to stroke her cheek and she leans down so you can stroke her. "Kasmir..." you pause and just take a second to stroke her waiting for her to settle down "I love everything about you, my beautiful kitten, nothing about you needs to change, however this is something bigger than the both of us. Imagine something happened, and you needed this size, to protect your...our people, protect me, our children" you say. Kasmir freezes as you say "our children".

"You...you'd still want me? Even if I was that big?" she says fear evident in her voice.

"Of course I would, and do, Kasmir I don't care if you become 300 or 3000ft tall, I will always love you, no matter the size, or shape, as long as you stay you" you say. Before you could move Kasmir hugged you tightly and started to purr, a deep rumbling purr that not only reverberated through her but also through you as well.

"Alright Mom, I think i'm ready" Kasmir says. Displaying an extreme amount of dexterity Zig Zag gently separates the two of you and lifting Kasmir up placed her down in the center of the circle before stepping back out of it. She then started to chant, although it didn't sound like her, the voice sounded divine...literally. It was like nothing you had ever heard, gentle as the rays of the sun but at the same time it felt like this voice could move mountains if it wished. Slowly the circle started to glow, brighter and brighter until the light engulfed the whole room, although you had time to shut your eyes. When you opened your eyes again Kasmir was standing eye-to-eye with her mother, her own eyes closed.
"Kasmir, Kasmir" you call unsure if she was alright, slowly in response to her voice her eyes opened and she started examining the room, obviously a bit disoriented due to her new size. Her gaze fell back onto her mother and of course you "well...how do I look?" she asks spinning in place.

You couldn't help but smile up at her "you look beautiful Kasmir" you answer and she smiles. Her expression quickly changes to one of hesitation and you find the source, she was slowly lifting her arm, her obvious intent to pick you up. You waited as she slowly lifted her hand to in front of you the massive object shivering as she looked at you, you reach out your own hand and she ever so slowly moves forward till you felt her hand around you. Just as slowly and gently her fingers wrap around you and she lifts you off Zig Zag's paw and deposits you on her own a small smile spreading across her face.

"About time you two, my arm was going numb" you nearly go flying as Kasmir jumps in fright but all you end up doing is turning a somersault in the air and landing back in her palm. Both of you had forgotten all about Zig Zag.

"Mom don't do that" Kasmir shouts glaring at her mother. She looks down at you a little dazed from your flight but otherwise fine "are you alright?" she asks her muzzle quickly moving to almost poke you in the chest as she tried to look you over for injuries.

"I'm fine" you reply, although you turn as you hear the sound of giggling. Suprisingly Zig Zag was standing there giggling like a little school girl.

"Aww don't you two just make an adorable couple" she says. "I'm sorry about startling you, but it was just such a cute little moment between the two of you and my arm was starting to hurt".

"Sorry mom, I was just..." "worried that you'd hurt him? Controlling yourself at this size is hard, but you will learn in time" ZigZag says smiling at her daughter. "We do have to leave now, since the ritual is over" Zig Zag says. She leads the way out with Kasmir following and she set the stone that had been removed back making the throne seem as if it was one solid piece again. "So Kasmir do you need me to lead you to your new room?" Zig Zag asks.

"No mom, you showed me the way how many times" Kasmir replies. With a final small wave Kasmir leaves with you along for the ride, she walks through the corridors of the castle for a couple minutes. Just as you were about to pipe up that you might be lost, she stops in front of a doorway. "Here we go" she says pushing the doors inward. The room before you was like nothing you had ever seen, the wall on your left had a large window taking up most of the space with a dresser and drawers standing on either side of it. On your right hand side was a mostly empty wall except for another doorway on the far side. Taking up the majority of the room was the largest bed you had ever seen, it was covered with a mound of pillows and silken sheet and looked like it could fit both Zig Zag and Kasmir at their current size comfortably. The wall opposite the door was taken up mostly by the headboard of the bed, as well as a small nightstand.

"Wow" was all you could say as Kasmir walked into the room examining everything.

"It's very nice isn't it, Mom had this room made for me on my 16th birthday, although it took till my 20th to be finished" Kasmir says.

"By the way, how old are you?" you ask.

Kasmir lets out an audible gasp before gently lifting you up to her face "you do know your not supposed to ask a lady her age don't you?" she says,

"Well yes....so how old are you, come on tell me it's not like i'm going to leave you" you say.

Kasmir sighs "fine i'm....21" she says a meek smile on her features.

"Young and beautiful" you reply a small smile spreading across Kasmir's features.

"Well mister, just how old are you?" she asks.

"I'm...younger than that" you reply suddenly feeling embarassed.

"Oh no, I told you how old I am, you have to tell me" Kasmir says.

"Or what?" you reply staring up at her in defiance. Kasmir walks over to the bed and carefully drops you onto the sheets, before you can get up she pins you under a finger and starts tickling you.

"Or I'm not going to stop" she says from above you, she kept up her "torture" for a full minute before picking you back up "ready to talk yet?" she asks.

"Fine...fine" you say between fits of giggles "20, are you happy?" you ask.

"Yes I am" she replies.

"So, what's through the other doorway?" you ask.

"Oh, just our private bath" Kasmir replies. She then slowly lifts you up to face level "would you mind..if I kissed you?" she asks.

"Of course not, why do you ask?" you reply.

"Well I'm just a bit..." she stopped as you stood there tapping your foot "just hurry up and kiss me" you say. You saw her smile and she gently leaned down her lips pressing ever so gently against you as you kissed what you could of her lips in return. The kiss broke and you saw Kasmir smile as she spoke again "you do know that we are officially mated now" she says.

"Yep, and I couldn't be happier" you reply.

"Well tradition states....I mean you basically said you wanted kids with me...I mean..." you couldn't believe that Kasmir was so flustered.

"Kasmir I would love to be your bed companion tonight" you reply.

"But I don't want you in my bed I want you in me" she says freezing as she realized what she said.

You bust out laughing "well that's what I meant, but I don't think I could say no now that you've been so forward, just be gentle" you say.

You saw the inside of Kasmir's ears pink "I will" she says.
1553322222211211111.title: Let the ritual happen

15533222222112111111.content:
You and Kasmir proceed with the mating and you both receive so much pleasure. But then suddenly your chest starts to tingle. The tingling soon spread throughout your body. Then you past out, and within an hour you walk up again with Zig Zag and Kasmir's giant faces over you.

"What happened?" You ask Kashmir and Zig Zag. Both look unsure on what to say to you but Kasmir is the first to say anything.

"You don't remember what happened?" She asked.

"No all I remember is having the best day of my life and then having a tingling feeling all over my body. Then I passed out." You said.

Zig Zag then lifted a mirror in front of you and you were in complete shock.
15533222222112111111.title: One of you?

1553322222211211112.content:
"Well, if it's okay with Kasmir," you say. "I'd like her to stay the same size." Kasmir blushes, saying "I hoped that you's say that."

"Why is that?" her mother asks.

"Well, I felt that if we were closer in size, we'd feel more... 'equal' in our relationship." Kasmir explains.

"Well if you both want this, I won't object." the empress says. "The ritual will not be done."

The three of you make your way out of the secret tunnel and ZigZag sets you and Kasmir down on the floor. "The two of you may spend the rest of the day as you please."

When you and your fiancé leave the throne room, she wants to go to the balcony, and you happily oblige. As the two of you looked at the beautiful view, Kasmir turns to you.

"Just think," she says. "In a few day, we'll be happily married."

"I know, I can't believe that this has all happened so fast." you say. "There was just something about you that I found attractive, and it wasn't just your looks."

"I feel the same way." she replies, which makes you blush.

That night, you were about to go to your bedroom when you are approached by Kasmir. "Where are you going?" she says.

"To my bedroom." you bluntly answer.

"You're supposed to sleep in my room, silly." she says, giggling.

"I'm supposed to?" you ask.

"Yeah." she says. "It's tradition that on the night that the royal couple becomes engaged, they have their first... mating ritual." she blushes as she said those last few words, and so do you. Without another word, the two of you walk hand in hand to Kasmir's bedroom.
1553322222211211112.title: You want Kasmir to stay at 10ft tall

1553322222211212.content:
"But mom!" Complained Kasmir. "No buts!" Said Zig Zag sternly. "I'm sorry Kasmir, but as empress, I can't let you marry an outsider. I like him too, but it is forbidden. I'm not normally a rules person, but this is a big one. Now, I don't want to hear any more about this, understand?"


Kasmir's ears drooped, and she had a sad look on her face. "Yes, mother." Zig Zag put her back down. "Good. Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some new decrees to take care of."


Kasmir trudged off, head down, tail dragging behind her. You followed her, hoping to comfort her. You called to her a few times, but she didn't answer.She turned and walked through a door, closing it behind her. You guessed this must be her room.


You hear muffled crying coming from behind the door. She must be really upset. You plan to come back here later and try to make her feel better about all this. You make your way back through the halls to the throne room.


Zig Zag is still there, dictating a new law to a scribe. "And furthermore........." She notices you coming in. "I'll get back to you Lawrence. Go take a break." The scribe bows and leaves.


"So, how do you like the Island?" She asks. "Oh, it's beautiful." You say. "I just hope Kasmir will be alright." Zig Zag nods. "Don't worry, she will be. She'll eventually come to understand that I must stick to my duties as empress, and we can't go against tradition."


She gets up from her throne , picks you up, and puts you on her shoulder. "Where are we going?" You ask. "To dinner. You must be hungry after all you've been through." She brings you to a grand dinning hall, big enough for perhaps the whole island to eat in. There, at the head of an long table sits a huge bowl of fruit. Zig Zag sits in the grand chair in front of that bowl and picks out a strange green fruit in the shape of a pyramid.


As she eats it, she picks up a round orange one that to her is the size of a grape, but to you it's a big as a beach ball. She hands it to you. "Eat up." You hold the fruit in both hands and take a bite. It tasted like a cross between an orange and a strawberry.


You spend the next hour or so telling each other about your own cultures. "So this "electricity", you use it to power a box that contains moving pictures?" She asks. "Yes. It's called television." "Fascinating."


That night, you are given your own room to sleep in. The bed is much larger than you, so you have plenty of room. Zig Zag provided you with a silk robe to sleep in, which was very comfy. You lay there for a couple hours waiting until you're sure everyone is asleep. When you are, you sneak out through the halls to Kasmir's room.


You quietly push the door open. Inside, Kasmir lay asleep, curled up under her silk sheets. You silently make you way to the head of her bed. She looks so peaceful asleep. You reach out your hand and gently brush her cheek.


Her eyes shoot open. She wasn't even asleep. Even in the pale light coming through the windows, she knows it's you. She throws her sheets off and grabs you, embracing you to her tightly. "I don't care what my mother says." She says. "I'll find a way to be with you if it's the last thing I do."


You reach around and rub her back. "But how?" You ask. "I don't know, but I swear I will find a way." You crawl in with bed with her and hug her. "Care to join me in for a bath?" She asks seductively. "I don't think we could get to the baths without getting caught." you say.


She smiles. "No, not that kind of bath." She takes the rest of her sheets off, and you realize she sleeps nude. Her belly and chest were as white as her stripes. She turns you around and warps her legs around you. She takes your robe off and beings licking you like you were her cub, starting with the top of you head. You sit there and let her clean you. Her rough tongue tickles your skin and she makes her way down your back.


"Now, I want you to scratch me." She says when she finishes. She lays on her stomach and you scratch her back, causing her to purr. "Mmmmmm, that feels so good." She sighs happily.


After half an hour or so of scratching, you lay next to her. You wrap your arm around her, she wraps her tail around you. She licks your face affectionately. "Good night, my love." She whispers. "Good night, my queen." You whisper back. You faall asleep to the sound of Kasmir's purring.
1553322222211212.title: Forbidden Romance

15533222222112121.content:
You wake up the next morning to the feeling of something rough and wet rubbing your ear. You open your eyes to see Kasmir, licking your ear in her sleep. You smile. She's so cute like this. Like a little kitten.


You gently shake her to wake her up. But she stays asleep. You say her name, still nothing. Then you get an idea. You slide your hand under the sheets and tickle her belly. She wakes up giggling.


"Ticklish are we?" You ask slyly. " Maybe. What about you?" She asks smirking. "Uh.....no, not at all." You say nervously. "Really? I can tell you're lying. And when you lie to me, there's consequences!"


She shoves her hands beneath your arms and tickles your pits. You thrash around laughing, Kasmir clearly enjoying this. After five minutes of this she stops. "You better get out of here now. Before someone catches you in here with me." You nod and pull your robe back on.


As you slip out the door, Kasmir blows you a kiss. You blow one back, and disappear. As you walk down the halls toward your room, one of the servants, a jackal girl runs up to you. "There you are!" She says. "Zig Zag sent me to find you, but you weren't in your room! Where were you?"


"Oh, I just decided to go for a walk." You say. "Well, come with me, the empress wants to see you." You follow her to the dinning hall, here Zig Zag sits, eating breakfast. "Good morning." She says. She picks you up and places you next to her plate. "That will be all, Jina." The jackal bows and leaves.


"Hungry?" She asks you. You nod. She hands you a bamboo chute that you use as a straw, to suck up the yolk from the eggs on her plate. You eat a piece of egg white as you continue talking. "So, any plans for today?" She asks you. "Not really." You say. "What do you guys do for fun around here?"


"Why don't you spend the day with Kasmir?" She suggests. "I thought you didn't want us together." You say. "I never said that." She says smiling. "I said she couldn't marry you. You can still get to know each other. For what it's worth, since you won't remember her when you leave here."


"That sounds good." You say. "Or, you could explore the Island some more. I'm sure you'll find plenty of things to keep you occupied." So what do you want to do?
15533222222112121.title: The Next Day

155332222221121211.content:
"I think I'll spend some time with Kasmir." You say. "Excellent." Says Zig Zag. She picks you up and places you down on the floor. "She eats her meals in her room, so she should be in there."


You make your way back to Kasmir's chambers. You knock on the door, and here what sounds like shuffling and scrambling inside the room. "Just a Second!" Calls Kasmir. "Come in!" She says.


You open the door, there's Kasmir on her bed, reading a scroll. "Oh, it's you." She says relieved. "What was all that noise?" You ask. Kasmir hesitates. "I'll show you, but you have to swear to not tell anyone." She says. "I swear." You say. She lays the scroll she was reading on the bed, gets up, reaches under the bed, and pulls out several other scrolls.


"What are these?"You ask. "Spells." Says Kasmir. "I've secretly been studying magic." "Your people know magic?" You ask, stunned. "Only a few of us do." She says. "Those who do are mostly healers and such. Mom says it's too dangerous, but I wanted to learn it so I could help the people more when I was queen. For example, this entire island is enchanted."


"It is?" You ask. "Oh yes." Says Kasmir. "We actually have our own language. But the island is enchanted so that you understand what we're saying. Also haven't you wondered why your kind has never discovered this place, other than the occasional castaway? That's because the island is enchanted, so that from above or from a distance, it just looks like a empty spot of ocean, surrounded by huge jagged rocks. So anyone sailing or flying by wouldn't dare come near, or even see the island."


"You know humans can fly?" You ask. "Yes. I've been able to see much about your world through magic. Airplanes, I believe they're called." You nod. "Yeah, that's it. What else do you know?"


"I know that your kind can't even go one decade with being in a war of some kind." She says, sadly. "I swear, you humans are so violent." "Well, not all of us." You say. "We're constantly at war with each other because we all have different views on how things should be done, and different beliefs. I wish we could have peace, but the world is full of people who think things should be done their way, and only their way."


Kasmir nods. "It's sad, isn't it?" You nod. Then, there's a knock on the door. Kasmir quickly shoves the scroll back under her bed. "Come in!" A servant comes in, carrying a tray of fruit. "Your breakfast, my liege."


"Thank you, Winston. You are dismissed." The servant bowed and left. Kasmir laid the tray on her bed. She sat in front of it and stared at it. "Everyday, it's always fruit. I think I'll make it more interesting. I'll turn it into some of the food your people eat."


"You can do that?" You ask. "Yeah. All I need to do is concentrate on what I want it to be." You stares at the food, a look of great focus on her face. There is a bright flash! When it clears, where once was a bowl of fruit, there is now a stack of pancakes. "Oops. Forgot something." She stares at the panckaes again, and they are covered with butter and syrup.


She snaps her fingers and a fork appears in her hands. She begins to eat. "Mmmmmm! This is delicious! I can't wait until we get back to your land, then I can eat like this all the time!"


"Oh yeah. Your gonna love all the food we have." You say. "If you think pancakes are good, wait until you try and omelet." "What's that?" Kasmir asks. "It's kind of like an egg pancake filled with cheese." Kasmir licks her lips at that. "I've never had cheese, but it already sounds good."


"Speaking of getting back home, have you figured out a way for you to come with?"You ask. "I think I might have something." She says. "Would you like anything?"


"No thanks, I already ate." You reply.


You spend the next hour or so talking about her abilities. "So what else can you do?" You ask. "Oh, lots of things." She says. "I can make things move without touching them, make things disappear and reappear, light fires with my fingertips, a whole bunch of stuff. I can even see through time."


"See through time?" You ask. "Sure. I can't travel through time, that's too risky, but I can see what has happened in the past. It is possible to see the future, but I prefer not to. I'd rather be surprised. Would you like to see?"
155332222221121211.title: Spend the day with Kasmir

choices: Ask to see the Island's history
Ask to see Zig Zag's past
1553322222211212111.content:
Kasmir smiles and pulls one of the scrolls out from under her bed. "So what do you want to see?" You pause for a second, thinking. "How about you show me when you were born?" Kasmir looked surprised, yet flattered. "Alright then."


She unfurled the scroll and began reading from it. "Changa omos rutay komona ekrisha " You had no idea what she was saying, you guessed it was some ancient language that the translation spell on the island couldn't decipher.


Just the a small blue dot appeared in the next in front of you both. She continued reading as the dot grew larger and wider, until a glowing blue disc hung in the air in front of you. The disc began to shimmer like water, as a image began to become visible inside it.


Then, as though you were watching a TV screen, you saw Zig Zag, at normal anthro height, laying on her bed, a small bundle in her arms. Next to her knelt an anthro tiger, holding her hand and smiling. They were both looking down at the bundle, tears of joy in their eyes.


The blanket fell away from the bundle's face, and now you could see it clearly. It was a baby Kasmir, sound asleep in her mother's arms. "She's so beautiful." Said Zig Zag, smiling. The tiger nodded. "Just like her mother."


A voice of screen, which you assumed was whoever helped deliver the baby, said "What are you going to name her?"


"Kasmir. That seems fitting." Said Zig Zag. Kasmir's eyes slowly opened and she began crying. "Shhhhhhhhhhh." Zig Zag said. "Mommy's here. Don't cry." She lifted Kasmir to her shoulder and patted her back.


You turned and looked at Kasmir in the present. "You were so cute as a baby." Even beneath her fur, you could tell she was blushing. "But you're even cuter now." You add. She blushes even deeper.


"So what was your father's name?" You ask. She shook her head. "I don't know." She said. "He died when I was very young, so I don't have any memories of him. I never asked mom either. We always just called him Dad."


You nodded. "Anything else you want to see?" She asked.
1553322222211212111.title: Visions of the Past

1553322222211212112.content:
"Not now." You say. "Actually, I wanted to spend the day with you. Your mother actually suggested it." Kasmir smiles. "Okay! How about we head to the shore? I always love it there." You agree, and you both head out.


When you exit the palace, four servants come up, carrying Kasmir's mobile bed. "Not today boys." She says. "I fell like walking this time." She dismisses and you both continue on your way.


As you make your way through the market, you become lost. Being half the size of the island's citizens, you can't see anything in front of you but legs. Kasmir picks your up and sits you on her shoulder. She puts her fingers in her mouth and gives a loud whistle. The crowd instantly clears a path, that she calmly walks through, with you sitting on her shoulder like a parrot.


You both leave the city, and enter the jungle. As Kasmir walks through the brush, you pass a group of anthros cutting down trees and lashing them together, another was tying cloth around sticks, making a sail.


"That must be my boat." You say. Kasmir nods. "It looks like they're almost done too. Which means soon, we'll be together forever." She almost seems to skip as she says this. "Speaking of which, how exactly do you plan to smuggle yourself off the island with me?" You ask.


Kasmir smiles. "Oh, you'll just have to wait and see." She says playfully. You both exit the jungle, coming out on to a white sandy beach. Kasmir picks you up off her shoulder and places you on the ground. The warm sand feels so inviting on your bare feet. You turn around to see Kasmir pulling her gown over her head. She wore nothing underneath.


Even though you had seen everything already, you still turn the other way to give her some privacy. Kasmir smiles. "Oh, come now. You don't need to do that. After all, you'll be seeing me like this a lot when we're back in your world." She turns you around, and you find yourself staring at her shapely body.


She smirks. "Like what you see." You nod. "Yeah.....uh......very nice." Kasmir giggles. "Really? How's this?" She begins posing seductively, swaying her hips and sticking out her tongue cutely. You face turn a bright red.


Kasmir laughs. "Come on, let's go!" She starts heading toward the water, you follow. She sits on the edge of the beach, allowing the waves to wash back and forth over her legs. You sit next to her and lay back in the sand, enjoying the heat.


After a while, you decide to play around with Kasmir a bit. You get up and go over to her thigh. "What are you doing?" She asks. You don't answer. Instead you begin massaging her leg. She lets out a mewl of surprise and begins purring. You move up to her belly and begin scratching vigorously.


She lets out a loud yowl of pleasure, and lays back in the sand, letting you continue. As you keep scratching her midriff, she continues yowling, her tongue loling from her mouth, as she pants and purrs. Finally, you stop.


"That was fantastic!" She says, sitting back up. "Glad you liked it." You say, resting your now sore arms. "When I'm back home, I can do that all the time." Kasmir lays down next to you, and begins nuzzling and licking you affectionately. "Can't wait for it." She says. You give her a kiss on the lips.


She pulls her head back, surprised. "What was that?" She asked. "A kiss." You say. "It's how humans show they love each other." Kasmir smirks and kisses you on the head. "I love you too."


You both lay there, locked in another kiss for a good ten minutes before you break it.
1553322222211212112.title: Beach Time!

15533222222112121121.content:
You and Kasmir stayed at the beach until nightfall. You were sitting on the beach next to Kasmir, looking up at the stars. You had gathered some wood piled it in front of you, while Kasmir lit it with a snap of her fingers, the orange flames dancing in front of you both.


"Aren't they beautiful?" Asked Kasmir as she gazed at the stars. "Oh yes, very." You say. "But I've seen prettier." Kasmir looks down at you. "Like what?"


"You." You say.


Kasmir giggles and pets your head. "You're so sweet. That's why I love you." Just then, your stomach growls. "Hungry?" Kasmir asks. "Kind of." You say. I haven't eaten since breakfast." Kasmir smiles. "Well then, I'll get us some dinner." She snaps her fingers, and two large salmon fly out of the sea, into her arms.


"Wow." you say. "You put the Gortan's Fisherman to shame." "Who?" Asks Kasmir. "Never mind." Kasmir nimbly guts, bones and skins the fish with her claws, and soon you're both roasting them on sticks over the fire. "Where did you learn to do that?" You ask.


"I used to catch fish a lot." Says Kasmir. "I am feline after all. I once caught one as long as my arm!" Yeah, right." You say, not believing her. "It's true!" She says. "Ask my mom! She saw it! Of course, she was normal sized then."


For the next hour or so, you both sit there, eating your fish and just talking. "So, did you ever love anyone before me?" Asks Kasmir. "Why?" You ask. "Just curious."


You sigh. "I thought I did. Didn't turn out so well." "Want to tell me about it?" She asks. "No." You say. "I can't. It's too painful." Kasmir stared at you for a minute, not saying anything, until........


"Her name was Jessica." She says. "You had known her since childhood. You went to school together, played together, and shared your first kiss together. You started dating at 16, then found out she was only using you to get another guy jealous, and it worked. That other guy gave you a black eye, and since then you've never trusted another woman."


You stare at her with your mouth open, dumbfounded. "How did you!?" She grinned. "Magic, remember? I can read minds too." "Man, I can keep anything from you, can I?" You say.


"Nope." She says, chuckling.


"So, what made you decide to talk to me when we met if you don't trust females?" She asks. "Well, I guess because you're not human." You say. She looks at you confused. "What does that have to do with it?"


"Well, I've always related to animals better than people." You say. "I used to have a cat for company at home. He was all the company I needed. I would sometimes even talk to him. When he died, I felt like I had lost my only friend, which I had."


"So, all your life your only real friends have been your pets?" Asks Kasmir. "Yeah, I guess." You say. "Kasmir smiles. "Some of your people might call that pathetic, but I think it's sweet." "You smirk. "Yeah, well, I don't care what other people think."


"Except me, right?" Asks Kasmir. "Of course." You say. Kasmir looks up at the moon. "Oh! We better head back now, it's getting late." She slips her clothes back on and places you on her shoulder, striding through the jungle. The cool night air relaxes you, could could fall asleep right here.


When you get back to the palace, you are greeted by Zig Zag. "Good news!" She says. "Your boat is finished! We can send you back home tomorrow." You pretend to be disappointed. "That's too bad." You say. "I was really enjoying it here."


Zig Zag smiles kindly. "Don't worry." She says. "When I erase your memories of this place, I'll replace them with happy ones. I promise." "Mom." Says Kasmir. "Since the is the last time I'll see him, can he share my bed with me?"


"That depends." Says Zig Zag suspiciously. "You don't plan on doing what I think you are, do you?" "No! Of course not!" Says Kasmir indignantly. "Can't you even trust your own daughter?"


"Alright." Says Zig Zag. "But he better not be covered with claw marks in the morning like the last one." Kasmir carries you to her room and locks the door, setting you on the bed. "Just think!" She says as she slides her gown off and crawl in next to you. "Tomorrow, we can be together forever."


"But won't your mother notice you are gone?" You ask. "Well, by then it will be too late." She says. "I'll be long gone. She'll miss me, sure, but she's more than capable of having another daughter to replace me. I'm willing to give up my kingdom, all for you."


She pulls you over to her, wrapping her arm and tail around you. "Besides, You're worth more than any kingdom." She kisses your forehead, and purrs as you stroke her back. "Goodnight, my love." You say. "Goodnight, my prince." She says as you both fall asleep.
15533222222112121121.title: Continue at the beach

155332222221121211211.content:
It was finally here. The day when you leave this island, and have your mind wiped. Whatever Kasmir has planned, it had better be good. You were at the table with Zig Zag, eating breakfast, when she said. " Well, it's time. You might want to say good bye to Kasmir. I know she still has a thing for you, and she'd be heartbroken if you didn't at least say goodbye."


"Good idea." You say. Zig Zag places you on the floor and you make your way to Kasmir's room. You knock on her door. "Who is it?" She calls. "It's me." You say. "Come in."


You open the door, the stands Kasmir holding something beghind her back. "Alright, Kasmir." You say. "It's time for me to leave. So If you have a plan, tell me it now." Kasmir pulls out two vials from behind her.


"These right here are my plan." She says smiling deviously. "What are they?" You ask. " They're potions. "This one....." She indicated the blue vial. "Will allow me to change myself at will, from my normal form into that of those cats your kind keeps as pets. This way, people won't discover what I really am."


"But what about, your.......you know, fur?" You ask. "You can tell anyone who asks that I'm a new breed of cat, and that you recently took me in." She indicated the clear potion. "This one, is what will allow me to leave with you. It will let me control my size so I can shrink to a small enough size that you can fit me in your pocket. Mom will be none the wiser!"


"That's your plan, then?" You ask. "Yep." She says. "It's simple, yet foolproof! Here it goes." She down both potions, and pauses. Soon, her clothes begin looking like they are a bit large for her, then, way too big. Her entire body gets smaller and smaller, until she is swallowed by her clothes.


Her clothes lay in a pile on the floor. You pick them up, and there stands a miniature Kasmir, completely naked. You close your eyes as you pick her up, wanting to give her some privacy. "Oh come now." She says. "You've already seen it, there's no need block yourself."


You look back at her. She was now no bigger than a lego figure, making her look kind of cute. "Wait, what about wiping my memory? I won't remember the plan, or you even." You say, just realizing that.


"Don't worry." Says Kasmir. "I'll take care of that, but we should get going." You nod, slipping Kasmir into your pocket. You head back out into the throne room, where Zig Zag is waiting. "How did it go?" She asks. "She'll be okay." you say. "She dosen't want to watch me off, she can't take the sight of it. She's still crying, but she'll get over it."


"I know she will." Says Zig Zag. "I know just how she feels, I've seen many loves come and go. Now, let's get going." She picks you up and places you in her palm. As she leaves the palace, what seems like the whole Island follows her to the beach. There on the sand is a large log raft with a single sail in the center.


Zig Zag picks up the boat with her other hand and walks out into the ocean, while the crowd watches from the shore. When the water is up to her waist, she places you on the raft and gently sets it in the water.


"Well, little one." She says. "This is where we bid each other goodbye. I wish you a safe journey." You nod. "Thank you for everything. Hug Kasmir for me will you?" You say.


Zig Zag Smiles. "I will. Now, you know what I must do." She touches you on the forhead with her finger. There is a blue spark as she touches you, and you fall unconscious on the raft. Zig Zag gives you a gentle push, sending you on your way. "Farewell, little one." A single tear rolls down her face and splashes in the ocean.


You open your eyes. You're laying on a raft in the middle of the ocean, the sun shining down on you, tanning your skin. "Must have dozed off." You say to yourself. You begin to remember how you got here. You had been shipwrecked in a storm and ended up washed up on an island.


For a time, it was kind of fun, having an entire island to yourself. But soon you got bored and lonely, and were able to construct a raft out of fallen logs, you couldn't remember where you got the sail from. You feel something squirming in your pocket. "What the?"


You reach into your pocket and are surprised at what you find. there in your palm, is a tiny cat creature, with black fur and white stripes. "Miss me?" The strange creature asks. "What are you?" You ask, dumbfounded. "Bring me closer and I'll tell you."


You held the tiny creature up to your face. Suddenly, kisses you on the lips. Everything comes flooding back at that instant. The Island. Zig Zag. Kasmir.


Kasmir................


Kasmir begins growing back to her normal height, amused at the shocked look on your face. But, at her full height, the raft is too small for her, so she shrinks down to your size. You remember everything, including her plan. "Kasmir. Now I remember." She smiles, showing her gleaming white fangs. "I told you it would work. Now, you're all mine."


She crawl over and kneels over you, forcing her lips into yours. You kiss back, wrestling with her tongue. You had no Idea how long it would take to get home, but as long as you were with Kasmir, it didn't matter.
155332222221121211211.title: The Big Day

1553322222211212112111.content:
You don't know exactly how long you and Kasmir were adrift. You didn't really care. You had plenty to eat, with Kasmir summoning fish to fly from the sea onto the raft, then changing them into whatever you wanted with her magic. She would turn the sea water into whatever you wanted to drink as well. You sort of hoped you never got back to land, if it meant you could just be at sea with Kasmir, forever.


To pass the time, you and Kasmir would just chat with each other. "So, what are we going to do when we get back to your home?" Kasmir asks you. "The first thing I'm going to do...." You say. "Is go to the pet shop. I need to get a few things if you're going to be my pet."


Kasmir scowled. "I am not a pet! I am your mate. We only want to people to think I'm your pet, when really, I'm anything but." You laugh. "Really? Then if you're not my pet, you wouldn't like it when I do this."


You reached up and scratched Kasmir behind the ears. You could see her resisting the urge to purr. You scratched vigorously, until finally she gave in.


"Alright, maybe I am your pet.........but only in my normal cat form."


You chuckled, and began scratching her back. Kasmir purred loudly and laid out across your lap as you scratched her. “I love you.” You say to her.


She leans up and licks your cheek. “I love you too.” Suddenly, she does something unexpected. She bites you semi-hard on the neck.


“Ow!” You cry, startled by the sudden pain, jumping back and covering the spot she bit with your hand. “What was that for?!” You say, suddenly angry. “What?” Says Kasmir. “It was only a love bite.”


“Well, next time, warn me.” You feel a trickle of blood running down your neck. Kasmir’s eyes widen at the scent of blood. “Oh no! Did I hurt you?” She says, suddenly worried. “I’m fine.” You say, wiping the blood away.


In the distance, you can see a land forming on the horizon. “We’re home!” You say, suddenly forgetting about the bite. You turn to Kasmir. “You better change into a normal cat awhile. Don’t want anyone spotting you.”


Kasmir nods and begins to change. Her body shrinks down to the size of a mailbox. Her white her seems to retract back into her scalp. Her arms and legs become that of a housecat’s, with her hands and feet becoming paws. There she sits, a tabby cat with black, white striped cat with a white belly and head, with her muzzle and the bridge of her nose being black.


She gives off a little mew as she jumps into your arms. You hold her close to you as you sail ever closer to land. You come ashore on an empty beach, which was lucky, because you wouldn’t have to answer any awkward questions.


Even luckier, you landed in Miami, which is exactly where you live. You step off the raft, Kasmir in your arms and make your way up the beach. When you turn around, the raft is nowhere in sight.


You know the neighborhood well, and have no problem finding your apartment building. You open the door with your key, (yes, you still had your house key this whole time) and step inside. Kasmir leaps from your arms onto the sofa, and changes back into anthro form.


“So, this is how humans live?” She asks, spreading out on the couch and yawning. “Well, it’s how I live at least.” You say, as you move about closing all the blinds and curtains, so that no one who happened to be looking through the window would see Kasmir.


“Now, I’m going to the store, you stay here, don’t answer the door, and stay away from the windows, and just watch TV.” You say handing her the remote. “Okay, daddy.” Kasmir says jokingly as she flips through the channels.


You head to the pet shop and buy a cat carrier, a scratching post, litterbox, and whatever else you would need. The cashier smiles at you. “Taking in a kitty?” She asks. “You could say that.” You say. You load everything into your car and head back to your apartment.


When you come in the door, Kasmir is watching a some anime show. “Are all TV shows this weird?” She asks. “Only the ones that are produced in Japan.” You reply as you put your purchases away.


You decided to order pizza for dinner. Kasmir had never had any before and was curious to try it. You ordered a large with half anchovies and half sausage. Kasmir found that she loved it, particularly the little fishes.


That night, Kasmir curled up in bed with you in her cat form, to give you so you both would have more room. She purred all night as you stroked her, until she finally fell asleep.


Option 1: That bite Kasmir gave you earlier seems to be having strange affects on you. Somehow, you are slowly becoming an anthro cat yourself. Including fur, claws, and a taste for fish. Good luck explaining that to the neighbors!


Option 2: For a few weeks all goes well for you and Kasmir. But you have been seeing a lot of animals that you wouldn’t normally see around here. Unknown to you, they are in fact anthros from the island in normal form. Zig Zag was very angry with her daughter abandoning them like that, and has sent them to get her back.
1553322222211212112111.title: Home Sweet Home

15533222222112121121111.content:
The next morning you felt different. You couldn't put your finger on it but something was different about your body you could just feel it. But you brushed it off assuming that it was just from Kasmir sleeping with you. So you went to your bathroom to brush your hair before Kasmir got up, and that's when you noticed what was different. YOU HAD A TAIL! You looked at it in amazement, then confusion, and finally you panicked not knowing what to do. You yelled for Kasmir to come in the bathroom and you heard her get up and start to walk to the bathroom.

"So you want to talk a bath this early in the day? Well thats fine with me." Kasmir says walking into the bathroom without even noticing your new tail.

"Kasmir what did you do to me?" You ask her. She is confused by the question and then looks at you and see's the tail behind you.

"Is that a...?" Kasmir trys to say the full sentence but fails to, but you answer her question anyway.

"Yup it is a tail. Now answer my question, did you do something to me?" You ask her this again and then you see guilt all over her face.

"Well... When I gave you that " love bite" my saliva might have gotten into the cut. I think that since some of my DNA got into you, that its trying to fix anything it thinks is wrong, and it must think that something is wrong since it gave you a tail..." Kasmir says this all rather quickly and you could just barley keep up with what she said.

"So let me get this straight... I'm going to turn into an Anthro like you?" You ask.

"Yes I'm not sure how long it will take though." Says this with a faint smile like she was enjoying this.

"Well how am I going to explain this to the neighbors?" You ask Kasmir when just then their is a nock at the door. You jump at first and then you panic, and so does Kasmir.

"Who is it?" You yell just to see if it was someone who you knew. Then a voice answered back.
15533222222112121121111.title: What now?

15533222222112121121112.content:
It’s been several weeks since Kasmir moved in with you. She’s learned quite a bit about the human world. You taught her how to use the computer and stove so she could feed and entertain herself while you were at work. One time she had gone on Google and typed in her mother’s name to see what would come up. To her surprise, there were several pictures of her. You never told her about how humans knew about Zig Zag.


“How can this be?” She said. “And are all humans this perverted?” You chuckled. “I forgot to tell you that here, Zig Zag is a fictional character. As to the second question, only most of the males.”


As a feline, Kasmir was naturally curious about many things, a trait of hers that tended to get her into trouble. Like when she found the six-pack you keep in your fridge while you were away. When you came home, you found her passed out on the floor, she only drank one can. Kasmir’s body clearly couldn’t handle alcohol. She was too used to the wine the amazons drank, which was non-alcoholic. When she woke up, she had a very painful headache, and even the slightest noise was like a thunderclap to her. You laid her out on the sofa with an icepack on her forehead.


She spent the whole day there, groaning in pain. After that, she never drank anything but water. You also taught her how to play video games. It turns out she was very good at them, as she would always whip your ass at Super Smash Bros.


She also seemed to like human music, particularly Ozzy Osbourne, Kid Rock, Metallica, and Voltaire. Kasmir soon became bored with being stuck in the house all day, and wanted to go outside. You had refused at first, but gave in after Kasmir licked and nuzzled you for several minutes.


You had bought her a collar and leash. At first she had refused to wear it, but you were firm with her, saying that if she didn’t put it on, she wasn’t going anywhere. With a sigh of frustration, she reverted to her cat form, and allowed you to clip the collar around her neck.


You led her around town, with everybody you passed staring at Kasmir and her unusual fur pattern. Some of them even approached you and asked where you got her. You told them that your parents work at an animal shelter and that they bred Kasmir themselves, that they named her “Kriss-Kross“, and gave her to you as a gift. You let them stroke Kasmir and scratch her ears. Kasmir certainly seemed to be enjoying all the attention, purring up a storm.


It had been sunset when you took Kasmir for a walk, so it was dark by the time you got back to your apartment. As you approached the front door, you saw a fox and a skunk rummaging through the garbage cans near the entrance, that they had knocked over. They turn and stare in your direction for a moment before running off.


“Odd.” You think to yourself. “Since when were there skunks and foxes around Miami?” You put the thought out of your head and head into the building, Kasmir at your side. After you get to your apartment and close the door, Kasmir changes into her anthro form.


“Well!” She says. “That was certainly fun!” You smile. “You just liked all the extra attention.” Kasmir smiles back. “Is that so wrong? By the way, I liked the explanation you gave those people about me. How did you come up with the name “Kriss-Kross”?

“Well,” You say. “Your mother is called “Zig Zag” for her fur pattern, so I did the same for you. Since you two have striped fur, I came up with Kriss-Kross to counteract with Zig Zag.”


Kasmir nods. “Very clever.” She scratches at her neck. “Can you take this accursed collar off now? It itches!” You take off her collar and she licks you in thanks. She yawns, showing her white fangs. “I think it’s time for bed.” You say. Kasmir nods, reverting to her cat from again.


You walk towards your bedroom, Kasmir following briskly at your heels. You don’t bother to change into pajamas, and just lay down on your bed. Kasmir leaps up onto the bed and curls up on your chest. You stroke her as she softly purrs to sleep. A few hours later, you are woken by the sound of voices coming from your living room. “


“Are you ssssssssure thisssssss isssssss where they are?”


“Absolutely. We saw them here earlier.”


“She must be here. Who else could it be?”


“What of the boy? What shall we do with him?”


You carefully lift Kasmir off your chest and lay her on your pillow. You reach under your bed and grab the shotgun you store there for emergencies. You slowly step into the living room. You aim the shotgun in front of you and feel for the light switch. As you do, the voices continue.


“I say we take him with us. He should be punished as well.”


“What if he didn’t know she was with him?”


“How could he have not?”


You finally find the switch and flick it on. When the lights activate, you are stunned by what you see. Standing in your living room in a circle, is four amazons! A snake, a skunk, a fox, and a wolf, all dressed in leather bras and skirts, except the snake who had no legs, only a long serpent tail. They each held various weapons. Spears, knives, arrows, etc.


Before you could react, the fox raised a blowgun to her lips and fired a small black thorn, which struck you in the neck. You felt a sudden sting of pain, then everything went black.


When you awoke, your hands and feet were tied behind your back. You lay on your side on the floor, the four intruders gathered in front of you. You noticed much of your furniture had been overturned as you heard yowling and hissing noises coming from the cat carrier the fox was holding at her side. They had captured Kasmir.
“Empress Zig Zag was furious when she discovered Kasmir was gone.” Said the skunk looking down at you. “She sent us to bring her back home. We’ve been looking across this strange land for weeks. You have no idea what a chase she put up after we knocked you out.” “How did you find us?” You ask, confused.


The skunk smirked. “You saw us yourselves picking through your garbage.” You couldn’t believe it. “That was you? But how-” “We were given potions that allow us to change our form at will.” The fox cuts you off. “After we saw you enter here, we knew this was where you were hiding the princess. It was just a matter of following your scent to the right door.”


“You will sssssssurely be punissssssshed for kidnapping the princessssssss.” Hisses the snake. Suddenly, the cat carrier in the vixen’s hand explodes, sending shrapnel everywhere, as Kasmir changes back into her full anthro form. The other amazons duck and shield themselves as the bits of plastic fly in every direction.


“He did not kidnap me!” Says Kasmir angrily. “I wanted him to bring me with him. I loved him, and would rather give up my position as heir to the throne and be with him, than never see him again. As your princess, I order you to go home and tell my mother I am staying here, and that‘s final!” The amazons stand back up, and the wolf approaches Kasmir. “Your highness, our orders are to bring you back to Anthronia. The queen’s orders are above yours, so you must come with us.”


“No!” Says Kasmir. “I am not going anywhere. This is my decision, my love, and my home. No one, can make me leave!” The snake grabs your head and tilts it back, exposing your throat. “Come with ussssssss or I ssssssshall bite him!”


“Wait!” Says Kasmir, raising one hand in alarm. “We are sorry princess.” Says the skunk. “But if this is the only way to get you to come with us, then so be it.” Kasmir’s eyes dart from you to the snake, who hovers over you, fangs exposed, dripping venom onto your face. You close your eyes, lest the burning poison blind you.


Kasmir hesitates. She could easily dispatch these amazons with her magic skills, but could she do it faster than this snake can bite?
15533222222112121121112.title: Unwelcome Guests

155332222221121211211121.content:
Kasmir knows she can't save you in time if she trys to fight. So she surrenders, but she trys to negotiate a deal.

"How about you guys get my mother and bring her hear and we can talk about this." Kasmir asks, but the the door of your apartment opens and in comes Zig Zag with anger on her face as far as you could tell.

"I told you to forget about him, to leave him alone and you go behind my back and leave with him!" Zig Zag says with complete anger in her voice.

"Mom I love him and nothing you do will change that." Kasmir says nearly crying.

"I don't care if you love him you can't stay here and he can't come with us, so he stays and you go." Says Zig Zag.

They argue for hours and hours until finally Zig Zag has had enough. She orders one of her guards to use the blow dart again and the fox does. She hits you and Kasmir and make you both pass out. You wake up an hour later and see that their all gone. You start to cry and start cursing and pleading for Kasmir to come back.
155332222221121211211121.title: Depression

1553322222211212112111212.content:
A week goes by and you had become very depressed. You stayed in your room sobbing over losing Kasmir, until one day you finally snap. You couldn't take it anymore. You say a short prayer and go grab your shotgun and load it with one round. You then put the barrel of the gun just underneath your head. Then as your about to pull the trigger the gun gets yanked from your hands, leaving you clueless to what just happened. You look to your left and see an Anthro fox holding your shotgun in one hand and a spear in the other.

"What were you doing?" She asks with a caring voice.

"I couldn't take it anymore... A life without Kasmir... Is a life not worth living..." You say this with a very shaky voice. You then start to cry.

"So you were going to kill yourself?" The fox asks.

"If it ment I could watch Kasmir from Heaven or Hell... Then yes... I was going to kill myself." You say this and get up. You look at the fox and try to grab your gun from her but she just throws it into your living room and blocks the door.

"I was sent her by Kasmir to make sure that you were alright... But it seems you are emotionally crippled... I will go to the queen and tell her what has happened here and I will try to get her to change her mind. Now if you don't mind try not to kill yourself until I come back with the news." She smiles at you and then leaves. You look at the shotgun on the ground and grab it. You then unload it and put it under your bed.

A few days go by and still now word from the fox that stopped you from suicide. Then you heard something at your door. It sounded like an animal scratching a tree or something like that. You then realized that it was the fox out their trying to get your attention. You quickly opened the door and to your suprize their was to animals standing at your door. A fox and a black and white striped skunk. You knew immediately that it was Zig Zag. You let them both in and they change into their normal forms, except Zig Zag who only grew to human height. They both stared at you for about a minute until Zig Zag spoke to you.

"I was told that you tryed to kill yourself just to see my daughter in your afterlife. Is this true?"

"Yes it is Zig Zag. All I can think about is your daughter. She has my heart and I have hers and no one can change that." You say sternly to Zig Zag.

"Well then... I think we can do something to help ease your suffering." Zig Zag smiles and then she starts to walk towards you. You start to run for the door thinking that she was going to erase your memory once again.

"Now now theirs no need to run. I am not going to hurt you." Says Zig Zag. You stop when she says this and you turn to say something.

"What are you going to do then?" You ask nervously.

All Zig Zag says is "You'll see." And then it all goes blank.

About an hour later you wake up to see Kasmir's face. You try to speak to her but you can't even make a sound. So you decide to rub her cheek. She feels you doing this and then looks at you with a smile on her face.

"Alex I missed you so much." She says hugging you.

Once again you try to push out some words and this time they come out.

"I missed you to Kasmir." You say faintly. She smiles and kisses you. You smile at her and say.

"Kasmir I'm sorry..." You say.

"Why are you sorry?" She asks you.

"I tryed to kill myself a few days ago... I just couldn't take it anymore... Not seeing you was killing me from the inside... I'm sorry." To your suprize Kasmir just kissed you and said that she would be back in a few minutes. She then returned with some fruit. You ate some of it and then you slowly feel asleep. Hours later you were awoken by hundreds of Amazon's screaming and cheering. As far as you could tell you were in some gladiator arena. Then it hit you. You were going to fight someone. You look around and see Zig Zag sitting in a thrown with Kasmir crying next to her. That's when you hear some yell from behind you.

"YOUR GOING TO DIE HUMAN!" You look be hind you to see a wolf boy running at you. He swings his sword at you and you just duck under it and start to run. While your running you notice your shotgun on the ground to your right. You then think to yourself 'How the hell did that get here!?' But you put that thought aside and ran for your shotgun. You grab it and turn around to see the wolf running at you again. You quickly check the gun to see if its loaded and it is surprisingly. You point it at the wolf.

"STOP DON'T MAKE ME SHOOT YOU!" You yell but the wolf didn't stop. You yell at him again saying "STOP OR I WILL SHOOT!" but again he doesn't stop. Then it hits you, he won't stop till one of us is dead. You then pull the trigger and hit the wolf dead in the chest and he fly's back about 10 feet. You slowly walk towards him and see first hand what you did. The wolf is in severe pain and he needs medical attention immediately. You try to stop the bleeding but its no use. You look him in the eyes and say. "I'm sorry..." And then walk away. The crowd was silent. You look at you shotgun that's in your hands and throw it to the ground and walk away from it. The crowd then started to cheer and throw roses at you. This confused you. 'Why are they happy?' You thought to yourself. Then you hear Zig Zag start to speak.

"Congratulations Alex, you have survived the first round of the contest." Says Zig Zag.

"What contest?" You ask.

"The contest for..."
1553322222211212112111212.title: What just happened?

choices: Skip to the visit to Anthronia.
155332222221121211211122.content:
Just then, Kasmir figured out what to do. She happened to know a spell that could freeze time just long enough to get you out from under those venomous fangs. She'd need to buy some time, though.

You looked at Kasmir this whole time, wondering what she was gonna do. You see her drop to her knees, seemingly in defeat, but then you see her mouth moving. You couldn't read lips, so it was impossible for you to figure it out.

"What is she doing?" the skunk said.

All of a sudden, everything except you and Kasmir became frozen in time. She rushes over to you, pulls you out of the frozen, snake's grip, and unties you. She then has you hide in your bathroom before she releases the spell. Once that happened, the guards were dumbfounded. To them, It looked like Kasmir just instantly hid you.

"I want to talk to my mother alone, face to face, right here, or else I'm not going anywhere." she said sternly.

Just then the front door to the apartment opened, and in walk a skunk with a zig zag fur pattern. It then grew into Kasmir's mother, ZigZag.

"The three of you are dismissed." she says to the guards, and they promptly leave the apartment.

Kasmir then calls you out into the living room. She felt that you needed to hear the conversation that was bout to go down.

Once you were in the room, ZigZag proceeded to reprimand her daughter.

"Young lady, you deliberately disobeyed me." she started off. "I told you that you had to let him go, no matter how much you loved him."

"Mom, I'm twenty years old! I'm a grown woman and I can make my own decisions!" Kasmir exclaimed. "Why can't you let us be happy? Is that too much to ask?"

"I can sympathize with you, sweetheart, but according to tradition-"

"Screw the tradition!" Kasmir yelled, catching you and ZigZag off guard. "I am so sick of hearing about how my life is controlled by traditions!"

"I am your mother and I know what's best for you." ZigZag said, trying to keep her daughter under control.

"No, you just think you do." Kasmir snaps back. "You don't know what's best for me, you only know what's best for you and the kingdom!"

"But it's your kingdom, because you're going to be queen someday." ZigZag said.

This set Kasmir over the edge. "Well maybe I don't want to be queen! Maybe I never did! MAYBE I JUST WANTED TO BE A NORMAL GIRL!!!"

Both you and ZigZag were shocked at those words. You thought to yourself: 'Now we're getting to the root of the problem.'

Kasmir was now on her knees, head in her hands, sobbing her eyes out. You quickly went to her side to comfort her, and she embraces you tightly.

The sight was too much for her mother to bear. ZigZag started to wonder if upholding tradition was worth her daughter's well being. She sighed. "Is this really what you want?"

Kasmir calms down a little. "More than anything." she answered.

Okay, I think I can have a new heiress to the throne. If you two promise to visit Anthronia at least once a week, you can stay here.

Kasmir's eyes lit up. "Really?"

"Really," ZigZag said.

"Wait, how are we supposed to visit Anthronia every week when it's so far away?" you ask.

ZigZag snaps her fingers and a scroll appears. "You can use these teleportation spells." she says.

"Thank you so much, Mother!" Kasmir says with joy.

"You're welcome." ZigZag says, before leaving.
155332222221121211211122.title: The Art of Deception

1553322222211212112111222.content:
It's now been a whole year since Kasmir moved in with you. This was, by far, the happiest year of your life. The two of you kept your promise to visit Anthronia every week. And ZigZag was more than happy to see you every time. Over the course of this year, Kasmir has now gotten fully used to the human lifestyle. She's even gotten used to keeping herself at average human height. The most amazing day of this year was when Kasmir learned a spell that allowed her transform into a human at will. This allowed you two to go on real dates instead of staying at home. It also allowed you new girlfriend to shop for her own clothes. Kasmir decided to call herself Katherine when she was in her human form, in order to fit in more.

Today was the day the two of you were to pay another visit to Anthronia, when you were surprised by a visitor. The doorbell rings, and you answer it, and in walks a skunk.

"Hi, mom!" Kasmir says.

The skunk transforms into queen ZigZag. "Hi, you two! I decided to pay you guys a visit for a change." she said.

"Well this is a pleasant surprise." you say.

"Well, why don't we go out on the town?" she says. "I would just love to learn about human life."

"Wait." Kasmir said. "Does that mean you learned the trans-species transformation spell?"

"That's right." ZigZag says with a smile.

So the three of you go out to the city, deciding to call ZigZag "Zoey" in her human form. Later that evening, ZigZag, or rather, Zoey, has something to say.

"Now, you two," she says "There's a reason why I wanted to visit you guys today. I have an important announcement."

"What is it?" the two of you say simultaneously.
1553322222211212112111222.title: One Year Later...

15533222222112121121112222.content:
ZigZag has a smile on her face. "Well, you know that I need a new successor since Kasmir is living here, right?"

"Yeah..." you and Kasmir say simultaneously. Neither of you has any idea where this was going.

"And you know that I've been feeling under the weather during your last few visits," she continues.

You think for a moment. ZigZag was right. For the past month, ZigZag has been ill.

"Well, I took Kasmir's advice and went to the doctor, and... it's official."

"What's official?" Kasmir asks.

"I'm pregnant!" ZigZag says with delight.

You and Kasmir look at each other, your mouths gaping open. Then Kasmir composes herself and says "Wait a second. You never even mentioned having a mate to perform the mating ritual with yet."

"Well, I wanted to wait until the time was right." her mother says. Kasmir doesn't say another word. Instead, she just leans back in her chair and rubs her temples, still in disbelief of what she just heard. "I don't see why you're so shocked." ZigZag says to her daughter. "I'm sure you and your boyfriend have mated several times already."

You and Kasmir blush. In actuality, the two of you haven't had sex yet, but it was best not to bring that up.

"So when do we get to meet the father?" you ask, trying to change the subject.

"Next week." ZigZag says. "You guys are going to love him."

By the time the conversation ended, you were already home. ZigZag says goodbye and you and Kasmir settle down in the house as she changes back into her anthro form.

"Well, it's great that your mom found a guy that she's happy with, right?" you ask

Kasmir looks at you and the look on her face says it all.
15533222222112121121112222.title: You're WHAT!?

155332222221121211211122222.content:
Kasmir's face made it clear that she was not happy with the situation at all.

"Oh jeez," you think to yourself.

"How could she have kept this a secret from me?" Kasmir asks more to herself than you.

"Calm down, Kasmir." you say.

"How am I supposed to calm down? Who knows how long she's been with this man? Why would she do this?"

"To be fair, we kept our relationship a secret from her."

"That's different. I wanted a secret relationship because I knew that mother wouldn't approve of it at the time."
